Name: J V
Review: Got a note on our front door Friday…Got a note on our front door Friday morning regarding a "Attempted delivery -receiver unavailable" from Purolator while my wife was at home.  My wife told me she did not hear any door bell at all.  This is the second time it happened while there is somebody at home.  Package is pretty heavy so I do I believed that the delivery guy was just lazy enough to carry the package that's why he just left the note.Date of experience: July 09, 2018

Name: Walo Waffles
Review: Don't use this service ever IT HAS 94% ONE STARS FOR A REASONI ordered a keyboard and the first time around I didn't give them the buzzer code because I expected them to call my number so I can come down and get the package myself. They didn't call so I never got the package which is customary for any GOOD delivering service. I called Amazon and told them to contact Purolator to tell them the buzzer code and to REMIND them to contact my phone number on arrival. Today was the day it was supposed to come, they used the buzzer but I didn't get a phone call OR hear a knock. Purolator will respond by telling you to contact them on email when writing a bad review. I didn't email BUT I CALLED and they still didn't get it right. Whatever you do do not use this half assd delivery service.Date of experience: July 09, 2018

Name: Farshad
Review: Worst shipping company ever!Worst shipping company ever!Happened to me a lot that I ordered something on place and it was supposed to be delivered by Purolator, I never got it. Be careful! They never knock on the door, call super or push buzzer. They just leave.Today I took a day off to get my TV from Bestbuy and unfortunately Purolator did not deliver it, returned it to a freaking site in Scarborough due to some stupid reasons.I will always make sure that the online orders are NOT working with Purolator.Date of experience: July 09, 2018

Name: Ada
Review: PUROLATOR SUCKSMade arrangements to stay at home to receive the package today, tracked the package online to an obsessed level. First I get "Delayed to weather conditions" on a sunny summer day. Then I get "Attempted delivery failed due to labor disruption", whatever that means. I immediately called Purolator to hopefully get them to get the driver to turn around, but of course, my notification arrived 1 hour after the "attempt" and the offices are closed. For the fun of it, I pressed "2" to track my package, and now it says that receiver was unavailable, when I was at home the whole time and no one rang the bell. Frustrated, I went on live chat, to be made even angrier by the agent who knew nothing and could not answer my questions to save her life. I didn't even care if I had to pick up the package myself, yet she cannot even confirm that it can be done. I'll have to cross my fingers that the request will be accepted for me to pick up, apparently. I asked about the labor disruption piece to which she said there must be a strike in front of my home. I told her there is no such thing. I asked if it could be due to construction in front of my place, she said that must be it. The thing is, the construction does not obstruct my place. She said that another attempt will be made next business day. I said would this not be an issue if construction is there next business day, she said she does not know until next business day to see if there is still construction. I basically told her that I can guarantee that the construction will still be there, so does that mean that as long as there is construction, I will not get my package? She gave some irrelevant response that made me wonder if I was simply talking to a robot. But I now know that she is not a robot because when I asked for a transcript of the chat (to serve as confirmation that she submitted a request for me to arrange for pickup instead), she became defensive and snarky. At one point she even said "I will be a few more minutes as I keep having to reply to you". Who says that? You're basically telling your supervisor that you cannot multi task. After all this, I still don't know what will become of my package. She submitted the request, gave me a confirmation number and ended the chat without thank you, good bye or can I help you with anything else. I am completely disgusted and I will never order from any retailer that uses Purolator ever again.Date of experience: July 07, 2018

Name: Murrayb
Review: Not flexible and inefficientNot flexible and inefficient. Not customer focused. No weekend deliveries. Attempt only one delivery... and the list goes on.Date of experience: July 06, 2018

Review: POOR DELIVERY SERVICE COMPARE TO UPS…POOR DELIVERY SERVICE COMPARE TO UPS AND AMAZON DRIVER DID NOT LEAVE ANY DELIVERY NOTE AND MADE RECORD AS ATTEMPTED DELIVER TWICE.I WAS AT HOME WAITING FOR DELIVERY AND TRACKING THE PACKAGE ON LINE EVERY HOURI CALLED CUSTOMER SERVICE TO COMPLAINT AND NO IMMEDIATE ACTIONPOOR CUSTOMER SERVICEDate of experience: July 05, 2018

Name: YooJin SHIN
Review: PLEASE DON'T HAVE PARTNERSHIP WITH PUROLATOR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO LOSE CUSTOMERSPurolator is the WORST shipping company!I don't understand why Zara and some other companies are in partnership with purolator. The driver left notice card and the pickup agency was too far from my place. So I asked to change pickup location. And the agent told me I can pick it up on July 3rd. On July 3rd, I tracked the item on the website and it was updated but the item was NOT redirected. So I made a call again and the agent said as I asked redelivery on Friday it could not be redirected. (At this point, if requiring for changing pickup location is not available on Friday, the agent should let me know that when we talk on the phone. Also, according to their schedule, they work on Friday too. Why is it impossible? They just don't want to work) The parcel is for present so I couldn't delay anymore. So I said I am going to pick up at the first pickup location and no need to redirect. Then, the agent said she's going to leave a notice on the system. The next day, July 4th, before leaving I tracked the item on the website again to make sure my item is at the first pickup location. Then, I realized that it's redirected! She said she successfully left notice on the system but now it's at the other place! If I do not check before leaving, I would be on a fool's errand when extreme heat alert is issued. And such sh🤮tty experience is not the first time! I asked changing pickup location for 3 times  last time. Never redirected and was sent to the sender eventhough it was with in 5 holding business days!!!!Companies which have partnership with Purolator should seriously consider to change to other shipping companies like Canadapost if they do not want to lose customers!!!Not only for business but also for an individual, strongly recommend to use other shipping company !NEVER Purolator!Date of experience: July 05, 2018

Name: Sade A
Review: Worst customer experience I have ever…Worst customer experience I have ever had. If I could give them a negative star I would. I have take time off work on THREE separate occassions waiting for my package from purolator. Today is the third day in the row, and although on their website my package is "on vehicle for delivery", it is not 8:45pm and still no driver. Mind you their last drop is 8pm. I called their customer service and after waiting on hold for 30 minutes, the rep told me, "I dont have good new. I see the first scan, but not the second one. We can get a hold of the driver and we wont be able to get it out to you today/" Before I could express my frustration he hung up. If this is the kind of "service" you want, then purolator is the place to go.Date of experience: July 04, 2018

Review: it's pick up company they don't dispatchEven though package had complete address, Purolator didn't try to attempt and didn't leave any note at my building door. Name: Rory Anderson
Review: Purolator - The WORST Shipping Company in North AmericaThis is the 3rd package I have had delivered through Amazon by Purolator. Delivered is a subjective term. The first 2 were in Ontario, and the most recent one was in Edmonton Alberta. In 7 total delivery attempts, I have never received a package from Purolator. Every package I have had to drive myself to their location to pick it up.The most recent shipment was the icing on the cake though. Day #1 Purolator delivery driver sets shipment to "Attempted Delivery" even though he never showed up nor even drove past the house. Day #2 (the guaranteed delivery date) they put the package on the wrong truck. I call them very angry, receive no remedy and am told that "it would be here by Day #3 guaranteed". Well this one is my favourite - Day #3 comes and they PUT IT ON THE WRONG TRUCK AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I call them outraged, and receive no remedy other than it will be delivered 3 days later on Monday, or I can drive 60 min round trip to their location to pick it up at 10pm. The package arrived 60 HOURS ago and they are located 30 MINUTES from me and haven't been able to deliver this package in 3 DAYS. An absolute joke of a company, unprofessional, and disgusting customer service. DO NOT USE. I have filed a complaint with Amazon and the Better Business Bureau.Date of experience: June 22, 2018

Name: Blair
Review: Puralator wouldn't deliver my package…Puralator wouldn't deliver my package because they said it was a PO Box, which it isn't, and when I called to get it corrected they said it would be delivered today. I checked the status and they sent the package back to the retailer. Awful service all around and I know I'll get a canned response from them in a couple hours.Date of experience: June 22, 2018

Review: I would give them 0 stars if it was…I would give them 0 stars if it was available. Payed$ 53.75 for one document that was supposed to be delivered next day. 4 days later still waitingDate of experience: June 22, 2018

Name: Ian
Review: Do not use Purolator THEY ARE SH!TPurolator is the worst shipping company, I pay for next business day delivery and it comes 3 days later. I contact purolator and they said they tried to deliver the parcel every day but nobody was home to answer. Which was complete crap because I was by my front door waiting for my parcel every day. Do not use purolator, they'll wreck your parcel as well. Garbage company. Edit: Delayed for 4 days in a row now, customer service is absolutely useless and they continued to blame this on me. If you want horrible customer service and money down the drain choose this crap company! Purolator is a complete joke, such a joke of a Canadian company. This is a crap company who doesn't care for their customers. Do not use. They will screw you over and won't care. You'll get a crap computer reply to your complaint and the owners won't give AF! DO NOT USE! You are wasting your money and time!Date of experience: June 21, 2018

Name: Maria Elena Suarez Ramiro
Review: Bad delivery servicePurolator leaves the packages at the entrance of the buildings, or says he leaves them and does not.On the 18th they said that they had left my package at the entrance of the building where I live, on June 21 they said that they left it in front of my appartmen door. Contradiction. I live in a 3-story building, and the entrance is locked.I do not know if they themselves steal the packages and they say they deliver them.They offer a bad service. Unprofessional. If you are not at home, you risk losing your package. They do not make tentative deliveries or leave notes to pick them up somewhere else.I recommend to you not to use this bad mail service.----------------------------------------------------------------------Thanks Catherine for your answer, but I consider Purolator has to analyze what the drivers of the trucks does with the deliveries. Mine was left at the entrance of the building according to the tracking of my package, which contradicts your delivery policy.I still think that I will not choose you anymore, when a site says that I send through you I will withdraw my orderBefore I wrote to the email you sent me and the answer made me more angry, that's why I wrote here.Date of experience: June 21, 2018

Name: Jenn
Review: I am annoyed..I am annoyed... my boyfriend orders all the time from Amazon, and puralotor is always the delivery service... I am home on maternity leave, and every time puralotor delivers there is never a knock at my door... either they leave it on the porch or leave a delivery notice!!!! I want to say that is pure laziness... i am home why am i now having to go pick up these items!!! Today the puralotor delivery man was on his phone I saw him through the window as I am washing dishes.. and I go to walk to my door and he is pulling out.. thank goodness this time they left it and no notice!!!Date of experience: June 21, 2018

Name: Larry S. Hochman
Review: My gut said don't use PurolatorMy gut said don't use Purolator, but I did. I needed to get very important documents from Winnipeg to Calgary the next day by 10:30 am. So I paid the extra money only to have a so called mechanical delay which caused the documents to be delivered in 2 days. I asked for a refund and they said that mechanical delays are non refundable. I deal with companies all over the world and this is the worst customer service I have every come across. This is the last time I ever use this courier.Date of experience: June 20, 2018

Name: trustpiloter02
Review: Anything but PurolatorI ordered a package with Amazon last Wednesday, June 15. They shipped the order out the day after, using Purolator as the courier. The order was supposed to arrive on Friday, but Purolator could not deliver to my apartment, apparently unable to access the front code despite being provided with the buzzer code. This is completely untrue as our buzzer code is directly linked to my phone; I would have received a call if they actually attempted the buzzer code. I did not the receive the call. In addition, Amazon Logistics completed a delivery the day before, fully using the buzzer code. I complained to Amazon about them, who told me that they called Purolator and provided the instructions. We scheduled for the delivery to occur today, Tuesday June 16, the week after. Lo and behold, upon checking my tracking page, Purolator has once again been unable to access my apartment. Because they could not access the front door. Despite the buzzer code being specifically provided to them. Unless there's been an earthquake and the front door is filled in with bricks, that front door is available. Suffice to say, I am extremely disappointed as to how this whole situation played out. Purolator genuinely has been the worst company I've ever interacted with, and I've been interacted with many. As I once told the Amazon Rep regarding future carriers, "Anything but Purolator, I'd rather eat my own shoe". Please, for your own sakes, do not use Purolator. (Also, TrustPilot, as another reviewer said, please give us an option to give 0 stars. Some companies need them. )Date of experience: June 19, 2018

Name: cybervision7
Review: I want to leave zero stars but I can't...I want to leave zero stars but I can't...Purolator is the absolute WORST Courier service on the planet. We ordered from Sumbeam and unfortunately they used Purolator. If I would have known this, we would have never placed our order because we've had the same terrible delivery experience from Purolator on 2 previous occasions. We work from the home and we were here for the times that Purolator stated they attempted delivery. They lie every time. They never leave a notice to prove that they even attempted a delivery and nor do they leave a voice message at our enterphone. When we call and ask them why they did not leave a notice of a failed delivery attempt, then they say that sometimes a driver will not leave a notice for condo owners for our protection. This is just crap and from now on if I ever order something again, I'll make sure to ask which courier they are using. We've never had an issue with other courier services like UPS, Canada Post, etc.Also, now after my wife called them, they said that we have to pick up the parcel from their nearest location which is 10 miles away. Do that in an SUV at today's gas prices, NOT. We will not drive to pick up a parcel that was never attempted to be delivered. We will then instead cancel our order with Sumbeam and ask them if they other delivery options other than the lousiest courier service on the planet Purolator.One more thing...from reading all the other negative 1 star reviews, which I'm sure would have rated zero stars if they could...I see that Purolator replies with some auto web bot saying they are sorry for the bad experience and request our tracking number, all to fall of deaf ears.Stay as far away from this courier service as possible!Date of experience: June 19, 2018

Name: DIANE NOEL
Review: EXTREMELY BADEXTREMELY BAD, 2 hours delivery in the same city = 4 days and they don’t pickup the phone.  Extremely useless NO service and not trustworthyDate of experience: June 16, 2018

Name: Chris
Review: No Star RatingIs it possible to give a no-star review? I actually refuse to buy online with any company that ships with Purolator. Recently I had a product that needed to be replaced and the company shipped out two seperate items via Purolator. Neither time did Purolator actually buzz my unit..just left the notice in the lobby which meant I had to trek way out to the other end of town to the depot and deal with their surly staff. The second item, which was sent via 2 day shipping took 6 business days ( 8 calendar days) for the notice sticker to arrive in my lobby. No updates at all on the tracking system since it was first sent out. I couldnt get information from anyone as to what happened to my package. What a ridiculous ezcuse for a courier company. They have one friggin job --DELIVER PACKAGES and fail miserably at it. Every. Single. Time. Why are companies still forking out money for this crap? There ARE other options.Date of experience: June 15, 2018

Name: Hugo Jobidon-Lavergne
Review: Probably the worst shipping company…Probably the worst shipping company available. I had to cancel my order and buy from an other online shop to avoid more time consuming exchange with them to get no results. They first did the usual thing they do: not ring the doorbell, leave a note, but I was waiting at home. Second thing: I called and told them they did not do their job, so they rescheduled the delivery to the day after "at the same timeframe", 10am or so. A litle bit before 6PM the next day, they tell me they will not even ship, rescheduled the next day again. I arranged an address change to my work address, because I cant stay home forever... They stil make an attempt to my house the 3rd day. The 4rth day they tell me the new address is not good for them (?!) so I change it to an other work related location. They did not arrange an other attempt and kept the package 15km from me, in a remote industrial location. By then I was so frustrated I just cancelled my order with the seller. Waste of time. I doubt my order would have reached me even if I called every day and stay at the destination address 24/7.And now, queue the automated response from the social media team.Date of experience: June 15, 2018

Name: Antonina Nekra
Review: Did not deliver on due date and did not…Did not deliver on due date and did not contact me to let me know... Horrible and hoping to never again deliver with themDate of experience: June 14, 2018

Name: Steve Murphy
Review: Purolator is only open for 3.5 hours…Purolator is only open for 3.5 hours per day in my city.  I ordered 3 things from Staples.  The first item came when I wasn't home so they just left a notice.  But the next two items came the next day when I wasn't home and they left the parcels on my step.  Why they wouldn't leave the first parcel, I don't know.  And why if they were coming back, could they not bring the first parcel the next day?  They returned the first parcel to sender after 5 days.  When you're only open for 3.5 hrs per day and don't try very hard to deliver the parcel, I guess they send a lot of parcels back undelivered.Note - It's funny, I can get a faster reply from Purolator by posting a bad review.   They replied in seconds to this review. I can't actually get anyone to answer the phone at the local Purolator office.  Of course, they are only open for 3.5 hours per day.Date of experience: June 14, 2018

Name: 源赖光
Review: Insteresting company/Insteresting experienceI just noticed the carrier of my package is PUROLATOR. I was upset !!I was frightened !!!As expected, the track status showed 'receiver unavailable' near 5 pm, but i was playing with my cat on the balcony without seeing any deliveries around.What makes me think they can be better after years? I must be insane...However, it reminds me what i experienced years ago...Lemme ask you: what is the most terrific experience in puro-'later'?is not 'no delivery attempts'is not 'customer service lies'IS 'package on the truck for a whole week!!'When these 3 things mixing, that will definitely be a curious chemical reaction...Initially, i made 2 attempts to customer service, i requested re-delivery. On the 3rd attempts, i figured out the 'it's on the trunk'.On the 5th attempts, i finally made sure i can pick-up my pack.I don't remember how long it delayed until i picked up.But, the whole thing mesmerizes me, like 'it happened just now'.(The reason i rate 2 stars is because there are tu many 1 star ratings.)I may be biased on this company and hold a prejudice. But most importantly, i fail to see their improvements. They may improve.Same thing happened b4 and now, is it really a coincidence?Date of experience: June 09, 2018

Name: Moon Neko
Review: It's a terrible delivery service I've ever had!First, they don't give me a call to schedule time for heavy, big and valuable item (Canada post did it very well). Their customer service told me that they don't have that priority. Hey, you just deliver a big TV and don't care if anyone there to receive or not?Second, I receive a notice at 8am that the package will be delivered in the same day. How can i do to arrange my stuffs to stay home and wait for them? The CS agent told me that my responsibility is check it to arrange time. What??? Third, no call before coming. This point, other carrier like UPS, Canada post did it. If the stuff is big and valuable, at least other delivery service call me 30 minutes before they come, make sure I have some one at home to receive or further arrangement. But this service doesn't do that.Fourth, they refuse to give my package to my building manager even I told them do so. When delivery man buzz my apartment door, i told him that I'm not home now, so I can either let him go in first then call the building manager come to receive and open my suite door to put it in, or can he deliver it directly to the manager office. But that guy refuse and only say "no no no no" hundred of time. Ok, i understand that a valuable stuff need a signature of someone who is over 18, right? But the building manager is not enough credential? Even she can open the right suite number to let you put the stuff in?Fifth, when I asked that guy if he will arrange another time to deliver )that the way Canada post did) it to me or the package will go to the pick up point. He just continue to say no no no hundred of time again. What's an answer? Hey, i just wanna know what's going on with my stuff. How Purolator trained their employees to response so with customer?Sixth, customer service can not solve any problem except saying apology. Thank you for making my life more miserable. I hope that I will never using the service of Purolator again in my life. Too much painful. And i hope that other company don't ship their products by this service. I won't buy anything which will be shipped by this carrier. And I just realize that many people are upset with their service too. Hey Purolator, you don't want to survive in the market? You don't want to compete against Canada post or UPS? How beautiful when so many negative review about your company are on internet?Date of experience: June 08, 2018

Name: Jack Flynn
Review: You can phone Amazon and have Purolator deprioritized on your Account.First of all, I was informed that you can now call Amazon to have Purolator deprioritized on your account if their continued screw ups threaten your business. I did that. This means Purolator is only used if Amazon exhausts all other options.Since when is it OK to leave a package in the hallway of a busy apartment building in TO - AT THE WRONG DOOR? They didn't even get the right door!!! It went in front of my neighbors door 3 doors down. Thank god they are honest, unlike these Purolator liars on the phone. I swear talking to them is like playing a mental shell game of hide the truth. They are trying to say someone moved it.  I have a motion detected peep hole camera that shows zero activity from when they claim to have delivered it correctly. Hopefully none of my packages ever see Purolators hands again.Purolator please don't leave your patronizing response that I should email you at your customer care department. If you've already lied to me once on the phone, then why would I send an email? Do you actually think you are offering people an option that they'd like when you offer this? It's the equivalent of offering customer service hell and it's insulting to people's intelligence and common sense. . Do you think people can't see that the only person who benefits from this little after the fact "customer service" charade is you?? Go ahead and  give yourself a little pat on the back, but it's offensive to the customer to offer them to be sent down yet another rabbit hole of ineptitude by asking them to send an email. But hey, at least you're consistent ... you're consistently offering poor service. Your company is a jokeDate of experience: June 08, 2018

Name: Teemo
Review: Horrible service and belligerent repsHorrible service and reps who are antagonistic and customer hostile. Yesterday Purolator left $1100 worth of product in the 3rd floor hallway of my apartment building. That's just sitting in the hallway where any of the other 20 tenants could have taken it (A 43" computer monitor and a mobile stand). I've called them and they belligerently claim they are allowed to do that and I should take it up with Amazon. Part of the problem is how hostile, righteously indignant, belligerent, rude and unhelpful their reps are. I guess they must get this kind of thing a lot because I'd barely spoken and they were on the defensive loudly. It is no surprise to me that they have 93% one out of five rating here. That's evidence enough for you! 93% bad! I'm in a lockout building. How is the delivery agent bypassing the lockout to get in? Purolator has said the local dispatch will call me and they don't. This is NOT an Amazon problem, this is a Purolator problem. Amazon are not the ones gaining access to a lockout bldg and then leaving things sitting in the apartment hallway. This is the second time in a week.   PLEASE NOTE: for others facing this problem with Amazon shipments. Phone Amazon and ask to have Purolator de-prioritized on your account. This means Purolator will only be used as a last resort - still too much in my opinion. One star is too high a rating for this garbage company who cares nothing about their customers.RE Catherine's replay:You said"If the driver is let in the building that would usually require a code and/or a key,"Did you read the OP? He wasn't let into the building. Myself and bldg management reviewed the lobby security footage today from yesterday. What the Purolator driver did was grab the door as it was closing from someone else who had been buzzed in. He knows that he is not supposed to enter unless he's buzzed in. I reported all the info including describing the video footage to Purolator. Purolator again promised a local manager will get back to me. My bldg manager is putting the video on a USB for me so I will have that available.As far as contacting you at your bs email. Why? For one more layer of obfuscation and bureaucracy. Get your company to do the initial thing they promised  and that is to have the local manager to get back to me. UPDATE: The regional manager finally called. She was a defending her driver's actions of entering the bldg without being let in by me. She eventually just ended the call in my mid sentence saying have a good day and just hanging up.I called her back and she had a little petulant flip out on the phone. She was more interested in being right than actually solving the problem. All you gotta do folks is look at their 93% one star ratings here. Tells you everything you need to know about this garbage company.Date of experience: June 05, 2018

Name: Micola
Review: terrible serviceno info, just put an card at my door, and put my stuff 9km far from me.Date of experience: June 05, 2018

Name: Michael Hachey
Review: Bunch of idiots who lie constantly They…Bunch of idiots who lie constantly They act like they tried to deliver your item but it's all bs i hope you all die in a fireDate of experience: June 04, 2018

Name: S.
Review: Incompetent and dishonest!Package from Amazon was recorded as delivered. It never arrived and I was home all day. Purolator took 3 weeks to put a trace on the package which consisted of asking the delivery person if he did deliver to the package to my house and "he said that he did", 3 weeks later????? After I questioned the validity of such unprofessional practice via email, the agent for Purolator replied that the "GPS shows the van stopped at [my]house".  I then asked to see that report so that we could confirm the address and GPS location actually coincided with the location of my house.... the agent replied that they "we're actually unable to obtain GPS information in that area on that particular van."   I guess I caught Purolator in a lie, because now the agent won't reply to my emails. If I could give this unprofessional and incompetent company zero stars, I would!Date of experience: June 03, 2018

Name: Stephen
Review: Delivery Accountability....We were expecting a bicycle to be delivered to our store today.  Customer was waiting for our call.  We tracked the bike and saw that it was delivered to us but we had not received the bike.  An hour later, a random person calls and says he received a delivery from Purolator that was a bike box.  It was the bike we were expecting.  We called Purolator and asked them to have the driver pick up the bike and deliver it to our store.  The service rep said that wasn't going to happen and here is the file number for your complaint.   Wow.  Awesome customer service.  I had to drive to the person's house and pick up the bike myself.  I complained to our supplier and asked them to consider another delivery company.  If this person never called us, no one would know where that bike went and we would have to prove to our supplier that we never stole the bike.   Purolator said they delivered the bike to us and they never did.  And they took no responsibility and willingness to fix their mistake so we could keep OUR customer happy.  Terrible customer service.Date of experience: May 31, 2018

Name: Madette Dayondon
Review: Dont ever trust their service!!!!Dont ever trust their service!!!!! Lied about delivery. I did put my workplace as shipping address cause theres always gonna be someone to receive it if in case. Tracking status says Attempted delivery due to heavyweight !!? Like what?! So what ? The thing is they never attempt to deliver it. Their reason is they thought its a residential address so they need a person to be present at the moment of delivery. How could they know if it is residential or commercial  when they didnt even tried yet!? Tried to call so many times and different answers.. they said it will be delivered by tomorrow but nothing came. I called again and they said it will be on friday since heavy shipments schedule is monday-wens-fri. If theres a rate for 0 star , i would choose it.Date of experience: May 31, 2018

Name: Brian Jairam
Review: Lied about package delivery statusI ordered from a big online store that for some inconceivable reason, decided to use Purolator for delivery. After getting in touch with the online store for help, a store associate contacted Purolator directly. Purolator said that they had messed up on their tracking info and said they would deliver the package that same day. It has been two days and nothing has still come. The online store was nice enough to take the hit and refund me for the goods, but as a warning to all sellers and buyers, do not use Purolator! As you can see from all these reviews, this courier is a joke; they lie about the delivery status of your package, presumably to meet their quotas for the bosses at Canada Post. Canada Post should terminate this entire joke of an operation.Date of experience: May 30, 2018

Name: Tien-Dat Le
Review: I would give 0 star if possible!One client of mine needs few banner stands for his trade-show in Saskatoon. I scheduled the shipment "Next Day" and "Air-shipped". The pick-up guy came and he promised up and down, left and right that it would be at the destination 10AM next day.2 days later, the customer sent us an email telling us that the shipping is still in transit and his show was happening at the time of the email. I checked on Purolator and yes, the package is still somewhere on the way. Purolator told me that they sorted the package in "GROUND", freaking "GROUND", which takes 3 days for the stuff to come. I still have my copy here and it was "AIR". Why did they choose the "Ground" themselves? Did nobody check on the waybill before sorting?The customer is really mad and he came to the show with nothing to present his business. I don't know what to say but Purolator really needs to look at their services. It's not the way to do business at all.Date of experience: May 30, 2018

Name: Jason
Review: Worst m********* experience ever!!!!Worst m********* experience ever!!!!! Condescending staff that doesn't give enough of a s*** to help. I have been trying to get my package for 2 weeks!!!!!! and can't cause I work all week and can't be there to receive it and can't pick it up cause my documents are "not enough for us to give it to you". I'd rather walk naked to Saskatchewan for my package than to ever have to deal with this company ever again!!!!!Date of experience: May 30, 2018

Name: TSaokei
Review: Purolator or is it Poor-or-later?Driver made a single attempt to deliver item (CCTV video confirms this). Left a pick up note which said the item would be available to pick up the next day. I went to get the item the next day and the item was not there.  Using the web site's tacking and emails I was told the item was again out for delivery. I again went out of my way for this company by ensuring someone would be at the delivery address to receive the item. Instead I get another tracking update saying I could go and pick up my package.When I order a delivery I expect it to be delivered to the address. I never have to go over a kilometre to pick up my delivery pizza.  If there is no answer for the pizza guy, he'll call the house (in other words he'll make an effort).  I don't get dropped off blocks away from my destination when I use a taxi service.Avoid bossiness' offering shipping via Purolator. You are better off either buying elsewhere or going to get the item yourself.Date of experience: May 28, 2018

Name: Funke Arogundade
Review: Save your money, Don't use Purolator.Paid $380 for international express shipping of 4lb (gifts) which was supposed to be delivered to the receiver. It got  transferred to UPS???? UPS charged us extra handling fees of over $100. Seriously!!! Why do international shipping when you cannot go all the way???Total of almost $500 for gifts not worth $400 and why would UPS charge us again and not deliver as agreed with Purolator. Receiver had to go to UPS office to retrieve it. Alright, thanks for the worst service ever. Worse than NIPOST!!!!Date of experience: May 28, 2018

Name: Ronny Joe Jimbob
Review: I shipped a set of speakers from Canada…I shipped a set of speakers from Canada to California. They showed up damaged with the magnets dislodged from the speakers. Claimed I didn't package it right. I will sue these crooks. How do you not package a speaker when it is damaged through 1.5 inches of wood ?Date of experience: May 26, 2018

Name: Joseph Yu
Review: Very bad servicesVery bad services. The driver can not wait for a minute and leave the notice at public area. And their customer service even hung up my phone.Date of experience: May 25, 2018

Name: Crystal Leduc
Review: Horrible serviceHorrible service. The driver (I can only assume it was him) rang my doorbell. It took me less than a minute to come from my basement to the door. I would say SECONDS to get there. He was already back in his truck. I tried to get his attention and was ignored. I hastily slipped on some shoes to run to the trunk and he drove away. I would never recommend this company for shipping. Ever.Date of experience: May 25, 2018

Name: Persephone McNair
Review: I did not approve having my parcel left…I did not approve having my parcel left on my front door step. I do not live in an area where it is safe for a parcel to be left on my front door step. This was a package for which I paid nearly $90. I am fortunate enough that I got home before someone walked away with it, but the chances are very good, I might not have been. This is ridiculous. I should at least have been contacted to ask for approval on this. To repeat, at no point did I state I wanted my parcel left on my doorstep. This is unacceptable.Date of experience: May 24, 2018

Name: Naani Mainya Thapa
Review: I would've given 0 star if possibleI would've given 0 star if possible. Horrible service, get rid of this company!Date of experience: May 24, 2018

Name: Filsan
Review: Absolute trash, COMPANIES SHOULD NEVER USE THEM!Absolute trash. I am not sure if these delivery people are brain dead since they seem to not understand how to call from a directory in a building lobby to be let in and deliver a package, EVERY SINGLE TIME a company sends with Purolator this happens, I write a an email to all of their CEOs and regional managers to not use Purolator as I and my friend and family do not shop at companies that do anymore. Make me drive 1 hour to get a package because this idiots can't get in a building.Date of experience: May 24, 2018

Name: Tony Truong
Review: Purolator is choosing my company moneyOk, so I have a package going from Ontario to Alberta. I paid for express shipping. The package value is about $90, I paid $500 because a customer is willing to pay $3,000 for it. So obviously I have to pay for the most expensive shipping method. Guest what? Is day 2 and I still don't know where my package is. Contacted them and they say, my car is taking care by Tammy, who was suppose to call me yesterday. No call, so I called Tammy and left 2 messages... Still no call and no idea where my package is. This is bad and I'm about to lose my contact hereDate of experience: May 24, 2018

Name: Kevin Carey (Cats-eye)
Review: Tracking system is a jokeFirst off, to give credit where its due.....this is not a critique of my local purolator delivery guy, my beef is with the pretty much non-existant tracking system. I live in newfoundland, and every single time something is coming via purolator, the package tracks as far as dieppe, NB and no updates after that. Its very annoying.  Almost pointless to have a tracking number, isn’t it? Whats happening with my parcel? Won’t know til whenever it actually shows up. In this day and age, literally every other courier can give you updates so you can follow where your parcel is day to day and be prepared, but with purolator your always left wondering....where is my parcel right now? will it arrive when they say it will? The day before? The day after? It’d be nice to know for sure, wouldn’t it? Isn’t that purolators job?  I’m currently waiting like a fool all this morning because AMAZON says my stuff will be delivered today, and as far as the purolator tracking info goes, nothing to report since May 17, when it left NB (today is May 22), should arrive “by tomorrow”.  Is it that hard to keep customers in the know? Really? From now on, its canada post or fedex or I won’t bother.Date of experience: May 22, 2018

Name: Rachel
Review: Worst shipping company ever!Worst shipping company ever!! On a previous package, Purolator has stated they "attempted to deliver" my package but they never actually came because we did not have an attempted delivery slip. We requested the package be sent to a retail shipping location for pick up. We went there the next day, and surprise! The package was not there. We called Purolator, and they said it was at another location that we did NOT request, so we told them keep it there and we will go the next day. When we arrived the next day, the package wasn't there! They had somehow delivered to the previous shipping location we originally requested. If they tell you "2 business days to update" they really mean "we'll screw it up two more times, so you'll actually get your package a week later." What kind of delivery company has you pick your package at some far away location?? I wish Amazon never had the option for Purolator! I have NEVER had a good experience with this company. If you have the choice, do NOT choose this company!I am unfortunately waiting for another package, and they will once again, undoubtedly screw it up. I will have to travel 40 minutes to pick up my "delivery" because I can't trust them to deliver it to the correct retail shipping location. Thanks so much Purolator!! At least you are consistent in screwing up in your line of business!Edit: James, there is no point in telling you the tracking number. Your company "manager" will do nothing about it, like they have done so many times in the past. This review is for others to heed caution and NOT choose Purolator as a shipping company.Date of experience: May 22, 2018

Name: Jesse D
Review: DON'T USE PUROLATOR!Don't expect to receive your item when they say you will, even if you pay extra..  I sublet some office space, and they wouldn't deliver my package because "my" sign isn't on the front.  They didn't even consider the address.  Do you look for names on the houses when you deliver??? How hard is it to deliver to the specified address!  No attempt was made what so ever, no compensation for lost time due to undelivered goods.  Down right horrible service.  As everyone else says, if you want your package delivered on time, don't use these guys.  Horrendous company. I paid extra, received less. BRUTAL!Date of experience: May 17, 2018

Name: Hanki Lee
Review: Thanks for dropping my packageThanks for dropping my package, I could here it dropping all the way from my room which was other side of the house.  Thanks for taking care of my package with such care. Good thing it was not fragile.Date of experience: May 16, 2018

Name: Ramona Dunn
Review: I have an issue with Purolator that has…I have an issue with Purolator that has not been resolved despite 2 weeks of regular phone calls and 2 reference numbers. The most ridiculous thing about this whole issue is that I am trying to obtain a CSNR sticker so that the delivery driver will not need to make two trips out every time he attempts to deliver a package to me. All I wanted to do was to make the drivers job easier and it has turned into a great big fiasco.Date of experience: May 15, 2018

Name: Trina Patterson
Review: Rude and unhelpfulPurolator called me asking to set up a pick up/drop off time, after calling the number they left in my voicemail they told me it would be waiting at their facility desk in Guelph. Apon arrival the ignorant girl at the counter said it was claimed as a heavy weight package and they were to busy to go get it! What kind of customer service is that? I drive 45 minutes saving them time and gas for them to tell me there to busy and I’ll have to wait till the following day because they are busy doing a sort! I even offered to wait at the facility for them to take the time to get it and it was a flat out no and she demanded to see my drivers license to make sure she was talking to the right person even after I gave her my tracking number! RUDE unhelpful customer service! Last time I ever use them and I recommend nobody else use them either avoid at all cost!Date of experience: May 15, 2018

Name: vlad
Review: if i could give give 0 stars that would…if i could give give 0 stars that would be it, worst ever service! The guy that had to do delivery, he just left the notice on my door, everyone at the time was home, nobody knock the door, very disappointedDate of experience: May 15, 2018

Name: Kam
Review: Tell your drivers DO NOT PARK IN…Tell your drivers DO NOT PARK IN RESIDENCE PARKING... next time it will be towedDate of experience: May 15, 2018

Name: Bonnie Cheung
Review: Poor customer serviceI ordered a video game via Amazon.ca and it got lost in the mail. After contacting Amazon and waiting for a replacement for over a month I complained to both Amazon and Purolator about this incident. The Purolator staff were unhelpful and frustrating to communicating with. First they ask me to check the tracking record to confirm if it was delivered to the right address even though I told them it wasn't, no one at my household saw or picked up the package from the door. I have already checked the tracking record on both Amazon and their site, on theirs it claims it was delivered to me on Amazon it says it was given to someone in Scarborough. The staff person said that their drivers originate from Scarborough which isn't true in this case they came from Vancouver. I showed them screenshots of both records to prove it. In the end they claim the gps shows that the driver did indeed send it to the right address and decided to close my case without offering further help. Despite the evidence I provided that a stranger has my stuff and the personal info that's labeled on my package. I was only contacting the company to leave feedback, I appreciate that they tried to look into it but they provided really poor customer service. I hope Amazon stops using Purolator as one of their delivery couriers.Edit: in response to James from Purolator: no I don't want to deal with your stag through e mail again. I have already sent them my tracking number and as I said already they were unhelpful. Claimed it was delivered to me and called it a day.Date of experience: May 11, 2018

Name: Wayne W
Review: unbelievably poor --I use multiple…unbelievably poor --I use multiple couriers to ship glass all over north America and stopped using them years ago due to a driver running over our shipment --yesterday I was asked to ship Purolator by a customer --well wouldn't you know it only 2nd window ever broken by a courier in 10 years again by Purolator --this is tempered safety glass packaged well and is almost impossible to break -- what are they doing to our packages ?? makes you  wonder --STOP using Purolator !!!Date of experience: May 09, 2018

Name: Boyd Coombs
Review: Purolators tracking service tells me my…Purolators tracking service tells me my package will be delivered on Tuesday May 8 2018..... At 6:00PM that day, No package..... I contacted purolator,.... One rep told me it will be on the truck the next day..... Another rep says it was given to canada post ....No one from purolator contacted me by phone or email to update me on any changes in shipping.....Poor customer service.Date of experience: May 08, 2018

Name: Joanie Couture
Review: DON'T use if it is for electronics...I had a package "delivered" yesterday (it was suppose to arrive today, so 1 star for fast delivery.). The person didn't even bother to knock on my door (and it was past 4:30pm since my husband comes back from work at that hour). So my package spent all night outside....in the rain. This morning, it was soaked wet even what was inside. I was lucky that it wasn't electronics inside because I'm pretty sure it wouldn't have worked with all the water inside the package. And this is NOT the first time!When I called this morning Purolator customer service to tell them : could it be possible to tell the delivery guys to knock on the door before leaving, they simply told my that it  was impossible to put a "obligation" on knocking on doors. They told me that they could only tell that specific delivery guy to knock next time....but what about all the others??At least Canada Post take the time to knock and if their is no answers but the package can be left without a signature they put your package somewhere "safe". Meaning somewhere that is not visible from the street and covered from potentiel rain (ex. under the patio table). They even write to you  message in your mailbox with the place they left the package.So, especially for electronics NEVER use Purolator unless you pay more to have the package signed for pickup.Date of experience: May 04, 2018

Name: Daud Muhammad
Review: The worst ever comosny .it's been 7…The worst ever comosny .it's been 7 days and i have not received my shipment yet. I ordered my shoes from xara snd this comoany was suppose to deliver with one or two days  but its been 7 days .earlier they make false excuses of address missing al though i orovuded my contact number along comolete address thdn i called them several times and made correction which was an excuse only .they confirmed me for todays delivery but now they delayed it again snd it is 8th dau .shioment havd not arrived yet.the worst service provider and zara is irresponsible company.am never gonna buy from zara until they choose some ither comoany fir deliveryDate of experience: May 01, 2018

Name: Rehana Meghani
Review: worst experience everIf I could give less of a star I would. I had originally requested no signature required because I knew I wasn’t going to be home. The new label the pickup agent decided to select signature required so I missed the package. Called customer service and the rep was trying to put the blame on the person who gave the shipment to the pickup agent. All I got was excuses and excuses and blame on me and blame on the person who handled the pickup. Oh and I might have been double charged... I didn’t authorize anyone to charge my card. Review: Always bad serviceI always get disappointed when I deal with purolator and if I could give them zero stars I would!! When I requested that they move it closer so that I don't have to drive for AN HOUR to pick up a package that I already paid shipping for, they took my request and didn't put it on file so the package was sent back to the shipper and I had to order it again and wait for it! Today was another horrible experience, I was expecting urgent documents shipped from abroad (which were supposed to be delivered FOUR days ago not today) and I stayed at home sitting by the door to receive them when the delivery person decided not to ring the bell and just leave a notice that I need to pick them up! He/She is wasting my time for no reason! I never want to deal with purolator again!!!!Date of experience: April 30, 2018

Review: I purchased Best Buy furniture on April…I purchased Best Buy furniture on April 3,2018 and purolator was assigned to deliver it on April 13,2018. I did mention to the company that there are no elevators and the apartment is on 2nd floor and they have to take 5-7 steps and knock at the door. It was a nightmare after that. After several calls to management and depot finally they deliver the item on April 23,2018 and the item was one table and four chair weighing 128 Ibs. purolator is the worst company to deal with. Name: Patrick Hutchinson
Review: First they lost it, then they broke itTwo attempts at ordering an item from Amazon. I have a prime membership so it should have been 2 day delivery. The two days go by and no package. I check the tracking number, and it says "shipping label created" and no more progress. I call Amazon and they say the package is lost in transit.I arrange to have another shipped, no cost (amazon Rep was super nice) and they again say two days. Three days go by, and again no package. Check the tracking. One failed attempt and then "damage reported; contact us." This time I call Purolator and the woman on the phone mutters something about the package being empty and tries to put me through to the claims department. Who are closed.I call Amazon and request a refund. They process it with no questions asked and I ask if I can specify a carrier when I order something, or at least specify "not purolator." They say no, but they will send my info and complaint to whatever department deals with that kind of thing.An hour or two later, I receive the confirmation email that my refund has been processed. It states the reason is that my address is "undeliverable." Bull.I call Amazon back and, very specifically, tell them that the reason for the refund is NOT that my apartment doesn't exist, it's that purolator are incompetent and that I want the complaint recorded that way. The kicker is, my apartment building has no mail boxes so my mailing address is a P.O. box that is included in my rent. You're telling me there was no one at the Post Office when you "attempted" delivery? Seems likely.If Amazon insists on using purolator, I will be cancelling my prime membership despite how nice and helpful they were.Date of experience: April 21, 2018

Name: Ryan
Review: Avoid Using PurolatorWe ordered 1 day shipping.  We're going into day 4 now & still no parcel. I would give this company a zero if I could. Day 3    delayed in transit due to missed  connection. I'm guessing I'll get the same reply that everyone else has received to send the tracking number with details.  Why would anyone contact customer service when they are completely unable to keep track of there own service details.  What an absolute joke. I'm just going to send up some smoke signals & hopefully that helps them find our house.Date of experience: April 18, 2018

Name: Admin girl
Review: Might as well use a donkey to get it there.My company will no longer be using Purolator and I would never recommend them to anyone. Name: Abbey Colucci
Review: A review of Purolator (April 2018)This review will make no difference to Purolator, but maybe it will make a difference to you, dear person who is considering using Purolator because they might be cheaper or because they're the Canadian choice. Please, dear reader, head my warnings. We ordered tricycle through Toys R Us as an Easter present for our tot. Purolator left delivery note April 3. I knew from the moment I saw that Purolator was involved, there would be trouble. So, husband called April 4 and was told redelivery would be April 6 between 8 am and 6 pm and that delivery driver may or may not leave the package on the porch if we leave a note. We did tape a note to the door to leave the box on the porch, but we were also home waiting for the package. We waited for 10 hours and there was no delivery, though on the Purolator tracking site the bike was picked up at 5:30 pm. I called April 7  and customer service said we must have misunderstood because there was no way they could have guaranteed delivery on Friday as they need 2 BUSINESS DAYS for a redelivery request. That's right, 2 business days to send the request from the national call centre to the local. Delivery was then set for Monday, April 9 between 8 am and 6 pm. The note remained on the door and husband stayed home waiting, but of course, there was no delivery. We have now been waiting 20 hours at home for a box. Called at 5:30 pm and was told there was no way they could deliver by 6 pm and that we would need to wait between 8 am and 8 pm on April 10 to get the package, but they *might* be able to upgrade our shipping to the morning. Oh, wait, that probably couldn't happen because it was so late in the day they couldn't possibly communicate that information to the driver because they needed the aforementioned TWO BUSINESS DAYS to communicate to the local company. Unlike every other shipping company in the world, they also can't provide even a rough estimate of delivery time, just a timespan of 10-12 hours with you waiting by the door like some sad dog. And that's what you are to Purolator, a sad dog waiting by the window. Since I couldn't guarantee we would be waiting by the door for another 12 hours, I canceled the shipment (which would be a total of 32 hours, btw).There was no recompense offered other than a half-hearted apology and two people saying "What do you want me to do?" and "I can't take the blame" (literally said that to me). Soldiers fighting in the Civil War got mail faster than Purolator can deliver packages. Donald Trump is more honest to his constituents than Purolator is with their customers. Doug Ford cares more about the inner city than Purolator cares about its customers.  Westboro Baptist Church has more respect for gay people than Purolator does for its customer base. If your business does shipping with Purolator, you are saying to your customers you don't care about them and they can go f*** themselves because you're just grabbing their money and leaving.The inefficiency and impotence of the entirety of this company has left me so bemused I have found the experience quite hilarious, but really just want to prevent you from having this experience.Date of experience: April 10, 2018

Name: J.R.
Review: Incompetence EmbodiedIt's a stretch to call Purolator a "delivery service." They'll leave a ticket at your door after one (alleged) delivery attempt, then you'll have to drive 30 minutes to an hour to go pick it up. But that's not all! You can call them to reschedule a delivery for your package, and then they'll give you an EIGHT HOUR delivery window, after which they STILL WON'T DELIVER YOUR PACKAGE. Then you'll have to call them back to try and get your package delivered AGAIN, but you'll find out your package is "still on a truck somewhere" and you'll have to wait another two days before they'll attempt to deliver it, at which point you'll be suspicious that you'll ever get your package at all. Which is what happened to us. After 30 TOTAL HOURS of waiting for scheduled delivery, and after multiple phone calls with Purolator's "customer service," during which we were told multiple, contradictory excuses about why they seem unable to put a box in a truck, drive the truck to an address, and leave the box on a doorstep, we gave up and told them to cancel the order.Purolator is a true marvel: a delivery service that is incapable of delivering a package. Bottom line: if you order something and see it's assigned to Purolator, CANCEL YOUR ORDER and use UPS, Fed-Ex, Postal Service, DHL, ANYTHING BUT PUROLATOR. This company is incompetence embodied.Date of experience: April 10, 2018

Name: Michelle Isaac
Review: Getting very frustratedGetting very frustrated. Name: Curtis
Review: 2 day shipping is really 5 day shippingOrdered an item with two day shipping , attempted delivery yesterday (Friday) missed the courier by 10 mins. Tried calling customer service on hold more than 15 mins when the wait queue message advised less than 5 mins. No option was given for a call back , hung up and called the local store. They advised that due to my missed delivery on a Friday I have to wait until Monday in the afternoon to pick up my package. What was the point of paying the extra money for express shipping when now it turns into 5 days , biggest money grab ever! Plus only one attempt to drop off a package what poppycock. I realize complaining won’t fix anything as any review outlet on the internet shows how bad they are. Next time I will go through Canada post at least they have yet to fail me (weird since Purolator is owned by Canada Post). End rant.Date of experience: April 07, 2018

Name: Steve
Review: Liars.Liars.I would like to know how a company survives that cannot handle the one thing is exists to do. First off, two-day shipping for them apparently means five-day shipping. Review: Puro-pick-up companyjust find out on google, it is owned mostly by canadian post, no wonder its service is in such a bad shape, it is truly a miracle that the company is still kicking and running. my internet phone company sent me a replacement box through purolator who didn't knock or bother to leave a note, just let the machine called my home phone: you have a parcel to be picked up, here is the address.... no door post or note, I even don't know my tracking number and I have to call my phone company to find out, what a service! and I have to drive 15 kilo to pick it up. this is not a delivery company, it is a puro-pick-up company.Date of experience: March 25, 2018

Name: T.B.
Review: EgregiousOn March 1, 2018, The licensing board that I am associated with was suppose to send an important document of mine to Michigan Licensing Board in Lansing and decided to use Purolator to courier my document. This licensing board put the "wrong address" and Purolator was unable to deliver the document (which is strange because I had another document sent to the very same address and FedEx was able to deliver without any problems). Anyways I called Purolator on March 8 to give the Overnight address to send this important document and they told me how they have to email UPS the change of address and UPS will let them know between 24-48 hours of an update. From March 9 to this date I've been on the phone regularly with Purolator and they promised to update me with the status of my document. When I looked on the tracking of my document, it was sent from Lansing, Michigan to Kansas City, MO on March 14. Nobody from Purolator told me my document was going to Kansas City, MO and wasn't able to give me an explanation as to why my document was sent to Kansas City so I called UPS to gain further information. UPS told me over the phone that the document was sent to Corporate Goods location out in Kansas City, MO because the address was wrong and they keep goods with the wrong address in the warehouse in Kansas City. Upon hearing this information I became enraged as I already told Purolator the Overnight address. I do not understand why it is taking Purolator so long to send my document from Toronto, ON to Lansing, MI when FedEx was able to do this in less than 24 hours. I spoke to Lisa from the International Department who told me Diane was looking into this and there was an investigation going on however when I spoke to Mark from Corporate Customer Relations he told me that my investigation has been closed. I told him how displeased I was with this service(I spoke to a Manager name Donna on March 14 and she told me Diane would get back to me on March 15 regarding the verdict of my document and I wasn't called by either her or Diane) and threatened to have FedEx retrieve my document out in Kansas since its so hard for Purolator/UPS to deliver a document to Lansing, Michigan. Mark then told me that someone made a mistake with the labeling of my package and said that is why it went out to the Corporate Goods site out in Kansas City. He told me Diane the specialist is supposed to get back to me 4:30 p.m. I was better off driving from Toronto to Lansing to pick up my document and deliver it, I atleast know it can be delivered on the same date.People please do not use Purolator to send any important documents, the customer service is egregious and you're better off having FedEx deliver your documents from Canada to the USA or even Canada Post. What disturbs me is that I have to be the one contacting Purolator regarding my document, these folks don't take the initiative to call their customers to update them about their documents being mailed out. Had I known this trouble occurred I would've opted for regular mail. I really wish I can give them a rating less than 1.Date of experience: March 16, 2018

Name: Sean
Review: UPS delivers right to my doorUPS delivers right to my door . Purolator delivers to a location 30 min drive away and says "go pick it up". Incomplete delivery is not a delivery at all. I shop online so I don't have to drive a half hour to the mall. But when it's Purolator , I still have to go to the mall anyway.I just cancelled my Amazon orders being shipped Purolator. In future , as soon as I see a  Purolator tracking on an order I've placed, I'm cancelling right away. I used to love Purolator 25 years ago and use to use them for everything. If I condone the transition to this type of shipping practice I will become part of the reason it exists. Not gonna do it.Date of experience: March 16, 2018

Then I waited for them from 7am - 1pm, I called them again, they just replied "your order should arrive between 8am-8pm" (what? I'm not jobless I have to do to work). They shipped the package at 2, and of course, no one was home so they left the note...again. Are you even real Purolator? I tried my best to make time for you and you were still late. Grow up, respect people's timeDate of experience: March 15, 2018

Name: Josh Jones
Review: Terrible courier. Takes advantage of us all. Use another courier service.Terrible courier. Never on time, in the last two years they have never delivered a package on the day expected. A lot of the time I receive a package and it's damaged and I have to return it. I have had them removed as a shipping option from most of my accounts. Hopefully Amazon will wise up and stop using these people as a shipping option. Their conduct is not suitable for business. The person that is gonna respond to this is from their social media dept. They'll ask for a tracking number and other information in a feigned attempt to resolve any issues you may have. This will lead absolutely no where. I have supplied information in the past and had no favorable results. They never change or learn. They just take our money for shipping and do whatever they like. Take action. Stop using Purolator. I encourage everyone to use another Courier Service.UPDATE: I was just at the depot to get my package, I get home and find that I have another package not being delivered today, they promise to deliver tomorrow. I highly doubt it. Regardless could have saved us all a huge amount of time by giving me the package when I was physically there at the depot. Which is 37 km away from my house. Great job; at not doing a darn thing right. Please; Stop; it hurts me to see such terrible customer service in a service driven industry.Date of experience: March 14, 2018

Name: Nancy Bieganek Sjolin
Review: I ordered an item from Amazon it was…I ordered an item from Amazon it was over 50 pounds I am pretty sure Purolator have google map? My address is 4 mile from town and they couldn’t even drop off my item. No instead I had to pick it up at some drop off and Purolator didn’t even call me to tell me that!
