UPS always delivers to my door why are companies using Purolator. I will no longer order from anyone that uses them. Oh and I am sure I am going to hear the same comments from Purolator as the last bad reviews. I think they need to re-think there comments they make on the service we are getting and also Amazon needs to re-think on who the use for delivery service Not satisfied with Purolator’s response if you’re not gonna deliver to my address you could at least call the customer and just maybe if it is a item over 50 pounds you should deliver UPS does that good customer service I will make sure I never order an item that you deliver!!!Date of experience: March 08, 2018

Name: sheri israels
Review: DON"T use this company if you can…DON"T use this company if you can possibly avoid it-DHL and UPS at least have real-time tracking. The BS they feed you on chat is really quite imaginative but you can't blame the agents-they just "read from the book".Appalling service.Delivery finally listed for today-it's 4.30 pm and still no package....what a surpise.I guess we should be thankful there is no longer a company called CanPar which operated in the 80's-parcels  used to arrive with large shoeprints on them on several occasions, as well as large holes in the boxes!Date of experience: March 07, 2018

Name: Bryce Brogan
Review: Appalling serviceAppalling service.  Consistent multiple-delivery attempts to wrong address, even though street address is prominently displayed on the door.  I've had to go to the airport office to pick up the shipments three times.  No procedures in place to deal with these problems (emails take 1-2 days for response, telephone ienquiries fruitless.)   Also, tracking is a joke:1. Not yet received2. We've got it3. We delivered it.No details.  Useless.  They have been like this for YEARS!Date of experience: March 04, 2018

Name: Ken Hamilton
Review: This is about the fourth or fifth item…Update  HOORAY I GOT MY PACKAGE WITH ABSOLUTELY NO HELP FROM PUROLARORThis is about the fourth or fifth item that was shipped to me through purolator 2 were supposed to be delivered to my door.But I had to pick them up. Since I live in the northern part of the province and have a PO box for an address. Some of them got shipped as far as Prince George,and then were returned to sender, this time I had a friends address in PG but there was some extreme whether so it could not be delivered.So when I tracked it and found they were returning it to sender I phoned and asked them to turn it around and deliver it at my cost I was told they could not help me it seems as though purolator has made a business out of return to sender.  Now they want a reply, but they don't even have that as an option on there webpage.Dear Mike my tracking #was CGK002586694    It has now been all most two weeks since my first post  about    PUROLATOR  They   did a thorough investigation and  concluded that it was my fault since the shipper did not provide my phone #. Even though the shipper had NOT had the package returned to them, in good faith they shipped the same Item to me thru UPS.     SADLY the Item that I tracked and was to be delivered on wed by end of day did not arrive, when I contacted UPS they informed me that they had passed it on to PUROLATOR.When I contact PUROLATOR they inform me that I must contact UPS as that is there tracking #. When I contact UPS they inform me that someone from PUROLATOR  will call me by 7 pm  . So far this has not happened.Since it is 5 pm Fri. I"am sure I will not see this package before  Mar 19 which will be ALL MOST 7 WEEKS since it was ordered and about 35 days since it was shipped. So just  to recap  An item was shipped from Ont. CANADA to B.C. CANADA, do to inclement whether ( 18 inches of snow in 36 hrs.) it could not be delivered. So it was returned to sender , it  was shipped again ,and 2 weeks later ,they don"t seem to no where it is WOW .Glad it did not have to cross an International border!!Date of experience: March 02, 2018

Name: Jassi Khangura
Review: If I could I would not even give them…If I could I would not even give them one star. There’s a reason why everyone does not prefer them. I was supposed to receive a very important document but after tracking the document, it showed undeliverable. I get we live in an apartment but EVERY OTHER DELIVERY SERVICE knocks on the apartment doors. There is an office right beside the main entrance which opens the door for these courier services. I would not even had known that my package was trying to be delivered if I had not checked. No notice nothing was left. Never using them againDate of experience: March 01, 2018

Name: Farrukh Khan
Review: WORSE SERVICE EVERWORSE SERVICE EVER.  THEY DO NOT GIVE A 5H1T ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERSDate of experience: February 28, 2018

Name: aida keramati
Review: Poor shipping company2 parcels supposed to be shipped on a Feb 26, 2018. I called earlier the week before to confirm it and they said it will become then. I took that day off and at 12 noon that they on the website it said the package won’t deliver becasue of weight. I talked to UPS and they said yes its heavy and either you need tonpick it up or wait for arrangement ( they could have done that arrangement earlier cause they known the weight from begining). I have waisted my Vacation day for nothingAnd now I have to wait 48 hours until they MAY call meDate of experience: February 26, 2018

Name: Keith Martinez
Review: Garbage shipping companyGarbage shipping company. Always late and when they want to "deliver back" they say wait for them 8am-5pm. Are you serious, that's telling me not to go to work so I can have my package! I'm still wondering why Amazon uses this carrier service, it's not even a service since I pay shipping only to go pick it up myself, wasting my time and wasting money on gas or transit fee. They actually told me to request a new date to deliver it back, uh it was supposed to arrive Wednesday or Thursday and Friday comes and they do this. No I'm not calling them back as I've already heard the same thing they say every time they pull this crap on me.I pay Amazon Prime for a reason, and that is to not deal with this type of disservice. Now I gotta go and pick up my damn package 18km away from my home because I'd rather pick it up than wait for the truck to come back.I requested Amazon to de-prioritize this carrier for my account, hopefully they go through with it as ALL OF MY SHIPMENTS FROM THIS COMPANY ARE LATE OR THINGS LIKE THIS HAPPENS AND I'M AT MY WIT'S END WITH THIS COMPANY.Date of experience: February 24, 2018

Name: D J
Review: So @PurolatorHelp on Twitter just told…So @PurolatorHelp on Twitter just told me that my Amazon package didn't get delivered (that was ON the truck all day) because they 'ran out of time'. What-? I have never heard of any shipping company pull this nonsense! Now I wait thru the weekend, and waster ANOTHER day waiting around for them to ship. Terrible. I'm making sure Amazon knows how bad this is too.EDIT - I pay extra for Amazon Prime to avoid this kind of nonsense. Not my problem if the depot is full. I just contacted Amazon regarding this and they have submitted my complaint.Date of experience: February 23, 2018

Name: Mohamed Khimji
Review: Horrible courier companyHorrible courier company.  Delivery person doesn't call, knock the door, or make any serious effort to actually deliver the package.  Instead, he takes the package to a faraway place where I have to go and pick it up.  What a horrible company.Today, I waited all day for a package that weighed 45 lbs.  I needed the package to move furniture in two days.  I was at home and I received an e-mail that said the delivery person made an attempt to deliver the package and that it would be taken to the depot. The depot is 10 km away and I have no car.  I phoned Purolator and was told that there is no way to have the package delivered tomorrow because there is a minimum two-day turnaround.  What a horrible courier company.  I have no idea why any company would use it for deliveries.What a horrible courier company!Date of experience: February 23, 2018

Name: Bryan Choi
Review: I made this account just for thisI made this account just for thisIncompetentUnprofessionalUselessWhenever Amazon ships orders they usually always use either Amazon carrier, UPS or Canada Post. Now since I live in a dorm like setting where there is no doorbell Amazon carrier and UPS leaves my package at the door; CP just drops it in the mailbox or at the post office which is a five minute walk from my place. Now this time they use Purolator who didn't drop off my package outside the door nor did they choose the send the package to the closest Purolator store; they sent it the third farthest Purolator location. So now I either have to waste 40 min of my day tomorrow and pick up the package or wait till after the weekend.I called Amazon because I know how much of a pos Purolator customer service is. Also adding a note in my account to never ship with Purolator. If you can avoid Purolator do so, there are better carrier options.Because I needed this package on the scheduled arrival date I tried to call the location where they will have it. In the past with CP when I called there was someone to pick up and verify that the package will be in at the office before the stated time on the packing slip. However calling the Purolator location in Richmond I get a nice voicemail stating their hours of operations, useless.No I do not want to contact you guys with his issue, I'm done dealing with your company and this is the last time I will.If I could give you guys 0 stars I would.Date of experience: February 22, 2018

Name: Bit Soup
Review: I left a one star review a few weeks…I left a one star review a few weeks ago because of two very late packages (sitting on Purolators truck marked "on vehicle for delivery" for a week). Since then I had three deliveries from Purolator that were on time. If I get bad service I leave a bad review, so it i s only right that if I receive good service I leave a good review.Date of experience: February 21, 2018

Name: Ha Ny
Review: Untrustworthy & DeceitfulAfter seeing all the negative and poor reviews for Purolator on social media and review sites in the past, I always made sure not to run into them for any business since I could see they are just professionals in making mockery of customers trust in them and taking advantage of it to their benefit. My belief is that all these customer nonsatisfaction is absolutely preplanned and intentional and they keep doing it at a very frequent rate, based on the complaints tweeted almost every 30 minutes, because they are sure they can get away with it, since the customer is in a helpless position. The worst part is they are so bold to respond to each customer with an apology note to no avail which to me looks more like a mockery rather than customer care! If they cared one bit for their reputation, let alone the customers, they wouldn’t allow such a mass outpour of complaints.As for me, I placed an order with Costco 16 days ago (the delivery estimate was 7-10 days) and unfortunately Costco trapped me with Purolator. I was just hoping not to be as unfortunate as others but after this long period of waiting, I have realized that I have also fallen victim to the nasty game Purolator is playing with its customers. After waiting for the initial 14 days for the shipment to arrive to my town based on the tracking update, they start playing their game and giving lame excuses by leaving a message on tracking that “the item is heavy to be delivered, contact us!”, as if Purolator has never delivered a 50 Kg shipment or they never knew, since they picked up the shipment 9 days ago, that it was heavy! Since then I have called them 4 times and every time they give me a new story, 1st they say if you are at home 1 pm onwards we will deliver it today and wait for the driver’s call, then they say it will not be delivered today but the driver will call you today for sure, 3rd time they say NO the driver will call you tomorrow, 4th time I call the following day after not hearing from them, they say the driver will call you in 48 hours and so on…., and based on other customers reviews, I have to make sure to stay at home all the time not knowing when the driver is going to call or come for a sneaky ring and “run off” like most customers have experienced.And the sad part is I do not know for how long more I have to wait for the driver’s call and the call center is not even providing me with the depot’s phone number so that I can contact them, for the very obvious reason that they want to buy time and know their game very well.Even with the tracking messages they are so unprofessional that they repeated the tracking message “Arrived at sort facility”, today, 21 hours after first posting the exact same message yesterday! It has been such a nightmare for me so far.Such a service is unimaginable even in a third world country, and they continue to mess with their hapless customers in CANADA!  Truly shameful.Date of experience: February 21, 2018

Name: azadeh zamani
Review: One of the worst carrier companiesOne of the worst carrier companies. they didn’t contact me in any way to say that there is a problem with my delivery. In the e-mail that I got for shipping there was no mention of their company name. I called the store that I got the item from and they gave me their name. When I contacted them the representative was so rude. I hope I never have to do anything with them.Date of experience: February 21, 2018

Name: Mario T
Review: This is the worst Courier Service ever…This is the worst Courier Service ever for sure.I have been waiting at home for an item to be delivered all day and I have been keeping a track on it on their website and also the app.Today, after 1:00 pm, I decided to contact them directly using Live Chat and was told then that the Item would be delivered until 6:00 pm today.A little past 4:00 pm, I checked the status again and was baffled to see that it was marked with "Attempted delivery at 12:30 pm".Contacted them by phone only to be told that the driver attempted the delivery, which he did not, and that he might be able to try to deliver it again later today. No specific time as it can be delivered until 8:00 pm.This is definitely the worst Courier I have ever dealt with, and this is not the first time it happens.On another occasion, I saw the Purolator truck stop in front of my building while I was on my balcony and the driver only took a notice with him to stick on the door. I ran to the door but it was too late and I was forced to go and pick-up the item at the drop-off location.This is the type of company that does not deserve to be in business as they charge their clients for a specific delivery method and then they just do as they please. What a joke of a company...And, unfortunately, I am forced to give them 1 star in order to have this posted.Date of experience: February 21, 2018

Name: Gerald Prud'homme
Review: To call Purolator a courier service is…To call Purolator a courier service is a wild exaggeration! You're better off sending your package by regular mail. They just don't care about the customer. They ring the door bell and leave within 30 seconds, and you are left to scramble to get your package redelivered. You schedule a new delivery time with them, but they don't show up. Worst of all, you may have to go and pick it up yourself at their central office, located in the middle of nowhere. Do yourself a big favour, don't use Purolator, and don't order anything delivered by them. Update of our last adventure (not yet over): 2 full days of failed delivery. Here are some of the excuses I've had from them over the last 2-3 years: Mechanical failure; the driver was sick; bad weather. I'm sure they have many others. Conclusion,  I will have to pick up extremely important documents at one of their locations., at the last possible minute. If anyone is happy with their services, they must have angels working for them!Date of experience: February 20, 2018

Name: Stefano
Review: My hatred for purolator is strong.My package was supposed be delivered on the 15th because I chose to get two day shipping. I’ve called purolator several times but just like their delivery drivers, their customer service representatives are equally incompetent. I rescheduled for a delivery that im expecting today but unable to track it and have no idea if it’s on the truck. I just got off the phone with purolator and again they couldn’t help(not a surprise). Am I expected to just sit at home all day and wait for my package which might not even come today? I’m unable to pick it up at the facility because I don’t have a vehicle so delivery is the only option. What’s the deal purolator? Clearly you don’t give a sh#t bout your customers because all I see on any review site are bad reviews regarding your delivery system. After I post this some bullsh#t customer rep will say “send us your tracking number so we may help”. No...no you won’t and you can’t.Date of experience: February 20, 2018

Name: Linghan Wei
Review: Where is the package going to?????I was suppose to have a small package with a weight of less than a pound delivered to my house two days ago in Alberta but now it ended up in Toronto. Feb 16, 2018	9:02 p.m.	Toronto Sort Ctr/ctr Tri, ON	Arrived at sort facilityFeb 16, 2018	8:09 p.m.	Toronto Sort Ctr/ctr Tri, ON	Arrived at sort facilityFeb 13, 2018	8:59 p.m.	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facilityFeb 13, 2018	8:58 p.m.	Vancouver, BC	Picked up by PurolatorDate of experience: February 18, 2018

Name: Kevin H.
Review: Not My First Choice AnymoreFor the second time now in Grande Prairie the claims of truck breakdowns or item missed delivery truck recently has been an infuriating experience with this courier service. I am not the only one after checking out the local Facebook page. Strange how 5:30 PM or 6:00 PM seems to be delivery truck breakdown time. If they can"t get the task done on Friday that they are being paid to do, maybe they should work a Saturday shift to finish the job. The rest of us in the oil and gas industry do.Date of experience: February 17, 2018

Name: Peter Jeffery
Review: My parcels not delivered due to…being stored by Purolator for 5 days in a downtown ... storage unit?!My parcels not delivered due to 'weather delay' ...without any foul weather on the delivery date it was reported.  This happens  repeatedly, on multiple deliveries on multiple dates.   Of greater concern - after having received literally hundreds, or in excess of 1000 deliveries from UPS, Fed Ex, Canada Post and Purolator ... they do not deliver to me about 10% of the time or more due to my address being listed as incorrect.   I can see the address, and it is correct, and my house has not floated off into the forest.  So, there must be another problem?  Currently, I have yet another Purolator ‘incorrect address’ package sitting in a storage space (of all the dirty places) downtown.  The package contains cereal.   Do I really wish to possess an Amazon delivery after hearing it's been sitting in some storage unit downtown  (given the usual rodent concern in these places, esp. considering the edible contents of my packages).  I will not be picking this up. Meanwhile, another package for my business is two days late and tracking shows no real reason why.   Enough already.Update today:   Another day, and 4 or 5 packages that never made it off the truck.  By the way, I've had friends who have been delivery drivers for Purolator.   I DO NOT blame the drivers.   The company apparently is very poor to work for and I'm guessing there's a high turnover of delivery personnel.    My "latest' package  (1 of several expected today).   Current time is 9:41pm.   I waited home all day for this.   The delivery includes equipment for my work.   No delivery again.HistoryDate	Local Time	City	DescriptionFeb 17, 2018	8:15 a.m.	Halifax, NS	On vehicle for deliveryFeb 15, 2018	12:59 a.m.	Halifax, NS	Arrived at sort facilityFeb 15, 2018	12:00 a.m.	Halifax, NS	Weather delay - service will resume weather permittingFeb 14, 2018	5:41 p.m.	Moncton, NB	Arrived at sort facilityFeb 14, 2018	5:40 p.m.	Moncton, NB	Picked up by PurolatorFeb 14, 2018	5:02 p.m.	Moncton, NB	Picked up by Purolator at DIEPPE NBDate of experience: February 17, 2018

Name: Luke
Review: Ordered a Desk onlineOrdered a Desk online, was guaranteed delivery on friday. Took the day off work and waited all day Friday until I got a failed delivery notice. Apparently if you dont have a buzzer number and leave a phone number to call instead they will not   contact you at all, Now they refuse to ship to me and I have to go pick it up on Wednesday (5 days later) as they wont deliver, and if I dont pick it up on Wednesday they will return it. I talked to Amazon customer service and they will no longer use Purolator to ship to me at all as this seems to happen every single time Purolator. SO if you also had a bad experience call Amazon and ask them to remove purolator from your shipping list.Date of experience: February 16, 2018

Name: Melina Webber
Review: Delay due to weather? "Where?", I ask.Package left Toronto Feb 13, 2018 inbound for Edmonton. Delivery was initially estimated to be today (Feb 16, 2018) , but now marked for Feb 20, 2018 due to "Weather delay - service will resume weather permitting". There is no inclement weather anywhere across Canada between Edmonton and Toronto right now. Based on other reviews of the same nature, I'm suspecting something is currently "rotten in Denmark". Transparency is a tool that builds trust in a business, its people, and it's processes - it would behoove Purolator to utilize this tool. Not enraged, but this is my first negative experience with Purolator to date and the reviews and comments I see here have me worried for the fate of my parcel.Date of experience: February 16, 2018

Name: Nieka Streef
Review: Currently fuming at PurolatorCurrently fuming at Purolator. I bought my partner something from amazon, that was supposed to arrive Feb 15th. I live in an apartment building with a buzzer that calls my cell phone. I waited all morning until I see an email saying my package was attempted and it would be at the pickup station the next business day. I promptly call Customer service to ask for a same day reattempt and to please use the buzzer (my full name is listed) and they said they cannot contact drivers (what?). They also informed me that they could try to get in touch with the office to get it out for delivery the next day, but it wasn’t a guarantee. The following day.. today. I wait around for the call.... my phone rings ONCE. By the time I pick it up, they’ve hung up, again, no chance of having a reattempt. I work for another big courier company, so I understand the pressures of having to deliver quickly, but I also understand customer satisfaction is extremely important. What’s the point of even having a delivery company that literally and figuratively does not deliver? This courier did the least they could do to get me my package on time. I am more shocked at the service than anything. Any other courier company would be a better choice.Date of experience: February 16, 2018

Name: HD Beauty
Review: They just throw your packages aroundThey just throw your packages around. My entire shipment was ruined. They have no options to file a claim for damage.Date of experience: February 16, 2018

Name: Shruthi Seshadri
Review: Follow up on my experience.This is a follow up on my experience with purolator. After my first review, purolator reached out to me to solve the situation but honestly it hasn’t been solved at all. They were unable to find my package and now I find out that ‘personal belongings’ cannot be reimbursed because they need receipts of all purchases as proof. All my belongings in that box were bought in the last year or so, you really expect me to have all the receipts? Now please don’t tell me it’s clearly printed in the terms and conditions because even if it was, it should be the first thing the store employees should inform to the customer, which I wasn’t informed about. Of course!Plus, I had to contact ups and follow up with them and connect them to purolator to restart the investigation. Basically I did the work for them, perfect! And now I’m stuck. No package  in hand, paid for it - ain’t getting that money back, and if I do file a claim, no guarantee ( the lady in the claims department said 100%) that I won’t receive any compensation for my time and money spent, along with mental trauma communicating with these people. If you can’t do the job, why do it at all. This is not done. I implore everyone to please not use purolator! They do not value their customers at all. Sarcasm - definitely a customers market.Date of experience: February 16, 2018

Name: Serkan Acuner
Review: Worst shipping company.We are at home waiting for a package but your driver updated the record as delivered.Date of experience: February 15, 2018

Name: Cc
Review: ALWAYS DELAYED!DONT DELAY ANY SHIPMENT THAT WE PAID EXTRA FOR AND ACTUALLY UPDATE YOUR SYSTEM WHERE THE PACKAGE IS.  YOU DONT CARE ABOUT THE TIME FRAME YOU GIVE TO CUSTOMERS. ALWAYS DELAYED DUE TO WEATHER CONDITION. IT ONLY SNOWED A LITTLE AND YALL DELAY EVERYTHING UNTIL THE NEXT DAY EVEN THOUGH THE PACKAGE IS ONLY AN HOUR AWAY FROM THE DESTINATION AND WAS SORTED EARLY IN THE MORNING, YOU HAVE ALL DAY! IF YOU CANT DRIVE IN LITTLE TO NO AMOUNT OF SNOW ON THE ROAD, YOURE IN THE WRONG COUNTRY!!Date of experience: February 14, 2018

Name: Jack
Review: Never use Purolator ever againDelivery has been delayed for 3 business days in total, 5 days including the weekends. Delivery was suppose to be here today but got "Weather delay - service will resume weather permitting". It was sunny for the whole day and you're telling me this BS? Go with Canadapost or any other courier . Never seen such bad service.Date of experience: February 14, 2018

Name: J
Review: Can someone explain to me how the …Can someone explain to me how the status of my package went from on vechile for delivery at 9am today then at 5pm it goes to weather delay? It has been sunny outside all day and hasn’t snowed in over a week...Thunder Bay is a small city, so can you explain to me how they couldn’t deliver it to my house from the sort facility in 8 hours!? it showed weather delay yesterday at 5:00 am then again at 8:50 pm too? Again, at that time there was no bad weather. I guess it never even made it on a truck that day. The package was supposed to be delivered yesterday. sounds to me they are just changing statuses to whatever just to make up an excuse to cover their butt...weather delay, yeah, OK. I hope future packages from amazon don’t use purolator! This is not an urgent matter, but this service is terrible and being dishonest if claiming weather delay when it’s clearly not. If it were urgent, I would be very mad, so just thought I would warn people! Maybe I’ll get it tomorrow?Date of experience: February 13, 2018

Name: Ariel
Review: PUROLATOR LOST MY PACKAGE!Dell shipped me my unencrypted hard disk back via Ground shipping using Purolator and Purolator lost the package.  Now my unencrypted hard disk is lost with no further information,  no thanks to Purolator.  This is the worst service that I have ever received.  I will be suing Purolator if any of my information is mishandled and if I become a victim of IDENTITY THEFT!Update:  they just put a symphathy reply while they do absolutely nothing!Update 2:  The investigative team found absolutely nothing.  I have no help what so ever.   I DONT UNDERSTAND WITH TRACKING HOW CAN THEY LOSE  A PACKAGE.  Don't they check from point A to point B whether they have all the packages that sent out to reach, they're should have been an internal alarm that something didn't make it to point B.  Is it not stupid for a courier company, not to do internal checks, rather than wait for the customer to report that they did not receive anything.  Upon, my report they kept on telling me to wait for few more days so THEY COULD DEFINITELY LOSE THE PACKAGE WITH NO HOPE OF FINDING IT.   I asked them to post on the bulletin boards that I'll gladly give an award if someone finds my package but I don't even have a confirmation that they did the same.  This is the WORST company.  NEVER DEAL WITH PUROLATOR AGAIN.   They have zero regard for customer packages!.    I refuse to file a claim as the value for my information is a lot more to me then few bucks  plus filing a claim with such PATHETIC company would be WASTE OF MY TIME!I see all these negative reviews posted everyday and definately makes sense.  Its one thing to have a delayed package but a whole another issue to completely have it STOLEN BY YOUR EMPLOYEES OR LOST DUE TO THEIR NEGLIGENCE.Date of experience: February 13, 2018

Name: Wayne
Review: Hollow & worthless apologiesPurolater (MOSTLY LATER) Bad enough I had incorrect information from AVshop in Markham ONT, the item shipped by them would not leave the small item in the drop off box labeled PACKAGE DELIVERY at my front door.  Frankly, I don't think they even rang the door bell as I was home when they came. Now I have to make a trip to get my package.  Looks like "in the same city" is what they shoot for.  Since there are no ZERO stars available, I was forced to give them a one star.As to your request to "look into the matter", I would think a 0.4/10 rating rating should tell you that Purolator needs to fire the top people in the company and find some people who understand what it means to have to go chasing after a parcel that your delivery person already had at the door of my home.  What if I was disabled, poor, no vehicle to go to the industrial area of the city by bus and only a one hour window to arrive there when your warehouse is open after supper. "Sorry for the inconvenience"????.  Those items are not something that an apology works for. Hollow apologies have another ZERO star rating.  Also, trying to phone a local office is as bad as trying to phone CRA.Date of experience: February 13, 2018

Name: Jaden Gnyp
Review: AtrociousThe laziest drivers not even attempting to deliver 80% of my parcels. Don’t recommend using them, so many other shipping businesses that actually care about their jobs and customers. Never using them again. There’s a reason why it has a 0.4 rating.Date of experience: February 13, 2018

Name: Matthew Clancy
Review: Shambolic. Disgraceful. Atrocious.Paid extra money to have my parcel delivered on February 13th, only to find out that the delivery driver did not even attempt delivery at all. Lazy service. 100% would not recommend.Date of experience: February 13, 2018

Name: Jaime Rae
Review: I will not ship with Purolator againI will not ship with Purolator again! Not only was I charged for an expedited service $65 for next morning delivery when the package was 2 days late. The customer services I received when I called was beyond rude. We had a business tender due and none of the deadlines have been met. Purolator is not a reliable and trusty worthy company I would not recommend shipping anything time sensitive with them.Date of experience: February 13, 2018

Name: Jaylene
Review: I ordered a package the 8th of February,I ordered a package the 8th of February, and I was supposed to receive it the 9th. and all I got was weather delay, it’s been warm and sunny and it’s now February the 12.... Purolator I never was happy with ur delivery’s.Date of experience: February 12, 2018

Name: Kyle White
Review: STUPID SERVICEGot 2 day shipping and was supposed to arrive on Friday the 9th, 'Delayed in transit due to road / highway closure'. So I tried to be patient as there was a bit of snowfall. However I wait until Monday and its still not in town??? 'Weather delay - service will resume weather permitting' ITS NOT EVEN BAD WEATHER ITS SUNNY. I'm 12 hours away from the departure location, this should not take nearly 6 days to deliver. If this is what a little bit of snow on the ground does to this company, get the f*c k out of Canada. Never using Purolator again.Date of experience: February 12, 2018

Name: Patricia McCunn
Review: Left in the pouring rain.Large packages delivered 2 days in a row and left in the pouring rain on my driveway, easily visible to all walking or driving by.  I have a huge carport and covered sidewalk. No dogs.  No other delivery company has ever done that. Completely unacceptable.Date of experience: February 12, 2018

Name: Faith
Review: Where are you?I was returning Shaw receivers and the shipping boxes arrived in 2 days. I packed them and called purolator to schedule pick up the next day. They called while I was at work and said the driver could not find the address. By the time I was able to call back I had missed pick up for that day. I rescheduled pick up for the next day. On my first break from work I noticed another message on my phone from purolator, again saying the driver could not find the address.  I spent my lunch hour going through the automated system and then the live operator, only to arrive home and find they had not picked up again! I ended up paying to send through Canada Post as at least I know it will get there. I do not understand how they could find the place to drop off the boxes but not find it for pick up. I can plug my address into Google maps and find it instantly!Date of experience: February 10, 2018

Name: Beverly Wong
Review: Never bother to knockThey never knock on the door, just leaves right away and makes you go all the way to the office to pick up package.  I have not heard a single good thing about Purolator and there are good reasons as you see all the one star reviews here.Date of experience: February 09, 2018

Name: Alina Rama
Review: No paper notificationToday I received call that my package is available for pickup at Silver Star Blvd location (Toronto).  Imagine my surprise since there was NO knock on my door - I'm on maternity leave - and there is no way I would've left my house yesterday during a snow storm. There was also no notice left that someone actually tried to deliver the package. This is the 2nd time something like this happened (no paper notice, just a phone call) so it's becoming a pattern. Are the drivers just selectively delivering packages now? I'm extremely disappointed in the service and also because Toys R Us chose Purolator. I wish they used Canada Post as they did in the past and there were no issues.Date of experience: February 09, 2018

Name: Sukhpal

Name: David Shih
Review: Purolator = Late packages every time!I am an Amazon Prime member and I order a package that was supposed to arrive Tue Feb 06. Today I'm once again sitting and waiting for this package and it is close to the end of business day and still nothing.  I only have this issue from Purolator never with Fed Ex or Canada post which seems to deliver when they are supposed too. Purolator needs to get their act together!Update: So another day gone and we are on Feb 8th DAY 3! Lol.  The status is now changed again to Weather delay.  Only delivery service to not deliver when it's clear out. I pressed and asked if he could call the driver to be sure as I have NO faith it would arrive.  He assured me that it would.Date of experience: February 07, 2018

Name: mytheras
Review: Purolator never keeps it's tracking …Purolator never keeps it's tracking info for the customer updated(always approx. 8 hours late) which is bad if you've been waiting all day. Name: john lucas
Review: Purolator-unpredictable,unreliable,total waste of time and moneyI buy A lot of things on amazon, and the main carrier is purolator , first dozen times not a problem, but the past month if they even show up you’ll probably find them kocking once then running back to their truck,  day after day it’s marked “item on truck for delivery “ so wait around from 9am to 8pm only for no one to show... caught them leaving the package once with out even knocking, but hey, at least I got my package That day...  once in a while is okay, things happen.  But this has been week after week for a month now.   Definitely a waste of time and money shipping with these guys, the delivery drivers don’t care, skip houses to make it home sooner I bet.Date of experience: February 02, 2018

Name: A K
Review: Purolator is THE WORSTPurolator is THE WORST! Consumer, please avoid this courier by all means!I live in the apartment building and had several parcels that were supposed to be delivered by Purolator. HA! They NEVER deliver. NEVER!!! I am SOOOOO p*** off with their service!Purolator's management must do something to change their delivery service or this company will go out of business very soon.Date of experience: February 02, 2018

Name: R lamba
Review: I chose Purolator from my vendors …I chose Purolator from my vendors choice of couriers, three day shipping to my door with tracking! Vendor says I'm on hook for the extra delivery charge regardless of couriers failings, that's only $7 but it's really annoying after wasting an entire day of my life waiting for the parcel. An irritant that could've been avoided had I been emailed there would be a delay.What really pisses me off is I thought I chose a courier instead of the incompetents at CanadaPost only to find out Purolator is CanadaPost!  W.T.F! no wonder...never again. Tell me Purolator how do I get a day of my life back? I told the vendor if they don't take responsibility for their choice of sub-contractors slack performance ($7 refund) there will no more repeat business and I cancelled my account.Date of experience: February 02, 2018

Review: your delivery people are LOSERSyour delivery people are LOSERS. if they see a building they never come up without our knowledge your company send my package back to shipper. waste of time.Date of experience: February 01, 2018

Review: I am now officially scared after …I am now officially scared after reading these reviews:(.  In the process of shipping a pioneer plasma tv from Victoria BC to Winnipeg.  Fingers crossed🤞😢Date of experience: February 01, 2018

Name: S V
Review: Transparency: A review I posted to google reviewsTAKE THE TIME TO READ THIS REVIEW. IT COULD SAVE YOU TIME/MONEY/FRUSTRATION.Not everyone reads these reviews but the way this company is run only serves to never have my business again. I will walk to a store before I buy something online that says Purolator "delivers" it. And I have to put quotes around deliver because words like "delivery", "responsible", "guarantee" are jokes. Meaningless words. Or more accurately, bold faced lies. I am going to quote a review from Jason Pugh - "I will NEVER use Purolator ever again. This operation is run by incompetent liars. Citing a snow storm from 1.5 week ago as reason to stop delivering today at 4:34. Said it was "bad weather" on the nicest day so far of 2017. Paid extra to have package GUARANTEED to be delivered today. If the lazy, lying, incompetent driver was too lazy to finish then maybe he should be fired. PATHETIC!"Why quote this? Because if you do read my review, do your research and confirm what kind of company this is (I would call them a garbage company but my trash actually gets picked up). They "lost" my last order, so the company I ordered from replaced the order with a guarantee delivery of January 3 2018 to Fredericton NB. The package left Dieppe (about a 2 or 3 hour drive to Fredericton, give or take) at 0600. The package was then in transit to Fredericton from Dieppe but at 1900 (an hour from their latest delivery time), after spending hours waiting for this delivery I got an update saying they couldn't deliver due to the bad weather conditions. The reasons I am giving so many details is when Jason gave his review, he got a reply saying "oh the weather was bad, we couldn't do our job" but Jason made it sound like the weather was quite fine, in fact. So check for yourself. Fredericton weather/Dieppe weather (New Brunswick) for the date of January 3, 2018 and see for yourself the terrible weather conditions that forced them from their deliveries. I am also being specific because today, January 4, 2018, we are expecting a blizzard sometime in the afternoon (the forecast made no indication of any poor weather for the 3rd and was very specific to Jan 4). As of now (0945), it's still a really nice day. So does Purolator stop deliveries because of the weather, tomorrow? "Too bad. Can’t deliver your package today. Supposed to snow tomorrow".  I think Jason said it right. Laziness. The weather was fine yesterday and this is inexcusable behavior. If you employ lazy, useless people, then try to blame it on the weather, eventually someone is going to come by and clearly call you out on your actions. This is intolerable and I will make sure as many people know about this kind of service. And this won’t be the only place I leave this review/complaint. Bottom line, you take people's money and do not deliver on your promises. They likely lied about Jason's storm when he said it was clear, but I won’t let them lie about mine. You have the info. Do the research if you have doubts. It might cost you more than money if you don't. What a waste of time. For me, never again.EDIT: Because I feel transparency is important, I am behooved to mention that this actually happened again. Same city. Same courier. Same excuse. Natural disaster or weather related delay for the date of Jan 31/2018. And to make things easier for everyone "time and date" (all one word) .com has a neat feature where you can look up historical weather for specific cities, on specific dates. Let's take a look, shall we.So from 0600 to 1200, weather shows as "passing clouds". Gosh, do you think the driver has a fear of clouds? Nah, that is just stupid. Obviously the perilous weather that prevented them from doing their job happened later in the day. As a responsible company with customers that they ensure are taken care of and knowing all the work they do to maintain public trust, we can be sure there was some kind of awful, unmanageable weather condition that just could not be handled and we cant blame them for that. So what was it? Hurricane? Blizzard? Flood? Wrath of God?Weather from 1200 to 1800, Fredericton, New Brunswick, Wednesday, January 31, 2018...."Sunny".Date of experience: February 01, 2018

Name: Jennifer Javier
Review: THE WORSTIf I can give them a “0” I would. Was home ALL day waiting for my package to arrive. Purolator delivery person buzzed me, the call was disconnected even before I can buzz him in. I was expecting for him to call back so I can actually buzz him in but he didn’t. I get an email saying that they’ve missed me. SERIOUSLY. He did not leave any notices or anything anywhere. Called purolator and asked if I can just pick it up myself. They said they’re not sure and most likely it’ll have to be the next day. I advised them of what had happened and told me that they are sure that these drivers try their best to deliver the packages. YEAH, sure he tried he didn’t even try calling again and just left. I dislike purolator and their service over all. Not very helpful. Honestly, they don’t even deserve a star.Date of experience: January 29, 2018

Review: Purolator is absolutely horrible.Purolator is absolutely horrible.I ordered some stuff online and was waiting for it to come.Didn't realize but apparently Purolator came for delivery but since they didn't leave a note or anything, I wasn't sure what I was supposed to do next.I tried emailing them, contacting them via phone but they never got back to for both means.Also used the live chat for help but all they did was provide me a phone number and told me to contact on my own. Name: S
Review: I give Purolator one star because it is late and unaccountable.I give Purolator one star because it is impossible to give them less. Sent an extremely important package through overnight shipping. Was assured it would be there by 5pm the next day. It was 17 hours late. This resulted in a cost of a few hundred dollars to me, and time off work to resolve the issue. I spoke with customer service as soon as the issue was identified but they took no responsibility for delay and failed to provide any sort of compensation. Individuals and businesses use this service because they require packages to be at a certain place by a certain time. Failure to take any accountability for that commitment is a failure on behalf of the company's core mandate.Update: It is clear that the reply Purolator puts up in response to posts on this site is a standard response. They ask you to contact them directly so that they can get the package number and look into what's happening. This makes it look like Purolator is addressing the issue: they are not. As noted in the post above, I spoke directly to a customer service rep as soon as the issue was identified and was informed, in no uncertain terms, that they wouldn't do anything. As there is no opportunity to reply to their reply post on this site, I am updating the original post.Date of experience: January 25, 2018

Name: Kam Orth
Review: "Delivery" company lolI have been waiting a week for 2 day shipping from Amazon. My buzzer finally rang and in the time it took me to buzz open the door and get down a single flight of stairs (a few seconds at most) the driver and truck were both nowhere to be seen. A few minutes later the tracking status changed to failed and I had to get on the phone to customer service to find out what was going on. The call centre informed me that it would be Monday at the earliest that I would be able to either have it redelivered or dropped off somewhere else for me to pick up because it would be going back to Nanaimo (hours drive away, and we can't drive due to disability anyway) for the weekend. After calling the Nanaimo office (and hitting a random staff extension as they don't have a secretary or customer service rep apparently) I was lucky enough to get someone who was willing to call the driver on his phone and ask him to try again. I needed this stuff 3 days ago, I DEFINITELY need it this weekend, and I was there to receive it. I am FUMING at the run around this has caused. If I'm lucky, the driver might have time to try to deliver it again today, otherwise I might be able to get a ride from a friend to pick it up tomorrow. If the driver had waited 10 seconds at the door no one would be having to deal with this, but apparently that is too much to expect. UPDATE - Apparently leaving it with their agent here in town was too much and I have to wait until Monday anyway. Another failed delivery attempt email too, despite not even buzzing and giving us absolutely no way of knowing he was here at all. This is the most pathetic service I received from any company ever.Date of experience: January 20, 2018

Name: Dan Baker
Review: 2 deliveries same day/same depot - one comes/other claims "adverse weather"So I am fixing up a truck and ordered a bunch of parts off of Amazon.  4 orders in total coming through Purolator.  2 packages show up today in one Purolator truck and I receive another package from UPS.  The other 2 packages do not arrive and when I check status it shows "adverse weather conditions"  So how did the other truck (which came from the same depot, Dartmouth NS) deliver in the adverse conditions?  THERE WASN'T ANY.  Was a sunny today.  Same issue happened last week, claimed adverse conditions, when it was sunny that day and a UPS truck delivered.  I have already chatted with the online help, said they were going to call the depot but that was 2 hours ago, guess I will have to wait until the "adverse sunny day" clears!Date of experience: January 19, 2018

Name: Anastasia Linska
Review: NEVER EVER USE PUROLATOR.NEVER EVER USE PUROLATOR.I ordered a tv with Best Buy to be shipped. They use Purolator as their distributor. I went online and the tracking said "Delivery attempt was made - receiver unavailable". I called them the next day and rescheduled the delivery for the day after, and the same situation happened. There is no way we couldn't hear the bell or knock at the door, since i spend the whole day in the living room where the entrance is. ALSO, I NEVER EVER missed a Canada post mailman and FedEx delivery. It makes me wonder if purolator delivery guy even bothered to come with my package. He probably did not want to carry the heavy item and instead wanted to make me pick it up myself at the depot. Also, the customer service is no help. They are rude and won't bother doing anything or contacting the driver(I was wondering maybe he got the wrong address), they just offered me a redelivery, BUT I CAN'T STAY HOME 3 DAYS IN A ROW WONDERING IF THE DELIVERY GUY WILLL ACTUALLY COME. Name: MB
Review: The deliverer didn't ring the doorbellA company sent me a package via Purolator. I was home when the Purolator guy arrived, but he didn't ring the doorbell. I have to pick up the package at a shipping center on Monday and wait for three days to have it since it's Friday today.Date of experience: January 12, 2018

Name: Foe Smasher
Review: This package sat at a depot in …This package sat at a depot in Penticton for 2 weeks. I do not live it Penticton and I cannot pick up the package there. I made this very clear to the person at the depot in Penticton on December 29th. I specifically told them that I wanted the package delivered to my house and I made sure they had the correct address. 2 weeks later they still had not delivered it. Furthermore,  I spoke with Melisa L on a Purolator chat line on January 10th. She told me the package would be delivered on the 11th. The package was not delivered and the tracking report said it was due to weather. This is the same excuse used 2 weeks earlier. The weather had been very mild for the last 2 weeks. On January 11th there was a temperature of -4 C and light snow. This can be confirmed by Environment Canada. The roads are plowed every day and have been very good. For Purolator to claim a delay due to weather, not once, but twice is nothing but a pure lie.  In the end I told them to send it back. They never did deliver the package. How can such a company stay in business?Date of experience: January 12, 2018

Name: Justin Boyce
Review: I am back again.I am back again.This is my 3rd time dealing with a Purolator problem. I made an order from MEC back on Dec 23rd. The item should have arrived within 5 business days. Here we are, Jan 12 2018 and the package is still in Ontario. Seriously? What is going on?The tracking number is: BVB000113244 Absolute joke I am getting so tired of this. I don't understand what happened. I know things get delayed but I've had stuff from China and other countries come faster than this. It's 2 provinces away. Come on now.NOT GOODDate of experience: January 12, 2018

Name: LA S
Review: The Purolator driver said the weather was too bad to deliver my package today January 11 2018 in Edmonton AB. ?????Parcel on the truck for delivery all day. I called and was told it would be delivered by 8 pm.No updated tracking information until it was too late to go to the depot which is 5 minutes from my home. The tracking shows it was updated at 530 but I wasn’t able to see that update until 745pm.  Depot closes at 8pm The delivery driver indicated on the tracking that delivery was delayed due to weather. Other than winter there are no weather issues in Edmonton today. So basically it would appear that the driver drove to my end of town decided to just stop and the depot and dump his/her stuff off. I’ve asked the awesome customer service rep to make sure that it does not get put back on the truck tomorrow. I will pick it up myself and will not depend on Purolator to deliver any packages to my home again nor will I pay for express delivery cause....well as you see it’s a waste of money.....and please do not insult me with a cookie cutter response. You clearly have a problem with your delivery drivers. One complaint is even similar to mine: Mysterious inclement weather only experienced by Purolator.  Update: my package was not left at the depot today as requested.Date of experience: January 12, 2018

Name: Jordan Waye
Review: This is my first time using PurolatorThis is my first time using Purolator, and honestly it's egregious. I was expecting a package to arrive, the tracking number said it was picked up, yet the entire day went without any notification at all. No attempts were made to contact me and apparently this was a "delay" that affected so many people that they couldn't even send an email to explain. I talked to 2 representatives, which both gave different answers. I just wanted a reason why, but none of them could offer an explanation, only saying that it was going to arrive tomorrow. This was the only day I could accept the package, as it is my day off. And par for the course, when asked if there was any compensation for the delay, I had to ask 2 separate times and then directly and still do not have a response.Why is it so hard to respond to customers? It absolutely should not be this difficult.If I have a choice in the future, unless they make changes, I will never use nor recommend Purolator.Update: This is the response I received from their customer care team.Thank you for taking the time to send us the tracking number. Once again, we’re very sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused.The package in question was shipped out on January 10th from Dieppe, NB and was expected to be delivered in Saint John, NB on January 11th. Unfortunately the local shipment was sorted by mistake to our depot in Fredericton which has reported that due to the depot closure last Friday (winter storm), they are still processing a backlog of freight and experiencing delays. The package has been scanned into the Fredericton terminal this morning, at which point the error was noted. The package will be forwarded to Saint John over the weekend and the delivery is expected to be done on Monday, January 15th.To answer your question you had mentioned on your review regarding compensation, Purolator’s Guaranteed Refund Program covers shipments that were sent with the Express service, but unfortunately not shipment sent with the regular ground service. As the shipment was sent with the regular ground service, a refund for the shipping costs would not be available.-At first I assumed it was a joke, how grossly incompetent does a shipping company have to be? No, unfortunately I have to wait until Monday, while crossing my fingers and hoping they didn't somehow further mess anything up or break the package.Funny thing happened though, I got an apology from amazon.ca this morning before Purolator. Even without me directly reviewing them, they saw something was wrong.If they can do it, why can't the company that lost the package?Date of experience: January 12, 2018

Name: Kristylized D
Review: Not impressedNot impressed. Takes just as long as regular mail but with worse tracking! My package didn't even make it by the expected delivery date.Date of experience: January 11, 2018

Name: Barb
Review: Do NOT use Purolator or UPS for International ShipmentsPurolator uses UPS for international shipments. They provide limited tracking information and do not update their information once clarifications are made. What you need to do is assume they have lost the package if it sits for a couple of days at a depot. I wish I did that. I actually trusted they were trying to locate it and send it.Once they lose it, they do not call you. It's up to you to figure out who to call. I have had 3 different agents all end up not responding to me once they got tricky questions like. "Is the address now clear. It was provided on Dec 30 - two days after the package was supposed to be delivered" Whatever you do, don't assume they can deliver. Don't assume they will truthfully display that they were contacted to update the address.Once questions start getting asked, they remove the tracking so you know nothing.If they lose a package, expect their customer tracking agents to avoid you. They cannot even get answers to basic questions like "where is the package?" "Can you tell me whether the clarification of the address has been understood." "Why is the package still sitting at the depot after one and a half weeks after the address was clarified again." "Is the package lost" "Are you getting another company to deliver the package." Once you start asking these simple questions, they stop contacting you after telling you to wait.Apparently, if they don't understand an address because it is not exactly like the USA or Canada, you are not going to get delivery. They apparently, have limited knowledge of international addresses, Google maps, or basic geography. So if you have to courier internationally, DHL has been recommended. DO NOT USE EITHER PUROLATOR OR UPS. They are not capable of understanding international addresses.I have sent an email to the contact provided below. I will update on the response.Date of experience: January 10, 2018

Name: PeterM
Review: yesterday and few months ago SAME situationfew months ago: delivery attempt were marked - delivery never was doneyesterday /January 8.2018/ delivery was marked, all my family at home, delivery NOT DONE. Customer service Rep. lied: driver made mistake, driver used not proper code,Date of experience: January 09, 2018

Amazon needs to stop using this company.Date of experience: January 09, 2018

Name: Tony Archer
Review: Never attempted to deliver.Never attempted to deliver and required calling them to deal with my package.Date of experience: January 08, 2018

They havent provided the drivers with a cellphone.  It is better to deliver something by ourselves than depending on their stupid serviceDate of experience: January 08, 2018

Name: David Corscadden
Review: Well its a bright sunny day in Edmonton …Well its a bright sunny day in Edmonton as was yesterday. I have spent 2 days sitting in my home waiting for my shipment that has been out for delivery for 2 days now. The roads are dry and its about 0c for the last 2 days but somehow there is a weather delay on the north side of Edmonton, go figure. Contacted the chat online and was told that it will come tomorrow but tracking says Monday so which day should I spend indoors again? tracking number is 331278135057 Happy that they got it to Edmonton in a timely fashion but....a weather delay, come on now, its sunny and warm by Edmonton standards. If you wait till spring it might get better!Jan 5, 2018	11:18 a.m.	Edmonton (north/nord), AB	Weather delay - service will resume weather permittingJan 4, 2018	4:12 p.m.	Edmonton (north/nord), AB	Weather delay - service will resume weather permittingJan 4, 2018	8:23 a.m.	Edmonton (north/nord), AB	On vehicle for deliveryJan 4, 2018	3:44 a.m.	Edmonton (north/nord), AB	Arrived at sort facilityJan 4, 2018	3:37 a.m.	Edmonton (north/nord), AB	Arrived at sort facilityJan 2, 2018	9:39 p.m.	Vancouver, BC	Departed sort facilityJan 2, 2018	9:10 p.m.	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facilityJan 2, 2018	4:33 p.m.	Port Kells	Arrived at sort facilityJan 2, 2018	3:31 p.m.	Port Kells	Picked up by Purolator at LANGLEY BCJan 2, 2018	12:49 p.m.	Purolator	Shipping label createdDate of experience: January 05, 2018

Name: Kat
Review: Rude CSPackage was supposed to be redelivered as I missed it the day before. Instead they left it for pick up in another part of town and never left me a slip for the second time in a row. When I called CS the man was very rude or just had terrible phone manner. Of course I accidentally slipped and said "because purolator f***ed up". Which, is my fault and I was sorry I said a swear word.. He got really huffy about it, when I tried to apologize for saying the F word he just kept interrupting me. Then was very condescending, inquired why I did not want to take an almost 30 minute bus ride in -30 degree weather to pick up a 20 pound package. While continuously interrupting me while i tried to answer. I have worked CS for a decade, and I get that I said a 'bad word', but to be talked down to like a child for 10 minutes afterwards? I constantly have issues with this company not delivering things but at this point, I wont order from stores that use purolator anymore it's too ridiculous.Date of experience: January 05, 2018

Name: Willy
Review: AVOID THIS CRAP - WORST COMPANY EVERThis review got 1 star because there is no way to put a negative or 0 stars.My package was supposed to be delivered on January 2nd (Tracking number DCM003696184) As of Jan 4 no notification was delivered, I reached Purolator and they said the buzzer code was needed and that was the reason why they neither delivered the package nor left any notification.All carriers leave notifications in the reception area at the entrance of the building but Purolator decided that they would not because they needed a buzzer code to deliver the package in my suite.... Amazing right? A buzzer code to be able to leave a notification in the reception just as all the other carries (and even Purolator when they want to do it)I realized about this issue because I first reached Amazon since the seller unfortunately sent the package through Purolator.AVOID this company, no criteria people working on this company, so far Canada Post is the best.Date of experience: January 05, 2018

Name: mike edie
Review: AVOID AT ALL COSTS sticks are smarter than staff therei had an order of medicine shipped thru pur (crap) olator supposed to receive it on the second of January sat home all day waiting for it checked the tracking said it was attempted delivery but nobody showed up called said they would take care of the issue delivery next day guaranteed wasted another day waiting and checked online once again said it had been attempted deliver in early afternoon no one showed up. seen a truck drive by shortly before the delivery was supposedly tried . looking over the shipping label there is no description of what kind of street the house is on happens to be a street not a place bay or any other thing that can and has been used to describe a street . now common sense would be if you do not or can not tell where it should go use the POSTAL CODE to get an accurate address which no one at puolator is smart enough to figure out .Date of experience: January 04, 2018

Name: Ste Van Haous
Review: purolator sucks bals2 days in a row my package was supposed to be delivered but keep getting "weather delays" in my city even though the weather is completely fine in my city and pretty much everywhere around it, no bad road conditions etc its honestly just tiring that every single postal( except for d band) service is either okay or terrible smell my balls purolatorDate of experience: January 04, 2018

Name: William
Review: There service is garbage they send …There service is garbage they send items over to post office to deliver instead complete trash stay away from purolaterDate of experience: January 03, 2018

Name: Cheryll Carino Bailon
Review: Christmas package MIAReceived an email that my package got delivered at my front door today at 12:05 pm. We were in the living room at this time watching a movie and by the time I read my email it was 1:00pm. I heard no doorbell. I phoned customer care right away and they said they will call me back before end of day. I asked why they didn't doorbell? She confirmed there's a note SRO on the order...(no idea what that means). Anyway I think with many instances where packages are stolen on front porches these days they shouldn't safe drop parcels at front door. At least doorbell when someone is expecting a package they will be waiting for it like I did. I've waited since dec 26. To get this package and why the holdup? Should the customer be put up to this? I made the purchase off the retailer and purolator is the trusted courier. If instances like these should occur then why bother shipping to home. I could have just opted for store pick up? At least rest assured I will be getting my commodity. I am not truly impressed right now. I have purchased a lot online from the same retailer shipped to my home and all I can say this is the first time this happened to me. Anyway received a follow up cal from Donna to advise they will phone meBack tomorrow to confirm if the truckers gps had some error of some sort. I really hope my package shows up. These were Christmas presents to me from my in laws. What really sucks is these items are no longer available online for me to attain. Christmas gone bad!Date of experience: January 02, 2018

Name: Ashley Ortizo
Review: Worst Delivery!Purolator was suppose to deliver my package today. When I checked the tracking it said they came at 12:52pm. I booked the day off just to wait for the package. I called them at 1:00pm to ask why I never heard a knock at my door or nothing. I was so upset wasted my time and this is the second time they tired to deliver it. They never even went upstairs or made an effort to do their job. Horrible service.Date of experience: January 02, 2018

Name: Babs
Review: Waiting at home for a deliveryWaiting at home for a delivery, bell rang, at the door seconds later, truck driving away. Purolator would not send the truck back, though had them on the phone immediately. Customer disservice. This is Friday and now I cannot get the equipment until Tuesday night, and I have to go to another city to pick it up, myself. First error could have been solved, second refusal to fix the customer problem indicates systemic disregard for customers, and certainly no wish to go the extra mile, when needed. Less than a mile, likely!Date of experience: December 30, 2017

Name: Teala
Review: Never againHalf a star, really, only because so far customer service hasn't been rude like others have mentioned, although they are unhelpful. We paid for a 24hr service delivery and 48 hrs later and counting I still haven't received my package. I have a house guest who came for Christmas who is now days late getting home (8hrs away) because her departure depends on receiving this package. She is understandably very upset. The only information I've been able to get from Purolator is that the package was given to a local agent and should have arrived by now. They are supposedly looking into it and will get back to me "by the end of the day". Totally unacceptable. The impact of Purolator's (and their partners') poor service has potential to create emotional and financial distress to people -- the people the business depends on to pay for their services. Trust is totally lost.Date of experience: December 29, 2017

Name: Princess2
Review: Awful Customer ServiceNo transperency, they lie and are incredibly rude! Don't bother with their Chat option for Tracking! So so abrupt and rude!! Awful awful company! Totally unreliable!!Date of experience: December 28, 2017

Name: Ryan T Carey
Review: 0 stars if i could0 stars if i could. This company is the best example of how not to run a company. Horrible customer service, God awful shipping times. They don't even get it to you in the window quoted. Had a laptop that was suppose to arrive on the 19th. Well they had it in Canada 140kms away from me on the 19th, but the lazy useless employees couldn't get it delivered that far in 3 DAYS before the weekend before Christmas. 3 days for 140kms. Worst service ever. From now on if i order anything from anywhere and they try to ship purolator i will immediately cancel the order. Would rather not give these thieving idiots any business.Date of experience: December 25, 2017

Name: Shirley Van Doesburg
Review: They do deliver but they don't to my …They do deliver but they don't to my house. I had a few orders from Amazon and they were delivered by Purolator. I live out in the country near Leduc and every time I get a parcel It gets delivered to New Sarepta depot and I am asked to pick it up. I called Purolator and asked if they deliver to me and was told yes they do. So why then are my parcels always delivered to New Sapepta depot?. I called Purolator the other day as I was expecting another parcel , and explained what was going on and she said no it will be delivered to my address not to the depot. I thought great finally my complaining worked well then I get a call from New Sarepta depot again. So it is going back to Purolator so it can be delivered to my home as I paid for delivery not for me to pick it up . I am not sure if this is a Purolator problem or driver one..  It is a pain to do this as it adds a week to my delivery time as New Saprepta has to wait for them to pick it up again and then I have to wait for them to deliver it to me..Date of experience: December 23, 2017

Name: Daniel Pigeau
Review: Ordered a gift from amazonOrdered a gift from amazon.  Was supposed to be here december 16 with two day shipping. When the item did not arrive i tracked the package.  Its last location was 4000 miles away in Vancouver days before. I called purolator and they could not find my purchased item. So its safe to say it wont arrive by christmas so i received a refund from amazon and ill refuse to accept the item from purolator if/when it shows upDate of experience: December 23, 2017

Name: Sudden Equal
Review: Ordered a 40lbs item from amazon.ca …Ordered a 40lbs item from amazon.ca with 2-day guaranteed delivery Dec 16 to a condo.  Tracking shows delivery attempted Dec 20.  Security cameras show dude left truck with slip prewritten, stuck to outside door, and walked away.  Recipient was home all day specifically to receive shipment.Refuses to reattempt at a time convenient to recipient, or perhaps communication between amazon and purolator rather broken.  Perhaps more convenient to have the recipient pick up (and accept liability for damage, etc).  Even an offer to pay for a new shipment from depot to recipient was met with refusal, willing to pay up to $500 to have it delivered to door.  (You'd think one of the drivers would want this cash on the side, but not enterprising enough I guess)Date of experience: December 21, 2017

Name: Gwen Beauregard
Review: It gets worse before it gets better..."At Purolator, we are delivering on holiday promises -- not just in Canada but around the world -- by helping people send holiday packages to their friends, clients and loved ones safely and on time," said Roger Alouche, Senior Director, Operations at Purolator. "Whether our customers are sending a business order to a client in a neighbouring town or getting a gift to a family member across the ocean, we are here to make the holiday shipping process as stress-free as possible."MIKE IS A VERY BUSY MAN!Note: I never ever write Reviews of companies and wouldn't, especially when I'm raging mad! PUROLATOR is NOT the one and only company that outrages customers for their sloppy outsourced drivers. Other than FED-Ex and UPS the rest of the Couriers are pretty godawful. Either they need to be full time, well paid employees ofthese companies or they should get out of the businessof package delivery. They can barely deliver snail mail.Not ALL drivers are bad. Just the ones that drive for Purolator et al where they grab anybody with a truck class driver's licenseduring really heavy periods such as Holidays.Those drivers are under enormous pressure and are being paid in time blocks with 100 orders an hour!They are indentured slaves! The drivers have their instructions: "Get in. Get out. In triple time. Do not pass Go, do not collect a get out jail pass. No time to file your nails!You're  fired!" You get what you pay for!I feel for the drivers. I feel even more for CustomerSupport people who end up taking all the flack forlousy Management. It's not a job you would want.This is a logistics nightmare and is getting worse as the online retailers are scrambling to meet ever increasingautomated work loads. They need an entire army ofprofessional drivers. In the meanwhile companies like Amazon are raking in BILLIONS of dollars whilst messing with their customer base. Their hiring practices are ghastly! It's a grand slam scam! I've been a Prime customer for years and order a lot from them. It has gotten way out of hand with very sketchy service. Meanwhile, pricing is ridiculouslyexpensive. Wait for the army of drones! Won't that be fun?@_@FIY: I am not, and never have been, an employeeof any online retailer, let alone of a Courier service.But, I have owned/operated a small business wherecustomer service was the backbone of my business.Re-tired. :)Date of experience: December 21, 2017

Review: Unfortunately I'm a slave to Amazon and …Unfortunately I'm a slave to Amazon and they use this company. Yet another package sent via purolator magically doesn't make it to the destination. Not to mention the tracking shows the product several cities away. Confusing as to how a company could be so poorly run to allow such incompetent drivers to lie/laze around all day. I've received my refund from Amazon but I'm absolutely shocked at the state of this company. Maybe it's time for some new tracking/scanning practices that actually work or hire someone that prefers to do their job rather than sitting in their purolator truck on tinder. Review: HorribleHorrible. Ordered something to be delivered by the 15th of December. No updates online for my package. RIDICULOUS! Why pay extra for something to arrive by a certain time when you’re just going to be let down? And really? Nothing can be done until after the weekend? Poor service and will never deal with them again.Date of experience: December 16, 2017

Name: Timour Savine
Review: if i could post zero stars i wouldif i could post zero stars i would. Review: These guys are the reason pop tarts have instructionsPaid extra for faster delivery parcel was to be here the 8th.
