Review: Don't fool yourself this is not a starDon't fool yourself this is not a star, it is a big fat zero!Purolator you did it again, you guys must be the worst idiots in the business. So far you didn't get one delivery right.Just go to hell, will you please?Date of experience: July 18, 2017

Name: Irvan Pahwa
Review: I wish I could give 0 rating to the …I wish I could give 0 rating to the courier service. The first attempt was unsuccessful because my buzzer was not clear to the courier, re-delivery was attempted and even after chatting with live support and mention him the buzzer number 3 time that it is 30, the re delivery was unsuccessful. I have been using Amazon Prime, but the other courier services, UPS and Canada Post always deliver on time and their first delivery is successful If by any chance they are unable to deliver they will drop it to the nearest location, which I can pick up the same day. This is the most unprofessional courier company I have ever come through. Even for dropping the courier to the pickup location (which is quite far from my location), they need 2-3 days. Even after getting so poor rating and bad reviews from their customers they have not improved their services. I wonder why I should pay Amazon for prime service when they have so unprofessional courier service.Date of experience: July 18, 2017

Name: Amanda
Review: Frustrated Amazon Prime CustomerIn what seems to be a trend, I'm an Amazon Prime client who has had an order mucked up by Purolator. I was expecting a package today only to come home to a 'we missed you' notice. I live in an apartment with concierge that collects all packages. To get in to the building/to my door, any delivery person has to go through them. For some inexplicable reason, the Purolator delivery person passed them and left a note on my door saying they missed me and that I have to come pick up my package clear across town in 5 days or my package would be let go. First of all, excuse me? What kind of service is this? It's one thing if Purolator and I had an agreement that I would be home and this would be the penalty, but making demands of me when they're the third party here? Rude and ridiculous. Never mind that regular working hours conflict with delivery hours and it's more likely no one is home. Never mind that the place they've told me to pick up from is quite far and I don't drive. The whole point of delivery is that you don't pick up! I had an agreement with Amazon, no mention of having to be home (which I've never ever had to do for another Amazon carrier, even when having a bed delivered!) why should I be expected to find my way to their office? I still don't understand why they passed the concierge or didn't leave it by my door. It's not a signature required delivery. Now, at this point, I checked in with Amazon, who says delivery will be re-attempted next business day. Given the note Purolator left me, I didn't trust this. What a good thing I didn't. I gave their customer service a call where I was informed that no, they had no plans to attempt delivery again. I would like to point out that every other delivery service does this. I explained what happened and she said the best she could do is arrange for another attempt on Tuesday because they've got some cut off system for requesting the next business day. It's strange that their office is open on a Saturday but they don't deliver and Friday is too late request for Monday. I stressed that the concierge will need to take the package, because as someone with regular work hours, being home for delivery is impossible and I'm sure Purolator knows this. She promised me they would but given the experience so far and others' reviews I'm very concerned about whether I'll receive my package and what shape it'll be in (it's electronics) and I don't understand why I can't at least get it Monday. It's not my fault this happened. I would've given 1 star but the customer service rep was pleasant and competent. I like to be fair and she did what she could to help me, so that star is hers alone. She has been the only positive representation of this company so far. I will be contacting Amazon to lodge a complaint. Imagine if I had relied on expecting another attempt based on what Amazon told me. All that money spent would be gone. I am not confident I will receive my package this Tuesday given everything that has happened. I am expecting to get another 'we missed you' notice and for the concierge to tell me they didn't speak to them. We'll see. If I get it, I will be inspecting it thoroughly for damage. I would really like to receive it tomorrow or Monday. Delivery problems is not what I pay Amazon Prime for.Date of experience: July 15, 2017

Name: A.J. KO
Review: Almost always late, almost always lyingI pay a lot of money for an Amazon Prime account due to the free two day shipping, however every single time I see Purolator as the delivery company I know it will almost certainly be late.  Roughly 75% of packages in my order history are "delayed due to weather or natural disaster", (most of those were "on the truck" on sunny, clear days.) I am currently waiting on several packages from Amazon, one of which has been delayed due to being shipped two provinces away from mine.If you contact Amazon customer service, you can request to have them remove Purolator as a shipping option when possible.  Unfortunately, sometimes Purolator remains the only possibility.  Still, it's worth doing as you will get more of your packages on time.Date of experience: July 14, 2017

Name: Lee Van Adel
Review: If I could I would give them 0 starsIf I could I would give them 0 stars. Luckily they actually tried delivering the package this time and when I said I wasn't home they said I could pick it up at the depot however the depot isn't even in the same city. Called Purolator to figure out why and they said they don't normally use their Toronto locations....Date of experience: July 14, 2017

Name: Cortland Mass
Review: WaitingSaid my package was on the truck and then said it couldn't be delivered cause it never made its way onto the truck. That was yesterday. Today I'm still waiting for my package (that says it's on the truck yet again) and it's taking forever. I guess we will see if I even get it today.Date of experience: July 14, 2017

Name: Kimberly Deering
Review: Amazon needs to stop using Purolator!!Amazon needs to stop using Purolator!!I've lived in two different locations in a year and every package I've had delivered with them has been horrible.My latest purchase is my sons bike, now I forgot the buzzer number, but it's not like the company called me to ask for an address correction for two days. Every other delivery company had called me that day or at my door to confirm. So when I finally go online and check why my package hasn't been here for multiple days(prime members pay to get things early) and I update my code they try to deliver, but the delivery person doesn't even wait at my building door for me to run down to grab it.... they leave with my package. Now having to wait to find out were I CANT pick it up because I won't be able to lift the box and my son and train 30 minutes there and then back again. Canada post, UPS have all delivered to me the same days as these without my buzz code and somehow magically I received all of those items.Date of experience: July 14, 2017

Name: Crystal
Review: We have an order with Best Buy for a …We have an order with Best Buy for a change table/dresser for our nursery. As it's 130 pounds we were told that Purolator would call us to arrange a delivery time. On Monday we came home to a delivery notice on our door instructing us to pick this up. I'm 7 months pregnant, and we have a car that I doubt this would fit in, even if I could help lift it. I've contacted Purolator a few times to get this re-delivered only to be told that they're "working on it" and that they need 2 drivers to make the delivery (I understand this as it is a heavy item). I'm worried my order will be sent back due to Purolator's incompetence. Had they phoned on Monday to arrange a delivery time we wouldn't have this problem at all! The fact that they've been unable to organize 2 drivers to deliver this since Monday has me doubting that the package was even on the truck Monday.Date of experience: July 13, 2017

Name: Randy Vis
Review: Absolutely terribleAbsolutely terrible. Should be 0 stars. The have screwed up and even not at all made several Amazon deliveries lately. I had to pick up from them because for whatever reason the driver wouldn't even make an attempt to deliver. The last Amazon order they messed up I paid for one-day (even though I'm a Prime member) and Purolator delivered 3 days later.Date of experience: July 13, 2017

Name: Francois Talbot
Review: Worst company ever, lucky my packages weren't stolenI've unfortunately been using Purolator for years now so like most people here I have dozens of horror stories to share about how bad this company is, but today takes the cake. Amazon Prime Day was yesterday, so I bought a lot of stuff which got delivered today. It's been raining every day for the past month and I live on a busy street, yet the driver thought my front door was a safe location to stack a pile of boxes about the height of a 6 y/o kid. Here's what it looked like : imgur .com/a/JEzzl. I swear the VIZIO logo could easily be seen from the street. I'm lucky nothing had been stolen (that I know of), but now everyone knows I own a bunch of new stuff, which doesn't male me feel safe one bit. I'm expecting more boxes but I won't be home for a few days, so chances are the next batch is gonna stand there for a while, and I know for a fact that my drivers never bother reading the notes I leave for them on my door. Anyway, wish I could give Purolator a big zero and, sadly, I'm still stuck with them because of Amazon and some others... :(Date of experience: July 13, 2017

Name: Derek
Review: My daughter was 2 hours away and needed …My daughter was 2 hours away and needed her passport for a flight leaving noon the next day,  I was going to drive it down but visited the local Purolator depot to inquire about express shipping options 1st.  They assured me the guaranteed 9am delivery option would not let me down so I happily paid $65 and went on with my day.  To make a long story short,  phone calls began around 10am, 2 hours of back and forth the envelope arrived at 1:00 and the driver said if we didn't call it would have been end of day because for whatever the reason the sticker fell off.Needless to say the flight was missed and we learnt a great lesson.  Understanding that things happen and not really upset at this point I phoned Purolator to inquire about a refund, figuring that it was common sense with delivery at 1 and payment for 9am I thought it was a no brainer.The call began with attitude before they even had the invoice number or any information, I was told that nothing is guaranteed...even the expensive guaranteed service I was sold.  After review still with attitude I was provided a $30 credit which is something but still didn't seem right, the way I was handled seemed like it was my fault and I did something wrong and only received a partial credit because it was still delivered.I suppose BUT...terrible attitude, service and resolve...I will not be looking for Purolator when I need to ship something and if asked would not recommend.Date of experience: July 12, 2017

Name: Shaharyar Abbasi
Review: This business is a joke. 0 stars.Purolator expects me to sit downstairs in my building till 8 pm. I ordered an item off amazon and PAID for express shipping. I was awake at 9 am and tracked my order at around 10. It said that they had attempted delivery even though i was awake and received no buzzer or knock on my door. I called their customer service and she said that i dont have a buzzer code on my address. After i insisted and told her to read my address back to me, it was clear that the address was correct and the buzzer code was indeed on it. My item is now at their depot around 20km away from my house. This service is awful and i hope i never have to deal with them again. I've ordered with amazon before and all the companies i've dealt with have buzzed me and brought the item up to me .EDIT: I was contacted by customer service and they told me that my item would be shipped to the closest depot. It is 6:42 at the moment and i still have no information about my item and they close at 8. This is literally the worst service ever. Please do not do business with Purolator, there are a million other options that know how to provide good service. I wish i could give 0 stars to this joke of a business.EDIT 2: Now they are saying they cant deliver it to a closer location until tomorrow. What a joke.Date of experience: July 12, 2017

Name: Matthew Marinett
Review: Purolator doesn't actually deliverMy credit card reward company for reasons beyond imagining exclusively uses Purolator for their rewards delivery. Twice in a row now (for the same reward) I've had notifications that the package was returned as undeliverable despite receiving absolutely nothing from the company - no call, no knock at my apartment door, no package slip left at my mailbox. Literally every other company is able to deliver to a downtown Toronto apartment building with no trouble - UPS, FedEx, Canada Post, all great. But with this order, all I get from Purolator is a message from my credit card company telling me it was returned as undeliverable. They don't even bother to drop it at a local post office. Instead, I have to call customer service again to get it resent. I've previously cancelled delivery subscriptions because they use Purolator, and I'm considering changing credit card companies now.Date of experience: July 11, 2017

Name: Naznin Ferdausi
Review: Purolator is liar and lazyPurolator delivery people is number one lazy and liar . Yesterday I was expecting a delivery from Best Buy and I was waiting at home . While I was cooking my son told me they r here and I also saw a purolator truck was parking in front of my house. My son asked me to recieve that and I said let them bring the product out and they will knock the door. But after 2 mins my son came back and say there is no truck there , did you recieve the delivery. I said no one knock the door or ring the bell. Then he went out side and check the mail box . They left a paper saying that they missed us.  Now I have to drive 25 mins at least to pick that up with my baby. Now what is the point to order online and pay to deliver at home, if I have to go to pick it up from even a far place than my nearest Best Buy store. No one could say that I was not at home that time because I am not working right now and staying with my baby whole time. This is not the first time . I could believe them if I didn't see the truck and they didn't even try to deliver it. We paid to get delivery at home , not to deliver that paper. Those drivers are getting money not to deliver that paper only , I think. Purolator should be apologize for yesterday 's act and should take action against that driver .Date of experience: July 11, 2017

Name: L. Collins
Review: I Just filed a THIRD complaint with …I Just filed a THIRD complaint with amazon.ca regarding Purolator My experience has been: Purolator doesn't "deliver." Purolator is a special snowflake of a company that expects YOU to go to THEIR depot to pick up your items. 1. I live quite far away from the nearest Purolator depot -  and I don't drive. When I order items online, I expect them to be delivered to my home. Purolator DEFEATS the whole purpose of ordering online.2. These Purolator "depots" keep extremely inconvenient hours for most working people, and only hold your items for five days before returning them back to the sender. Work 9 - 5? Good luck getting your stuff, in most cases...3. Purolator doesn't "do" apartments. They won't buzz your unit number, and most times they won't even leave a notice to let you know they've been around.4. Purolator drivers will lie and say that the delivery was "refused" - or that nobody was at home to accept delivery. The internet is loaded with complaints from people who waited at home all day long to receive a package. No calls, no doorbells, no notices. They check the Purolator tracker only to find that their parcel is back at the depot.5. If amazon continues to use this courier, I will have to stop ordering from them. This is absolutely ridiculous. Somehow Canada Post and UPS manage to deliver my parcels. Purolator is 0/3 at this point. Google the complaints about this company, people. And Beware.Date of experience: July 11, 2017

Name: Geoff
Review: Amazon should stop using Purolator...We had a monthly subscription come from Amazon via purloator. They didn't call our unit, or notice the large sign with the delivery number for the building on the door. We have staff that receive packages 12 hours a day... They neglected to call and now have the package in their sorting centre over a hour drive away. Extremely disappointed. If Canada post, FedEx, and UPS can drop the packages off with our staff, why can't you?Date of experience: July 10, 2017

Name: galjoen8
Review: Their tracking system sucks!Date of experience: July 10, 2017

Name: Margaret Ross
Review: Packages sit in Limbo until noticed!Mailed a package on June 26 going from Vancouver,  British Columbia to Darien, Georgia in the USA. My client still has not received this and it is now the 7th of July. In fact, all the tracking says is that it has departed Vancouver. This tells me it is still sitting somewhere in limbo on the Canadian side of the border. This has happened once before (the only other time I used Purolator). My package sat in the depot in Canada for 2 weeks until I called. I would rather pay more than use Purolator! I run a fairly busy home base business and ship out several packages weekly but will never use Purolator ever again. They are bad for business!Date of experience: July 08, 2017

Name: 4smarie
Review: The WORST customer service ever …The worst customer service i have ever received. They are dismissive, do not care about customer needs, no one goes out of their way to get further information for you and they are extremely rude. If I could give 0 stars I would. NEVER using purolator again.Date of experience: July 07, 2017

Name: Mik
Review: Absolutely terrible serviceAbsolutely terrible service. It's not often I got out of my way to complain about something but the fact that Purolator refuses to leave any sort of notice for delivery attempt, doesn't contact me despite having my phone number on file, and just return my package to their warehouse and sit on it for days just straight up shocked me. Of all the parcel delivery services I deal with, FedEx, ICS, UPS, DHL, I have never seen any of them go so far out of their way to completely shirk their responsibility. WHAT GOOD IS A DELIVERY SERVICE THAT DOESN'T DELIVER???Date of experience: July 07, 2017

Name: Steve
Review: Borderline phenomenal serviceToday, July 5 2017 I called Purolator Customer Services and had a slightly complicated issue dealt with by Margaret out of Moncton. She was about as close to phenomenal as you could be. She worked through the process, if she didn't have the answer she seemed advice internally, she apologized that it took a little time but in essence it was me who thanked her for her diligence and service and going above and beyond!!! I hope her manager gets to read this! Do everything you can to keep her, she is great!!Date of experience: July 06, 2017

Name: James Penner
Review: God help you if you use this for …God help you if you use this for anything business related. I've only ever shipped two things through Purolator (not by choice of course). This time is the final straw. I lost out on a $500 side job this weekend because the Purolator driver is too lazy to even come down my street! I live in a rural area about 45 seconds outside my cities perimeter and I have security cameras in both my driveways that can see the whole street. No ONE Purolator truck came down my street. I figured okay maybe they ran late because we had a pretty bad storm that day - they'll deliver it tomorrow for sure right? NOPE! Same line about not being able to find my address (even though its wood burnt into a 4 foot by 1 foot wood block tied to my chain link fence less than 5 feet from the street). If you're not intelligent enough to see this, you shouldn't be driving a truck or anything for that matter. It completely astonishes me how companies like Amazon and Newegg still ship through Purolator. At this point the service is so poor that I'm convince Purolator is discounting their bulk rates for these two companies so deeply that Purolator is paying Amazon to ship packages for them. There's simply no other logical reason to ever have a contract with a company known for such cringe worth customer service. Everywhere you look are one start reviews. Did I also mention I've had 100+ shipments delivered to this address last year by Canadapost/DHL/FedEx/UPS. Even Loomis is capable of finding my house (first try - super impressed) and delivering full skids right into my garage. This is why its so confusing to me why a Purolator driver managed to not once, but twice manage to "miss" my house. What a joke. If you rely on shipments of product to make money, stay as far away from this disaster of a company as you possibly can. I'd rather ship with untracked Canada post mail than this garbage.Date of experience: July 03, 2017

Name: A. Marie
Review: Unaccommodating delivery serviceUnaccommodating delivery serviceNote : Customer Service Rep, Megan, was very professional and promptly directed my issue to the branch. However, the branch clerk was awful, rude and condescending. I've never gone out of my way to submit a complaint online about a service. I'm usually cooperative and patient. However, the Purolator in Ottawa (Hawthorne Location) is completely out of line. - I live in centre town and enjoy benefiting from amazon deliveries to my door as I don't own a car. I have no issues with any courier service with the exception of Purolator.  - I work business hours.- Purolator only delivers during business hours. - They try 1 delivery a day for 3 days...my package is now 3 days late minimum.- I was informed that the release waiver I signed is void since I live in a house with more than 1 unit... defeats the point of the waiver. Whether or not the package is left at the door is to the driver's discretion... that's just odd. Why rely on legally binding waiver when you can rely on the subjectivity of human being?   - If the driver opts out of leaving it at the door, they return it by default to the furthest location from the downtown core possible - 30 minutes drive away! It's like they're dismissing their customers intentionally... I haven't even addressed the branch worker's condescending tone when parroting this illogical policy.  It is the most absurd delivery protocol I've encountered yet. Considering our increasing reliance on online shopping and the importance drawn to efficiency and access, I would urge them to review their policy.Date of experience: June 28, 2017

Name: Lopez
Review: Mechanical delay..Mechanical delay... these is what puralator will tell u ever time they don't deliver a package on time. these way they don't have to guarantee any delivery. shipped with them 6 to 8  times a month for 6 months  they had over ten mechanical delays in that time.. They did not refund  any of the shipments just a bunch of  b.s  sad to me about how its not there fault if they have mechanical delays which in there world is anything..  a truck breaks down.. they forgot one of your packages some where...  The  list goes on. Do not ship with these people bad buisness. even worse customer service they just don't care. Really dont care.Date of experience: June 27, 2017

Name: Frederic Hamel
Review: Purolator denied having delivered it to …Purolator denied having delivered it to the wrong address.I never receive the 3 pieces worth a $1000 I was supposed to.I am also about to loose RMA on all the product related to these 3 pieces.Date of experience: June 26, 2017

Name: Robyn Fraser
Review: Atrocious customer service,zero assistance receivedMy experience with Purolator customer service was one of the most unpleasant consumer ordeals I've ever endured. I waited 7 days for my delivery that was on a truck each of those days but never actually delivered. Customer service never once gave me an altenate option or different information on my expectations for the delivery (It's on the truck, scheduled for delivery today) and were unhelpful when i requested a different drop off or pick up  location. 7 days I spoke with 3 different agents and not one could assist me. I alternately requested assistance from the original shipper and resolution was swift. I notified 2 of the Purolator agents that the issue was reolved & received no reply. The original shipper however offered me a gift card for my troubles and is still in contact until gift card is received. Would never use Purolator if other options were available. Terrible customer service and horrible problem solving skills.Date of experience: June 25, 2017

Name: Amunnet Yaahzel
Review: I would not give Purolator a 1 star …I would not give Purolator a 1 star they don't deserve it. Worst company ever for delivery. they should be out of business closed down for good as they don't deliver drivers lie and say they showed up when they did not. this is my 3rd time. will ask the company to use another carrier from now on.Date of experience: June 22, 2017

Name: Chris Zenteno
Review: Horrible ServiceHorrible Service, it's just like they don't want to deliver the packages. Today, for the second time, I took to the day off from work to receive a package since it was showing in their tracking system that I was going to receive it today. I stayed the whole day at home, and after checking the website at the end of the day, I see an Attempted delivery at 11:52, however my door bell never ringed! no one called me or anything. Did they really attempt to deliver? I doubt it! Now just like the first time, I will have to pick up the package in their facilities. What's the point then of using a delivery service!!! ??? This never happens to me with Canada Post, UPS, FedEx, etcDate of experience: June 22, 2017

Name: Andy
Review: DO NOT USE PURALATOR!Absolutely horrid service. I ordered an package via Newegg and when I saw the word shipped from Puralator I knew I was boned. Without any shortage of failure, they managed to completely mess it up again. The delivery guy never called or leave a notice for pickup.(My apartment doesn't have a security reception and I wasn't home) it is like the company from top to end doesn't care what they are doing. Just summited to Newegg to never again ship via Puralator. Will do that too to any other orders in to future. If anyone is seeing this, pay another carrier such as DHL, which has amazing service and speed(package from East Europe ordered the same day as local package via Puralator arrived earlier.). Or for God sakes the Canada Post is even way better than is pile of mess. At least they only messed up a few time over 100+ shippings.Date of experience: June 21, 2017

Name: Carol Lee
Review: This company shows a delay on both ends …This company shows a delay on both ends of transit.  It keeps going on a truck and off the truck at sorting house and then the same thing on the delivery end.  I do not know why companies still use them for delivery.  I waited 1 month for a delivery from Toronto to Burnaby.  This is just not acceptable.  I ask that you do not use them at all and maybe their poor habits will force their hand.Date of experience: June 20, 2017

Name: Gerry
Review: No delivery happened on the confirmed …No delivery happened on the confirmed date they supplied, horrible customer contact and even worse getting something reschedule for delivery even though you were home all day when the initial delivery was to happen. Please avoid them and use another delivery service.Date of experience: June 19, 2017

Name: James Pua
Review: Same thing happen to me 4th time now …Same thing happen to me 4th time now and I don't bother to complaint until today. Yes Purolator deliveryman don't bother to use the buzzer (or don't know how to use a buzzer?) We are at home the whole time. Worse, they place my package pickup location in another CITY 25KM away from my house/city. There is one retail (not Puralator) mail office contract to Purolator near my house (Coquitlam) but I think their system mistaken my address is in another city (Burnaby).  I'm not surprised to find similar complaints right here at trustpilot.ca. I've contacted Amazon to not use Purolator to avoid heartburn. What they should do: 1. They have to train their deliveryman better. 2. Fix their bloody system3. Learn from UPS, Fedex, DHL.Date of experience: June 19, 2017

Name: MrNewcity
Review: Worst shipping company I've ever usedAlmost always late. And if they aren't, they say noone is home even though there is. They knock once, wait 3 seconds and run off, then I have to drive 20 mins to get the package myself. Basically, I pay them for nothing.Date of experience: June 19, 2017

Name: Tim Vanderford
Review: I will make every effort to ensure that …I will make every effort to ensure that I never get anything shipped to me via Purolator again. They consistently leave a tag on the door when I've been home to receive a parcel. I'm beginning to believe the drivers get paid more if they have to return things to the depot so they pre-fill in the "We missed you" card and run like hell to stick it on the door and leave.Date of experience: June 16, 2017

Name: Adam Murdock Gale
Review: The most consistent company I have ever …The most consistent company I have ever used.  Every time, without fail, they manage to completely mess something up.  Delivery notices posted on my door when I am home.  No knocks.  No phonecalls.  No buzzer.  I have requested amazon to never ship me a package via Purolator again.  Absolutely embarrassing, you're better off driving to the store and picking up what you need as it will be faster than getting Purolator to redeliver your package or driving to one of their distribution centers.Date of experience: June 15, 2017

Name: Kassie Aurora Castle
Review: Over a Week for EXPRESS SHIPPINGI ordered from Amazon, with express 1-2 day shipping, item to be delivered to me on Friday, June 9. Well, they didn't even attempt on Friday, attempted once on Saturday, said "Coudn't find your address" despite being here numerous times before.I called and was told Monday for sure.I called on Monday and was told Tuesday for sure.I called on Tuseday and was told Wednesday for sure.It's Wednesday. It's not here. I called. "Thursday for sure".UNACCEPTABLE. Worst service of my life (and I order online at least once a month).Date of experience: June 15, 2017

Name: Marie Dunn
Review: Purolator are the most expensive …Purolator are the most expensive shipping company. Their rates are outrageous.Date of experience: June 09, 2017

Name: Rafah Jamal
Review: Ordered from Amazon PrimeOrdered from Amazon Prime, delivery was scheduled for 2nd of June. I receive an email on the 1st saying there was an attempt to deliver; they left a location for a pick up that's far from my location which defies the whole purpose. I call and demand a delivery, and they say after 3 days. I requested a call or an email before the delivery with the expected time. On the said day, I call their customer service, and I'm told that they can't locate my package, call again tomorrow. Instead, I called Amazon, and after being on hold for a very very long time I'm told that it will be delivered the next day, It was already 5 pm, so I left. At 5:25 I get a call from my buzzer from a rude guy, I tell him that I'm not home and he can leave it in front of my apartment. I rush home to find a paper saying "we missed you" and again with a location for a pick up that is far from my place. They expect to deliver at any time and any day, and we be there waiting for them? Then say "we missed you". I still didn't get my package, but at this point, I'm done with the calls, holds, and rudeness, but what to do. Worst service ever from both Amazon and Purolator. I wish I can give a negative rating to express my frustration.Date of experience: June 06, 2017

Name: Adam Yunes
Review: Purolator: the epidemy of garbage serviceDrivers are always nice, however the head guys are all (insert curse word) bafoons... wasted an entire day based off of false information I was given about the location of my package. They're an absolute joke! Next time I'd rather go via carrying pidgeons.Date of experience: June 05, 2017

Name: Paul Ng
Review: Trash freaking carrier dont ever use …Trash freaking carrier dont ever use again. they freaking failed to deliver the package and refused to deliver it on the same day again trashDate of experience: June 01, 2017

Name: Arian Ansari
Review: Worst shipping company ever with …Worst shipping company ever with garbage customer service that even can't give you estimate of delivery time and they won't notify you when they arrive so basically you have to sit at home whole day waiting for your parcelDate of experience: May 31, 2017

Name: Unknown
Review: Poor speed, service, and lack of customer service.I ordered an item off sportchek.ca, they shipped VIA purolator.The website tracking showed it would arrive may 26th friday, it did not arrive.(I'm a 4th year student in Psych, Neuroscience, so I know how to properly talk to people)Monday may 29th, contacted purolator via live chat.The CSR was unapologetic, did not care, and forwarded me to a trace specialist.CSR specialist said they don't know what happened to my package and needed descriptions of what it is, brand name, etc to find it. Tues may 30th,the trace specialist now says it's coming tomorrow for May 31st.again, unapologetic, lack of information, and terrible customer service.Please anyone thinking of using Purolator, don't.This experience has made me so put off by them I will avoid them for my lifetime. They will lose your package that weighs 40 pounds and is 10 feet wide. So your packages that are tiny stand no chance at all.Do not use it.Best experience far: UPS, DHL, and Canada Post (Slow but reliable)Date of experience: May 30, 2017

Name: Chelemsteve@gmail.com
Review: SeriouslySeriously, use someone else.If they hadn't wasted so much of my time already, I'd write about the horrible experience.USE SOMEONE ELSE!Date of experience: May 30, 2017

Name: Kristina King
Review: Currently sitting at home on a Monday …Currently sitting at home on a Monday for no reason, might as well of gone out for all the good it did me to wait. They "attempted delivery" which is a lie because the apartment buzzer never went off. So now I have to waste gas to pick up my package later this week.Date of experience: May 29, 2017

Name: Dwila
Review: Guarantee is unreliable. Disappointing.I paid extra on Amazon.ca to receive a package that I needed to take with me out-of-town for the weekend. It was guaranteed to arrive on Friday. It didn't arrive. I contacted Amazon, who has 24/7 customer service, at 11:00 pm on Friday. They refunded my shipping and gave me an extra month of Prime for free, and sent a message to Purolator. Saturday morning at 8:00 am I reached purolator by phone to ask about the time of arrival for my package. The response: It arrived at the facility too late to go out yesterday. (I checked. It arrived in my city at 4:14 pm). It won't go out until Monday. (I was shocked and enquired about weekend shipping.) We don't deliver on weekends. (I asked what we can do about this.) I'm really sorry. (That's it?! You're sorry?!) Apparently this company does not guarantee what it says it does guarantee. Guess I'll change my weekend plans. Very disappointed.Date of experience: May 27, 2017

Name: Mia Carr
Review: Please, allow drivers to have cell phonesCouriers will not call you directly if you live in a building without a buzzer so you can meet them at the main entrance to retrieve package.Date of experience: May 27, 2017

Name: RIchard Lamontagne ( SERVITECH )
Review: Don't know what's happened with …Purolator !!??Don't know what's happened with Purolator service . Not so far in the distant past I always had great service but since retired personnel have not been replaced in my area of concern ( Joliette, Quebec ) things have really gone down hill. I'm losing time and not able to coordinate my service to customers because of required parts shipped from Carrier Canada, Laval  .... Someone's  not doing their Job and I suspect it's in the upper management somewhere . Following this complaint , I'll be making a complaint with Carrier Canada to find more reliable couriersDate of experience: May 26, 2017

Name: David
Review: Your amazon order ended up with …Your amazon order ended up with Purolator? I'm sorry for you.Date of experience: May 24, 2017

Name: Paul Boretski
Review: Simply put they stole my package and …Simply put they stole my package and lied consistently about it. Foul company owned by that other foul company Canada Post. Never again.I only wish I could give them ZERO stars. If they were not owned by Canada Post crown corp. they would be GONE long ago.Date of experience: May 18, 2017

Name: Rick
Review: Incompetent courier serviceWe paid rush service for our parcel to arrive before 1030 am the next day. The itinerary was from Hamilton, ON to Ottawa, ON, which is less than a 5 hours drive. The tracking information hasn't been updated and the parcel should have arrived this morning. I called customer service, who tell me that they don't know where it is and that everyone is looking for it. The parcel contains very important documents, which I needed to move next week. I have to cancel my flight and Purolator's incompetence is going to cost me over $3000.Date of experience: May 18, 2017

Name: Samuel Lessard St Amant
Review: Left the box in the wide open of my …Left the box in the wide open of my door and didnt knock or ring the bell.. what if someone would have taken the box before i came to look if it was there? 800$ of pc part shipping..Date of experience: May 17, 2017

Name: Todd
Review: USE UPSUse UPS......... I had two packages arrive on the same day, one from UPS one from Purolator. I wouldn't be home for ten days so I called UPS and five minutes later my needs were met. I called Purolator and dealt with the most unhelpful and useless customer service rep who refused to even hear me out. Ill be forced to ship this package back to the sender.Date of experience: May 16, 2017

Name: Gustaf
Review: Positively incompetentPositively incompetent. Delivered a package at an odd hour; left a notice that had a 'tracking' number nobody at Purolator could make sense of and the name of the recipient was a random word rather than any name of anyone in the household. Apparently they don't check to make sure their drivers have basic literacy skills. Judging by what I'm reading here their hallmark is badness, pure and simple. Avoid them!Date of experience: May 16, 2017

Name: Dmitry Solomadin
Review: The worstThe worst. Avoid at all costs. Ordered 4 or 5 items on Amazon, everything was delivered within 2-3 days, even king sized bed was delivered within 4 days and perfectly on time. But the item that was supposed to be delivered by Purolator was not delivered within a week! And they did not contact me, did not gave me any estimate worst. When I reached out to customer support they said that because it is a heavy item (55lb are you kidding me?) they need 2 additional days to arrange a truck. I can't believe companies like that are still on the market.Date of experience: May 13, 2017

Name: Customer
Review: No wordsIn my four or five interactions with Purolator over two shipments (one in October and one in May), I have not once had a positive or productive experience. On both occasions, their 'attempt at delivery' was nothing shy of pathetic; just because there is a buzzer where you have to search a name or unit number, doesn't mean 'no buzz code, address correction required'. Both times I was not left a delivery slip notifying me of an 'attempted delivery'. I had to first notice my packages hadn't arrived by their expected date and use my tracking number to determine that because of other peoples' incompetencies I now have to go out of my way to pick up a package that was paid to have delivered to its recipient. I have never had this issue with any other courier company; everything has either been properly delivered via the buzzer or automatically taken to the nearest pickup location with a delivery notice left neatly at the mailbox or door. I wish I had a job where I could not give a **** and just walk up to a door and say, "well, looks like they're not home, back to the warehouse it goes. They'll figure it out at some point, my pen is too far in my pocket for me to reach in and write these people a note that I came by." The customer service and call centre staff for Purolator are just as much an atrocity as their delivery staff; being told a package is at one location for pickup after several painful phone calls and then arriving at that pick up location only to find out it has really been taken to a facility ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CITY. Buddy, just because your computer reads it is in 'Toronto', doesn't mean you should just go off naming a random Toronto Purolator location. Check your **** before you tell your customer to go pick their things up. I have never been so dissatisfied with a company that I went off on a rampage to write a review for them. After my first experience with Purolator I thought, it was close to Thanksgiving, people make mistakes, give them a break etc etc and kept my delivery experience to myself. But after today, and after reading so so SO many negative reviews of this company online, I am so glad to know I am not the only one who has felt this way. There are literally hundreds of one and two star reviews for this company all sharing some variation of poor customer service and delivery speed, and its not just a few hundred bad ones out of thousands of reviews. It's literally JUST hundreds of bad reviews. I hope they get incorporated into a company that actually knows what they are doing. Once I get my package on Monday I am doing everything in my power to not support Purolator courier services.Date of experience: May 12, 2017

Name: Libby Flohr
Review: The run around!Received note saying to go pick up next day, went and was told it was delivered to wrong address, went to address and they did not have it, went back to purolator and found that the package was there all along! No apologies just bad service! Why am i paying for handling when they make me waste my time to FIND my package!!!!!!Date of experience: May 12, 2017

Name: Vanessa Bouchard
Review: Horrible everytimeEverytime I order a package delivered by them they just throw the box on my porch and run away. Last time i opened the door about 5 seconds after I heard it dropped and the delivery man was nearly running towards his car. are they so afraid of human interactions. Name: Jacky
Review: Ship with Fedex or UPSThis is not the first time happened to us. We trust Purolator  for our shipments nationwide. Lately our shipments to Oakville from Toronto broken (packed with lots of bubble wraps and fragile stickers outside the box). We never complained we shipped replacements to customer still broken,seriously? This week we shipped to Stouffville from Toronto of 7 items packed with 1/2" bubble wrap and fragile outside the box still 5 items damaged (broken). These items cost us thousands excluding  shipping cost...How they handle our shipments? These items cannot be broken easily. This is our customer for more than 20 years we supply all over Canada of all their stores. This time they are looking for another supplier because of negligence of Purolator. Ship with Fedex or UPS more safe.Date of experience: May 10, 2017

Name: EToda
Review: Unsympathetic.I've had several interactions with purolator. Everytime I've made a scheduled delivery, there is an issue.Most heinous is the recent incident involving a gift card of significant amount which has gone missing. The way they handled it was awful. They seemed unsympathetic towards my lost package and spent their focus towards blaming my concierge which, most candidly put, has a faaaaaaaar better scorecard than these guys. I'm so disappointed and I have asked for a replacement card with the specific request of an alternate carrier.Date of experience: May 09, 2017

Name: MB
Review: Horrible customer service. Call FedEx.Horrible. Guaranteed overnight delivery for conference/tradeshow in Vancouver. Been three days. Apparently package is being held in warehouse an hour away.  I am welcome to pick it up myself or wait for Monday delivery .... by which point the conference will be a thing of the past and I will be back in Ottawa.Do yourself a favor. Go with FedEx. At least their customer service pretends to care. I didn't even get an apology nor will Purolator provide a credit for failing to meet their guarantee .... or just for failing delivery.Date of experience: May 06, 2017

Name: William Y.
Review: Questionable ethicsI was waiting at home for the whole day waiting for delivery. There was no knocking at the door, no buzzing, nothing. Upon refreshing the online tracking, it said delivery failed. The driver left no notice, nothing whatsoever. I rearranged for delivery the next day, waiting at home for the whole day again. There was no knocking at the door, no buzzing, nothing. Upon refreshing the online tracking, it gave me a delivery failure again, and you guessed it, the driver left no notice again, nothing whatsoever. I called purolator again trying to explain the situation, but the connector was rude and didn't even let me finish my sentence. Purolator is extremely unreliable, with questionable business ethics and honesty. Such business practice should go through major reformation.Date of experience: May 05, 2017

Name: Angie
Review: Can I give them negative stars?Can I give them negative stars?I called TWO days in a row before my package was getting shipped, ensuring they had made notes on my profile that clearly outlined I wanted the driver to buzz my number (which I provided and they had on file), and leave the package outside of my door. NEITHER OF THESE THINGS HAPPENED. And when I called to be like "what the F%$#" they tell me i have to travel 20 minutes out of my way to go get a package that THEY SHOULD BE DELIVERING TO ME. Literally the worst company in the world. I hope they go bankrupt.Date of experience: May 04, 2017

Review: very bad service.worst service I have seen the doors was open they did not came, went with rubbish note. I want to complain on them, I have CC footage.worst service.Date of experience: May 03, 2017

Name: Muppetologiste .Ca

The day of pickup the item finally arrive, and I confirmed on the purolator page and by phone that the item was in their downtown office and they confirmed it.I went to pickup it to downtown, and it wasn't there. Name: Jesse Campbell
Review: My first experience with this …My first experience with this company.....They said they were delivering my 1,500 laptop on April 18th but they didn't show up i waited all day because i live in a rural area and i didn't want to miss them.  They then said April 21st my laptop was on it's way......they didn't show up again so i had to wait the weekend and they said April 24th my laptop would arrive and the lady said it was in the purolator van and will be at my house and again it never arrived....they then said sorry and my laptop was in the van again and will for sure be at my house....they never showed up again.    finally i had enough and they said they were gonna trace my package and message the delivery guy to bring me my laptop and finally he arrived at my door at 6pm .....on april 26th ....what a joke of a companyDate of experience: April 27, 2017

Name: Eli Ganceña
Review: Not even worth a star but it won't let …Not even worth a star but it won't let me rate them a zero.Terrible service, only way to receive your package is to drive to their keele location, how inconvenient! Name: Kyle Kayfish
Review: Terrible serviceTerrible service.  Had scheduled delivery of parts needed to be installed.  They split up the shipment and proceeded to lose half of it. Review: The only time my packages arrive late …The only time my packages arrive late from Amazon Purolator is the delivery method.Date of experience: April 21, 2017

Name: Madison Doepel
Review: CAN I GIVE NO STAR?! BECAUSE 1 STAR IS TOO KIND.SUCH A JOKE OF A COMPANY!!!!! Name: Corey
Review: Absolutely under no circumstances …Absolutely under no circumstances should you ever use purolator. Name: Leslie Spencer
Review: Terrible customer serviceTerrible customer service - non-existent, in fact.  Would never recommend this company and frankly, I don't know how they stay in business.  Spoke to customer service representatives three times on the phone to advise them that I live in the garden flat of a house, and the messages were somehow either not conveyed to their drivers or else the drivers ignored the information and went to the front door of the house, where of course no one was home.  I ended up being told I had to pick up my (heavy) parcel in person.  Being a senior with osteoarthritis, this was very difficult for me.  Really dreadful company and hope I never have to deal with them again.Date of experience: April 14, 2017

Name: Amoi
Review: Horrible customer service lazy employees!!!If I had the option of giving this company no stars I absolutely would. Name: Lindsay
Review: The only thing consistent about these …The only thing consistent about these guys is their terrible service. I am a frequent amazon buyer and have prime. The only time things are not delivered on time is when Purolator is doing the shipping. They are consistently late and never provide updates, and their customer service is completely useless. The most recent delivery was supposed to arrive April 12. The info said it arrived at the sort facility near my home (20 min away!!) at 6:21AM. By the following evening it till hadn't arrived. We are now going into a long weekend so the earliest I can expect it will be the 17th. I contacted customer service and they said that I could come and pick it up. I am 9 months pregnant and my partner is away working, this is why i wanted DELIVERY. I was told it didn't arrive in time at the sort facility to be sent out today...I asked how this could be seeing as it arrived there YESTERDAY before 7AM. I was not given an answer. This is just one of many bad experiences with this joke of a company. I have no idea why amazon continues to deal with them.Date of experience: April 13, 2017

Name: christel lindemann
Review: Liars the bunch of themLiars the bunch of them! Been messed around four times! Driver never showed up and I spend two days ,all day,sat waiting and nothing...I call purolater ( a total of 5 times)  who claims the driver had been there each time HUGE LIE I tell them we have cameras where I live and id be happy to show them that they didn't show up..Suddenly the woman is more helpful and creates a case number..Of course the next day no one shows up..I call again to get my delivery now its ready for pick up WHAT!? Then another "rearranged" delivery is organized..For tomorrow..I go to work today and when I get off there's a message on my phone saying my things are ready for pickup and that they were there today ( I specifically told them that today I would not be home so very convenient for them to claim they were here) I call again and after much waiting and discussing I am told my delivery WAS at pickup but is now at the depot again for re delivery. I don't know who or what drives/works at purolater but it is in need of a brain!!! I am still hoping my delivery will come tomorrow if not I am taking this further!!!!!!Date of experience: April 12, 2017

Name: A.B
Review: Paid extra for 1 day delivery for a …Paid extra for 1 day delivery for a needed item, the parcel went out at 730am and recieved a delayed delivery notice at 355pmDate of experience: April 11, 2017

Name: Kuma Tenshi
Review: Don't ever use them if you can avoid doing so!!!I had a package sent through Purolator, from British Columbia to London Ontario, through Purolator Express. Basically guaranteed to be at the destination and delivered by end of next business day. Not exactly a cheap method of shipping, but it was an important item that was needed. It made it across the country fine enough, and was out for delivery at 9 am on March 6th. I've had issues with Purolator in the past getting into the building, even though literally every other courier has zero problem doing it. So whenever I find myself in a situation where I had no control over who something was sent through, I tend to just keep an eye out all day, as I work from home anyways. Business days tend to end at 6pm, as do their deliveries and the like. I had seen no sight of them all day, and around 5:20 I decided that perhaps the driver was simply running late, or my area was at the tail end of their route for the day. It was annoying, but at least I'd ensure I was at the lobby door to let them in regardless. I had waited at various points down there throughout the day already as well anyways. 6 pm ends up coming around, and nothing, no sight of any truck on the streets, nor in the parking lot right in front of the building, both of which I had full view of the entire time. So I went back up to my apartment with a sick feeling in my gut, to discover that sure enough, the tracking now claimed an attempt was made at 5:50 pm and it claimed I was "inaccessible". Which was a load of crap!!I immediately contacted them through Live Chat on their website, and big surprise, the first rep I was greeted with actually defended the driver and refused to file a complaint for me, instead adamant I just get a re-delivery for tomorrow. Kept asking me if there was a buzzer code, and even told me "the driver won't even get out of the truck for apartments if there is no buzzer code listed with the address." I kid you not. After pointing out that A) there is a list of all residents and their accompanying buzzers right inside the door B) no god damn apartment in the WORLD doesn't have something like and C) I have HAD deliveries done by Puro and others no problem, using the buzzer system!! (Yes, amazingly, there are Puro drivers out there with a head attached to their shoulders, but they are quite rare). She was rather flummoxed by my pointing out logic and reality to her. After telling her off, I just contacted another rep. They did file a complaint for me to the depot, however, they seemed disinclined to believe my claim much like the first rep. So in the end, I just had them send it to a Puro agent at a retail printing store, and then spent 35 dollars on a taxi to pick the damned thing up. I have no car as I work from home and my brother can otherwise drive me on the rare occassion I need to go out, and I am also not in good enough shape to use public transit unfortunately. HENCE why it is important for items to be delivered to my freaking door!! Something Purolator seems disinterested in general on doing, despite it being the core and main point of their entire business. This is what happens when a delivery company is owned by the Government, they just don't give a damn because they know they can get away with it.Date of experience: April 08, 2017

Name: kevin goerk
Review: Lazy lazy lazyLazy lazy lazy. Beautiful day out its sunny and warm. I get my tracking info saying my package will arrive today, also that I paid extra for. I get a second notification saying it's delayed due to weather conditions at 3:00pm. There is no reason for that notification ever on a day like this. All I can see is that they wanted to get off earlyon a Friday.Date of experience: April 07, 2017

Name: Kat
Review: The driver liedI ordered a package from Amazon with Prime. My package should have arrived today, but instead the driver decided that he didn't feel like driving to my house and inputted that I had requested a new delivery date. The tracking details say that I requested this at 15:10. I called purolator at 15:15... FIVE minutes later to find out what had happened and express that not only had I not requested this, but that I absolutely wanted the package today. The woman I spoke to was utterly unhelpful. At first she basically accused me of lying and had me go outside to look for a sticker. There was none. I was told that the driver could not be "sent back". I didn't want the driver to be "sent back". I wanted to the driver to deliver my package... ONCE. I have been here all day. The driver lied. She rescheduled the order for tomorrow, unacceptable. And filed a "complaint" against the driver. Insufficient.  With today's technology, how is it possible that they are not able to contact their drivers in real time?If you require a reliable delivery and you have an option to choose another carrier, I recommend that you do.Date of experience: April 06, 2017

Name: George Zhu
Review: Why can’t the public stop Purolator's bad behaviour?I didn’t receive my package. I called Purolator to ask what happened. The first-time answer from Purolator was “according to our GPS record, our driver may deliver it to a wrong address”. The second-time answer from Purolator was “the driver delivered it to your door. the driver couldn’t find a place to park in front of your door, so he parked his truck (200 meters) away from your address”.Either Purolator or the driver lies. There is an open area in front of my address. I often saw other delivery trucks turned their heads in the area.Each time called the customer service department; I was always told: the package was delivered at your door. Your case is closed.Why are almost all complaints telling similar stories? Why can’t the public stop Purolator’s bad behaviours?Date of experience: April 04, 2017

Name: Marc Falcone
Review: Driver don't come to deliver, marks parcel as "receiver inaccessible" LIE!Friday, March 31th, 2017. I waited since 8 am. Driver did not even come to our address. Parcel marked as "Attempted delivery - receiver inaccessible" at 11:21. I phoned Purolator and was said: "driver unable to park in my street because of traffic!" which is a lie, as I reside in a rural area where the street is large and without any traffic. Then the parcel is marked as "Appointment required for delivery, receiver will be contacted to reschedule" at 17:43, then as "Unable to deliver - delivery date rescheduled" at 19:29. Delivery rescheduled to Monday, April 3, 2017. I never had a parcel delivered on delivery date. These courrier drivers never come to our address until we complain!Date of experience: April 02, 2017

Name: F
Review: absolutely ridiculousThey were supposed to deliver my package but I was notified that my address could not be found. She was also confused as to why they could not find my address (I have had deliveries from purolator multiple times before). She scheduled the delivery for the next day but again it did not get delivered because of some ridiculous reason that they missed this delivery even though it had been out for delivery since 7am in the morning. Such a terrible delivery service!!Date of experience: March 29, 2017

Name: RJW CHOI
Review: Lazy, rudeI had bad experience ever with purolator. Hope amazon does not ship with them anymore. Delivery guy was so rude. I didn't get any notice of messages when they were downstairs just left me a message and they wanted me to come pick it up at purolator location.Date of experience: March 27, 2017

Name: Melanie of Ottawa
Review: They made a mistake with the address, saying it is incomplete and are blaming either myself or amazon for it, when there was never a problem with other amazon deliveries.They made a mistake with the address, saying it is incomplete and are blaming either myself or amazon for it, when there was never a problem with other amazon deliveries. So they had to correct the address and re-label, which for some reason requires 24 hours delay. Since the package arrived at sorting 5 hours before they send out their delivery guys, they is enough time for them to correct their own mistakes with the address in their system. If it is amazon somehow sending incorrect address, then purolator need to check their system on how they information from amazon, because no other courier or delivery company had a problem with other stuff ordered from amazon using the same address.Date of experience: March 23, 2017

Name: Darle Heck
Review: Please don't send my parcels by PurolatorI just had another episode with the stupidity that is Purolator. They didn't deliver my package, they never came to my door. I get a phone call from one of their drop off locations saying they have my parcel. The parcel is in the next town, 30 km away.  Really, that can't be the closest drop point. But, this was an improvement on the last time when they were supposed to deliver a 2 carton delivery from the USA. They sent back box 1 of 2 saying my address didn't exist and called me to pick up box 2 of 2. If they are owned by Canada Post, why can't they figure out addresses. There is someone at my house 24/7, we have home business and a driveway alarm that goes off if anyone drives in. Why have I never had a parcel delivered to my house, even though the drivers all say they came to the door and nobody was home. Why do FedEx and DHL have no problems delivering to usDate of experience: March 22, 2017

Name: Jibran Raza
Review: Lazy As Fu*kThey said online that they tried to deliver but they didn't try it. There was no attempt to buzz my apartment or anything. Now I have to drive far to get it. I was literally outside my house at the time it says online as attempted delivery and I saw nothing.Edit: I am adding 2 stars because they delivered it the day after.Date of experience: March 22, 2017

Name: Monica Bhattacharjee
Review: Worst everGiving it a 1 because there's no option for a 0. They don't call, they don't even put notes on the lobby door. Once they didn't deliver and didn't even notify us for the next 2 weeks. Phone customer service is totally unhelpful. The lady on the phone didn't  know if undelivered goods would be available for pick up the same evening or the next day. Instead she offered me to lodge a complaint against the driver, which I thought was weird. She said drivers are supposed to leave stickers specifying details. So I asked if they have a designated driver for a particular location or more than one driver and she didn't even know that!! What an absurd way to pass the buck and just blame the driver. I just hope Amazon doesn't use their carrier services. They just screw up amazon prime, big time.Date of experience: March 21, 2017

Name: V Lashing
Review: the worst. If anyone can delay things it purolatorWorst company hands down. Delivered my stuff to wrong address, 3 blocks down the street more than once. Never ring the bell just plop it down and off they go. If the box is heavy its not getting plopped at the door either, its going to be in the driveway at roadside.Thats if they get it right at all. I actually had an argument with them once because a 2 part shipment was a light box and a heavy box. The light one arrived. When I called in the woman said the heavy box was there in her office and not to worry, its Friday see and no one wanted to lift heavy on Friday. Someone will come Monday. No lie, that happened. Another time the box came wet and smelling like pee. Called in and they said they had a chemical spill on the truck ... OK so you just deliver wet with chemical? Then they backtracked and said there was an animal shipment .. so it was pee? Then they backtracked again. At least they named it right puroLATERDate of experience: March 20, 2017

Name: megan goldie
Review: ruderude staff on the phone. wish amazon did not use themDate of experience: March 17, 2017

Name: Lucy Louriac
Review: Worst Service Ever !!The driver did not WANT to come today. So it's delayed again. And no estimated hour of arrival.Impossible to change the delivery adress. The parcel is still in the truck.Crap service over the phone.Their estimated time of arrival is a joke.Date of experience: March 16, 2017

Name: IMEN TRAD
Review: Worst shipping company ever! Very bad experience!I waited all day at home on Monday for a delivery and nobody came and when I checked the package tracking online it said that there was an attempted delivery and that my address was incomplete, which wasn't. When I called, the customer service agent was very rude and told me that they don't access apartment buildings if the receiver is not at home. I told him that I waited all day for my delivery and that nobody showed up and even if the delivery man couldn't access my building, they could have done what every shipping company does and leave a card with the instructions to get my package (By the way, I previously received a package delivered by Purolator and they left a card doswnstairs in my building, so this is not new for them). When I told him that, the agent was even ruder and told me that this is their policy and that they don't access apartments buildings...Obviously lying... He aggressively offered to put my package on hold at a local Purolator store which I accepted thinking that it will be easier to finally get my products but, today it's Thursday and still no call from them...  I am very disappointed and frustrated by this situation and I hope that I will not have to deal with this company again!Date of experience: March 16, 2017

Name: Jojo
Review: VERY VERY BAD service. LOST my package!!!!!!!!!They have lost my package which contains an IPhone. Tracking specialist has been assigned to the case, but there is no KPI (in terms of number of days) to come back to you.  Still unresolved. If KPI or target is not set for the staff, what is the action taken to ensure Customer focused vision is there (promoted in their website)?Money gone, package gone, time wasted, unlimited of follow ups.....Date of experience: March 16, 2017

Name: Bob Porter
Review: Sat here all day.  Same story as othersSat in my 12 unit condo for an Amazon delivery all day.  At 3:30 Amazon advised the package could not be delivered at 3:20.  I seriously doubt the driver even got out of the truck because they require an entry code for the building.I have no control over who Amazon decides to ship with.  Canada Post, DHL and UPS have never had any requirements.  How is the customer supposed to know?There is an intercom at the front door with 11 names on it.  All that was required was to find our name and press the button.  Or call us at the phone number on the order.Apparently the customer can waste a whole day but the driver doesn't tell inclined to even try!Worst service ever.  I will be providing this feedback to Amazon.vs and writing the Minister responsible for Canada Post who is responsible for this company.Appalling.Date of experience: March 16, 2017

Name: Mr. Meseeks
Review: Never try purolator3 days and no update my item hasn't even moved!!Date of experience: March 16, 2017

Name: Jordan
Review: I literally sat in the lobby of my apartment and watched the Purolator van pass by10 minutes later, I check tracking info and it says "unable to make delivery-insufficient address information, please contact". There was no attempt at delivery. On the phone, I'm told that it is my fault for not putting a buzzer code. My apartment has a big sign on the very first door that says "Please input apartment number for buzzer". Canada Post, DHL, and UPS have had no problems ever in the past understanding the sign and I've always received shipments from them. I asked over the phone to attempt another delivery the next day. I was told this was no longer possible (despite their website saying to call up and schedule a delivery).I have no choice who ships my parcels from Amazon. From the times that I have had my parcels shipped through Purolator, I have never (I really mean never) received my package without a hassle. The driver's don't seem to care. Its an ongoing issue that others are having as well. Management does not seem to care either as this issue has been ongoing for years. I have not received a response from customer care, who advised me to contact them regarding these issues.Date of experience: March 14, 2017

Name: Tyler
Review: NightmareDidn't deliver on time, no explanation, no reason for delay, will never use them again.Date of experience: March 12, 2017

Name: Paul Marsh
Review: Obstinate drivers.Purolator is the only delivery company I deal with that is unwilling to leave any parcel at the door to my flat. A driver can be scanned in to my building from my phone when they arrive, and there is video surveillance on site - so there is little reason to believe the package is unsafe in this location.The package is then sent across town to a reception centre full of other annoyed customers and (apparently) undervalued staff.I would almost prefer the driver take a swing at throwing the parcel up onto my balcony as opposed to dealing with Purolators central warehousing. A contact attempt has been placed to attempt to "permanently provide approval" for drop off at my flat, if this is possible then I wont consider Purolator any more insidious than the other big courier companies. (review amendments TBC)Date of experience: March 10, 2017

Name: Natalia
Review: Worst service ever!!!!!Five days ago I purchased an espresso machine from Amazon. However, I cannot receive the package because Amazon has chosen Purolator as a carrier. These guys cannot deliver anything except, probably, when you catch them on a street. This horrible service completely negates all the benefits of on-line purchases because you would have to fight with the delivery company for an extended period of time just to get your package. My advice to the consumers bying online from Amazon - please make sure that the package will be delivered NOT by Purolator.Date of experience: March 09, 2017

Name: Maria Filtser
Review: Bad serviceThey were supposed to deliver my order. The order had full valid address. Today they called to say, that 4 days ago they didn't see apartment number and tomorrow if i won't be at home to take a delivery (a working day) or pick it up until 5 - they will send it back. WHF?Date of experience: March 09, 2017

Name: Caren
Review: Worst service ever. Unreliable. Inconvenient.Purolator customer service and service itself is the worst. Incompetent service. Unprofessional! I was waiting and wasted my days waiting for non existing delivery. 3 TIMES. Waste of time.Date of experience: March 07, 2017

Name: Brian Morrison
Review: As a delivery company a total disasterOn Thursday the tracking website indicated that my parcel was on the truck and would be delivered by 8pm on Thurs . I contacted the hotline to request a more accurate delivery time . Unable was the reply ,. Well can you tell me the location of the truck so that I can get an approximate idea of delivery schedule . Sorry we don't know that . Well can you phone the driver and ask him . No we can't do that either . Well 8pm came and went no delivery . At 9pm the website was updated informing me that the truck had broken down early in the day and there was to be no delivery that day I had remained at home from 8am to 8pm waiting delivery . No phone call , no email , no contact of any kind informing me that delivery would not take place that day . Despite contacting the helpline twice during the day .I was then promised delivery on Friday with delivery again sometime before 8pm . Foolishly after the debacle from the previous day I expected that I would be afforded some sort of priority or even the courtesy of a more accurate delivery time . Again after contacting the help line and voicing my complaint I requested that a supervisor contact me regarding my complaint . Not unexpectedly, the call back did not materialise .8pm on Friday came and went with NO delivery . So to date I have remained at home for 2 days for absolutely nothing .This company cannot make deliveries Cannot contact their customers Cannot follow up on complaints Cannot contact their drivers Cannot track their vehicles Just what are they capable of doing ? Because they seem incapable of making a simple scheduled delivery It's now Sat, day 3 of this debacle but of course Purolator doesn't deliver on Sat or Sun so it's going to have to be Mon for delivery . Which means that I have had to spend 3 days at home waiting for a parcel delivery .Sat I phoned their customer service line spoke to a very nice lady who offered no more than a sorry and platitudes about" how we care about our customers " Yeah Well your actions scream the exact opposite .There has been absolutely  no attempt to rectify the situation , no special delivery no offers of compensation it's totally disgusting Someone in management really needs to shake up this  business  because all that I can see is incompetence at every level starting with their core business .I cannot suggest strongly enough that you avoid this business at all costsInteresting to note that nowhere on their website is there a facility for customers to blog about their experiences , probably for very good reason having read  the awful reviews hereDate of experience: March 04, 2017

Name: Celina
Review: lazy driversI took the day off just to wait for my delivery of a rocking chair.   i was waiting all day then i saw the truck pull up to my house so i went to put the dog in his kennel for safe keeping. the delivery guy just put up a paper slip on my door. when i opened the door he drove off.  HE DID NOT EVEN KNOCK on my door !!!! and i'm pregnant, how am i suppose to go pick my heavy item up now....  i thank you for your lazy employees!  i called purolator right away to see if they can send the driver back asap because he obviously inst doing his job, but they cant do this, so now i have to take another day off and hope that the delivery guy knows how to use his hands for actually knocking on a door. meanwhile my rocking chair is most likely being tossed around who knows where getting damaged!Date of experience: March 02, 2017

Name: Alice
Review: Horrible ServiceThis company should not be in business for one more second! It sucks and will definitely ruin the reputation of any business who chooses Purolator as their courier service. The driver doesn't want to deliver the package actually. He just want to dump the package at your front door and gets his job done (if you even call it a job). When it comes to apartment building and you need him to knock the door and leave the package at the front desk, believe me, he won't even bother to enter the lobby. And the customer service specialist in Purolator probably don't care either. All your explanation and complaints won't matter. Nobody in Purolator cares.Date of experience: March 02, 2017

Name: Linda Bissonnette
Review: Lazy DriversYup agree with R Froese same story here. My parents live in an area were there are 7 highrises for seniors and another one is in construction and because of that construction the parking is reduced and the management had to install a valet in a booth. You have to stop he sees that you are a delivery driver for Mickey Mouse Purolator he removes the orange cone and you drive your truck to the main door of which he obviously to lazy to do. Then you walk inside press the reception button and she takes and sign for the parcel this also very hard to do for a lazy sob. Twice he never attempt and played the lazy game well I closed the account and the box is on its way back and I will send it different or drive to Montreal myself and deliver it because it's seems to be very very hard for a unionized idiot, AND FYI PUROLATOR I AIN'T PAYING FOR A NON DELIVERYDate of experience: March 02, 2017

Name: R Froese
Review: Missed delivery2x "missed delivery". Many other choices for a courier than this one. Drivers do not want to drive to portage from Winnipeg I suspect although they say they have too many items to deliver in a day.I have had much better service from FedEx.Date of experience: February 28, 2017

Name: SereusServicePro
Review: There are much more reliable services to useUnfortunately, this company does not have great service, including in inclement weather.   Poor customer service, delayed packages, lost packages, misplaced packages, the list is at times endless.  I would advise against ever using purolator for anything.Date of experience: February 28, 2017

Name: Maher Kaddoura
Review: Expected delivery date always way offAnything is better than Purolator. They gave me an expected shipping date through the tracking # and then they tell me it wasn't even out for transit the day it was due. P.S. this is not the first time I have issues with Purolator.Date of experience: February 28, 2017

Name: Allan Swartz
Review: Owned by the government - like dealing with civil servants.  Choose FedexThe day after dropping off a package in the afternoon, I got a call from Purolator asking what was in the envelope. I was charged $50 for overnight delivery and the package is still in Toronto. I asked for a discount and it was refused. The person who filled out the form at Purolator did not write down what she saw, that the envelope contained documents. It's my fault not hers.I will never use their courier service again.Date of experience: February 24, 2017

Name: Bill Sullivan
Review: Avoid like the plague!package still sitting at their facility after a week! They said on tracking be delivered Feb. 23 2017. When I say facility I mean Toronto and I live In Dartmouth. Totally unacceptable delivery service, 0 stars if I could.Date of experience: February 24, 2017

Name: Alix Bovair
Review: Broke my 3000$ laptopHad my laptop shipped to manufacturer to fix a software issue, they fixed it and sent it back through purolator, and it returned with a hole punched through the shipping box and my screen broken. Purolator denied my claim as I sent it "at senders risk" Absolutely terrible customer service.Date of experience: February 23, 2017

Name: Jaswinder
Review: Shipment DelayIf there is half star in the rating I would love to give this company that half star.My shipment suppose to deliver me on Feb 15,2016 and I didn`t get it delivered and called in on Feb 17,2017 and I was told that Your shipment will be delivered on Feb 21,2017 and booked my appointment for delivering that day.On Feb 21 I was waiting for it to be delivered and then checked status and was still showing they need appointment to deliver.Called in Again and they told me to Deliver on Feb 22 and somebody called me in afternoon that we are booking your appointment for Feb 22,2017 between 8am to 8pm.I dont have a choice and i booked it.In the evening i got another call that we cant deliver it on Feb22,2017 because we dont have manpower to ship your shipment.I dont know how they guys are running their business.This company really deserve worst rating for their service.I won`t ever deal with This company in future and will tell my friends not to do business with this company.Date of experience: February 22, 2017

Name: Diana Vaizberg
