I am so grateful to everyone for helping us out and to get this shipment out.  The driver Amud (hope I got his name right) was the Star of the day, like a human angel.  He saved my bacon!  I tried to give him a big tip and he wouldn't take it.  Management should promote him.    Thanks so much to him and Purolator.   Customer service is the most important thing and I REALLY appreciate that the jobs are kept in the country and not overseas!!!  that's enough reason to use Purolator.Sincerely, Suzanne @  Natural Beauty Skincare®Date of experience: October 21, 2016

Name: Alexander Gosselin
Review: No door tag, item sent back to France.I had my parcel shipped through Chronopost from France. When it arrived in Canada, they shipped it the rest of the way via Purolator. I had to call their office in Montreal to get the tracking number - but too late. The item had apparently been here in Vancouver for a week, and Shipped back to Chronopost's Montreal Office yesterday. It's still in transit right now. It would have been nice to get a door tag from Purolator, but I guess they were too busy. The parcel is still in Purolator's posession, but they best they could do for me was to give me a complaint number for the driver. WHAT USE IS A COMPLAINT NUMBER TO ME? I DON'T CARE WHAT YOU DO WITH YOUR DRIVER. Other than that, all they can tell me is OH WELL, TOO BAD.Date of experience: October 19, 2016

Name: S Dunphy
Review: DeliveryPurolator is the worst delivery service in Ontario.For the third time the driver did not deliver because of the excuse could not find street number.I can tell you none of the other delivery companies have a problem finding my townhouse,even the pizza guy and the paper delivery does not have a problem.I will never ever use Purolator again.I wonder where management at Purolator don't address this problem.Dont they read the thousands of bad reviews on line.Having worked in the transportation industry for 30 years and done home delivery in various jobs, lazy incompetent drivers did not have a job very long if they performed a work ethic like this.Purolator I have a question for you,what if it was a customer waiting for medical supplies.Date of experience: October 14, 2016

Name: ana Cser
Review: Absolutely horrendous experienceI've never had good experiences with this courier company and sadly I never know which courier my online order will come with otherwise I would never ever deal with Purolator. But this experience tops the cake! Last year in November I ordered a crib from babies r us. I was 8 months pregnant and exhausted from walking around so I thought I'd save myself and my hubby another trip to the store! I paid $150 for the delivery and my delivery was delayed 3 times due to "purolator needed 2 people to deliver, as the item was over 150lbs" as per customer service! Okay, sure. Whatever, I get it. Heavy item. Finally after talking to  customer support a few times we agreed on a date where I would stay home from work for the item to be delivered. That day, I get a call from downstairs of my condo and the purolator guy says very rudely "I got your package, can you bring a dolly and you or someone else has to come help me it's heavy". I explained I was pregnant and no one was home. I was not about to wait another 3 weeks for this package so I asked my neighbor who thankfully had a dolly and picked up the package. He brought it up himself without the help of the delivery guy. First of all, a lot can be learned here purolator. Like, plan ahead for big packages and equip your staff with tools to carry heavy packages. But as for customer service? Your whole staff needs a 4 week course in simple etiquette and empathy. I can't believe I paid $150 for your horrible service not to mention took a day off work!!Date of experience: October 11, 2016

Name: Donna Leon
Review: STAY AWAY FROM PUROLATOR!I set up a small business account in July and used Purolator twice since then.  The first time, I shipped three boxes across the country.  The goods were in moving boxes, packed tightly, labelled and sealed securely with packing tape.  When we viewed them upon delivery, two were torn open and clothes were falling out.  I couldn't believe the poor condition!  It's as if they had been tossed off a truck at high speed. Strike one.Three weeks ago, I sent a computer in an electronics box (which I bought from UPS, as Purolator does not have any supplies of that nature).  Not only was it in a proper electronics box, but we also went the extra mile by wrapping it a great deal of bubble wrap purchased at the UPS store. It was so secure inside that box that no harm should have ever come to it. The computer, an older Mac Book Pro, worked perfectly and was to be used by my son, who required a Mac for a Computer Sciences course at university.  It arrived in Halifax with a dent in the metal casing, and a screen that was in hundreds of pieces.  It was unusable.  Couldn't even be repaired.  The value was $300.  Purolator's Claims Specialist rejected the claim because 'the computer was not in its manufacturer's packaging'.  So if we had shipped it in the Mac box, which was much flimsier than the UPS electronics box, the claim would have been accepted?!  And to add insult to injury, the surly clerk at the Purolator office in Kitchener allowed me to purchase insurance for that $300 value, even though technically, one cannot insure used goods such as that if not in original packaging. She also knew what I was shipping, and said nothing at the time. Purolator is not 'there for me', as they slogan states.  Their shippers clearly don't give a hoot about customer service.  I am closing out my small business account.  I should not be surprised.  91% owned by Canada Post. Same attitude, same poor service.  Save yourself and your goods. Go elsewhere! Sayonara, Purolator.Date of experience: October 11, 2016

Name: Tenby Lloyd
Review: Absolutely awfulFor three days now my package has been out for delivery, and not delivered. THREE days in a row, the driver ran out of time and couldn't deliver it.If you aren't able to deliver a package due to time constraints, then those missed packages should take priority the next day. THREE DAYS later and there's still no time.And when I call to complain, I find out that only 10 packages were missed. So for 3 days they just couldn't be bothered to deliver those few packages? Absolutely unacceptable. And now it's a long weekend... so another 3 days...Why do I bother paying for faster shipping when it's over a week late?Will NEVER be using purolator again, and will now only order from companies that use a different shipping service.Date of experience: October 08, 2016

Name: Anthony Glazebrook
Review: Why do Amazon use them?We were expecting a package but Purolator didn't deliver it because they "didn't have access to the front door". When I called them it turned out that they didn't have the buzzer number. We have a modern system where you search for a buzzer number by surname and yet they couldn't look it up yesterday. Now I have to wait until after the long weekend because their driver has already left to make his deliveries today. Terrible service.Date of experience: October 07, 2016

Name: LeilaO
Review: Amazon reputation destroyed by PurolatorUsed Amazon in 7 locations, only Purolator messes things up so badly. Ordered stuff on Amazon.ca and chose deliver to address. No buzzing, no knock, nothing. Slip of paper was dropped at my condo door and telling me I have to go to 30 minutes away to pick up my stuff. First off, the reason I ordered prime was that the stuff I order gets delivered to my door so I don't have to drive. I don't have a car. Somebody please stop this company from working with Amazon, they're ruining amazon's reputation.Date of experience: October 07, 2016

Name: Mike
Review: USELESSWell learnd another valuable lesson today. Useless is a waste of a word on these turds !! Incompetence at its best. I worked for FedEx 22 yrs ago and things worked better then. How embarrassing with the advancements in computers and robotics. Drivers stealing packages and lying about delivery attempts. Not to mention ridiculous rates. Call center yeah that's even more frustrating. Can't get a simple answer always side stepping the question.Date of experience: October 06, 2016

Name: Ctrl C Ctrl V
Review: Changing delivery date from yesterday to ''not available''I couldn't remember if I had used them before until last night. They never came and just changed the delivery date to ''not available''... No call, nothing. Last time I used them, I had JUST missed the truck and had to drive 25 minutes to go pick it up... I feel that I will probably have to do it this time too seen as I don't even know when they are coming now...Why do they have so little pick up places? Never have that problem when I use UPS or Canada Post...Date of experience: October 05, 2016

Name: Iryna
Review: Terrible service,never use Purolator againAbsolutely unacceptable service! I was going to send a birthday gift for my relative in U.S (which was a perfume ), Purolator guy has checked the prohibited items list and never found a perfume in it so I've been told it's OK to ship it. The next day I got a call from Purolator telling me they cannot deliver the birthday gift since it's "dangerous item".. what?! Really? And they said they cannot bring it back since they don't have my physical address which is ridiculous because I gave my address while sending the parcel! Anyway,I patiently gave them my address again and asked them what approximate time of delivery will be. I never got an answer, just "sometime tomorrow" so it means I have to sacrifice my day sitting tight at home waiting for them?! Anyway, I missed them coming just another 10minutes,so I phoned back and asked if they can send the driver back. They rejected! Even though he was just here! I've been told that only medication package is worth coming back and I can pick it up myself whenever I can... Very unprofessional and rude,the whole story from the beginning to an end. Thank you for nothing, Purolator. .Date of experience: October 04, 2016

Name: Mason Databi
Review: Worst courier ever, why amazon still use them?Whenever my amazon order was supposed to be delivered by them, I ended up picking it myself. They have worst logistics, and drivers. Make sure ask your countrrparty to not deliver through themDate of experience: September 28, 2016

Name: Mary
Review: WORST SERVICE EVER!Seriously can people stop using this? We never ever received anything that we expect. I would stay at home specially to make sure I'm there when they come with the package... I live in a condo building and they've never ever even rung my buzzer or left it with the concierge or anything... in fact the concierge never even sees them. Do they even drive around or just leave it at their absurd locations. SO BAD!!!!!Date of experience: September 26, 2016

Name: blair
Review: Can't pick up on same day like canada post8:29am On vehicle for delivery on the Purolator web site does not give an estimated time for delivery. some time that day I can't wait all day for it. so  I leave for 1 hr and they show up when aim not their at 10:53am. And its on a Friday so grate. I will have to go too the depo but. I have to white until Monday at 10am what is that I cant pick up same day? or even Saturday but their not even Open on Saturday day.  Canada post does it. after 1pm. customer service no help at all on the phone. It is cost me money now. WILL NOT USE THEM AGAIN!!!!! Canada Post for all my packages now!!!!Tracking Number: JWD005577048 Was on Friday 23,2016Date of experience: September 25, 2016

Name: Andrew
Review: UselessOrdered an item, express shipping, needed it for the weekend. Delivery was attempted Friday, while I was home, but no effort was made to contact me or let me know my package was here, didn't even leave a delivery notice on the door. Now I have to wait till Monday, or head across town on a 2 hour long bus trip to pick up the item. A lot of good that does.Date of experience: September 23, 2016

Name: Ian
Review: Poor customer service,Wow great customer service. All in all thank you for being the sh*#*#est delivery company I have ever had the miss fortune to use I applaud your efforts In poor customer service. Below is a simple bullet point on what went wrong. Delivery driver  could not deliver package because of bad weather. On that day the sun was shining a beautiful sunny day . Driver could not deliver because road was closed. Road was not closed I was in all day . Driver could not deliver because address was wrong. No it was not . Spoke to a manager asked parcel to be delivered elsewhere. However it would cost me. . Asked parcel to be sent to one of your collection points . Walked the 2 miles to collection point and no parcel . Call customer service and well the results from your customer service is a good old fashioned we don't give a sh*#* because we have your money. Paid for 2 day shipping it is now day 7  so now I'm gonna have to claim from my credit card company. Give your selfs a slap on the backDate of experience: September 21, 2016

Name: Clement Manuelpillai
Review: Absolutely the worst courier service in Canada.I shipped a server on Sept 6 from Toronto to Halifax for a next day delivery. I paid $266.44 for this and promised it will be there the very next day. I shipped it on Sept 6. I flew to Halifax on Sept 8, Thursday to setup and configure it. I found the server wasn't delivered on Wednesday as promised. When I called I was informed it was lost in transit and they were looking for it. I waited till Monday, Sept 12 for them to find it and was told it was lost and asked me to put an insurance claim which I did. On Sept 14 i received an email stating the server was found in Brunswick and they will ship it to Halifax same day. Today is Sept 20 and I am still waiting for the server. When I call or email asking for it all I get  is, it is in transit and they will let me know.It has been 14 days since I shipped this 5' long, 4' wide 20 lbs box, and paid for a next day delivery, which I can't imagine how can they lose it in the first place, and still hasn't been delivered. Most of all the customer service I got from Purolator was a JOKE. Their attitude was, yea we lost it, things happen go fly a kite!! I actually want to give them a negative 4 stars but it is not available. I have lost more than 3 grand in my flight up and down to Halifax, hotel and food charges and my time.NEVER AGAIN!!!Date of experience: September 20, 2016

Name: zaskar30
Review: As usual, the worse7:44 AM.. out for delivery. 6:17 still states out for delivery yet they are done for the day. No new updates and good luck talking to someone. As a rule, I never use this useless company. However it is the choice of one of our distributors. They make UPS look like saints.Date of experience: September 20, 2016

Name: No Real Name Online (Sorry)
Review: Delivered by Canda Post?I had an item shipped from the USA (a new phone, for those wondering), and when the package arrived at my door, it was in the hands of a Canada Post worker.  I guess Purolator only shipped it over the boarder, and Canada Post took over.  Three stars because the package was not delayed when shipped, but for some reason, the tracking code was not working, even though I checked the day after it was issued to my email.  Overall, OK, but if you have a choice for courier, try FedEx instead.  When I shipped from them, the parcel tracking was working, and was delivered the morning it was supposed to arrive.Date of experience: September 19, 2016

Name: chris
Review: what a jokei am absolutely disgusted with this service and border line fraudulent services purolator is running . I sent an order out on Thursday and was told by the employee that " I guarantee it will be delivered on Saturday, it would  be in the morning or late evening" it is satuday and the package hasn't moved its status since, thank you purolator for charging me $220 for a absolute failure of a service and for a largely missed opportunity to feature my fashion pieces in a high profile music video.the item was going to Los angeles , shipped from vancouver it went to seattle then somehow to louisville and is stuck there now. Then the package was handed off to UPS where it was no where mentioned that a alternate carrier would complete the service. if your paying that kind of money to have something shipped you would expect a direct route not a loop around. at this point i was better off paying for a flight and delivering the pieces to the director himself.Date of experience: September 17, 2016

Name: Jenn
Review: Lied about delivery attemptWe were expecting a package from Purolator. They claimed to have attempted delivery twice, yet they did not leave one of those delivery forms on the door. We found that really odd SO...We have video cameras on our property that record 24hrs a day and according to the footage, Purolator NEVER even came to the house. Apparently, they lied about attempting to deliver the package. TWICE. NICE.Date of experience: September 12, 2016

Name: Hanna g
Review: The worst delivery company I have ever seen in my life!!!There is nothing good about this company. They kept my item for a week after they received. They are very careless. The lady that worked there was pretty rude and arrogant. And ofcourse, my item was damaged by the time it got to me. Never again. If you can please choose another companyDate of experience: September 09, 2016

Name: Dexter
Review: Worst courierPurolator never delivered my package at home. The driver is very lazy. I always need to pick up my package to the Purolator. They always lie on telling "attempted delivery-receiver unavailable", even there's people in our home 24/7.Date of experience: September 01, 2016

Name: Dave
Review: HORRIBLE SERVICE STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVEDPUROLATOR is by far the WORST company I've ever dealt with. Package sent via EXPRESS has still not arrived after 4 business days and the service agents cannot give me an answer as to why there has been a hold up and where my package is now. I have spent 2 hours on hold to speak with 2 agents. The first lady was unfit to be working in any sort of customer service position. She was very unhelpful and grumpy. I asked to speak with a manager and she declined. She assured me I would be contacted ASAP. I was not contacted so I called back 4 hours later. This rep was much more empathetic and friendly but still was unable to resolve or even answer questions that I had regarding why my package is "delayed" or "sorting error". They honestly have no idea whats going on.I have now received an email saying that I must provide the details of my package before my "case" will be proceeded with. How is this relevant? I have provided details as to my package and am now waiting to hear back. I have offered numerous times to pick the package up personally at the sorting facility but they don't seem to be able to find my package. This "business" is a joke. I will never use this courier for any future en devours. I suggest all options be exhausted before allowing this company to handle your parcels.Date of experience: September 01, 2016

Name: Romeo Brabus
Review: PUReLATe 'eR - SHIP YOUR ITEM MAYBEThis is a classic example of a 3rd world courier service, amazingly still operating in the developed world. PUROLATOR HAS A ZERO-TOLERANCE FOR DRUNK DRIVING POLICY! which is why you will not get your delivery on Friday or Monday! These clowns need to pack it up for good, and there by leave it to couriers that actually deliver.Date of experience: August 30, 2016

Name: Jon
Review: Poor Customer ServiceI was expecting a parcel to be delivered from a purchase on Amazon. I do not have a functioning buzzer for my apartment suite set up yet, as such, I put a note on the front door of the building with my phone number asking for a call so I could come down and sign. No such luck, the delivery person couldn't be bothered to make a phone call but simply stuck the pick-up tag to my note.Utterly poor customer service, laziness, and lack of reasonable judgment. In today's world there is absolutely no way someone does not have a cellphone on them. In regard to the possibility that this is a policy, it's also a very short sighted policy in today's society. The purpose of delivery is so that I don't have to wait until 7PM to drive across town to pick up my package, frankly quite shi**y service. I'll be requesting any future purchases from online vendors avoid Purolator.Date of experience: August 29, 2016

Name: S. Byers
Review: Absolutely the worstI can't count now the number of hours I've been waiting on the phone for customer service! Finally someone picked up, she was completely rude, she didn't even bother to look into my parcel, I was so mad I hung up!  After all these hours of waiting for help this is what I get?  How can a company run this way? I'm speechless!Date of experience: August 26, 2016

Name: Victoria
Review: LiarsThe representatives lie to their customers re:parcel arrivals. It is both frustrating and incredibly disappointing. I have copied conversations between myself and purolator representatives where these lies are demonstrated.Date of experience: August 19, 2016

Name: Frank Fettucini
Review: I would rather die than use purolatorWasted 12 dollars to get it here as fast as possible. It's almost 8 PM and it's not here. The tracker can only say delayed- for three days! Still not here, and I don't think it's gonna get here. NEVER USE THE SERVICE PUROLATOR HAS TO OFFER. IT WILL DISAPPOINT YOU I CAN GUARANTEE IT!Date of experience: August 16, 2016

Name: Gilles Page
Review: Drivers lies about attempting to deliver4 times out of 5 deliveries the online tracking tells me the driver tried to deliver and no one was home. I work at home, I'm there 24/7...Once I found the fail to deliver slip in my mailbox in the lobby. Another time at my door.. twice more, I got no slip and found out online... I believe the drivers are lazy. instead of carrying up the package they just grab a failure slip and stick it on the door or in the mail without bringing in the package and claim no one was home...I never had one failure with Canada Post or UPS. But the failure rate for Purolator is mathematically impossible. Your customers are getting screwed if you use this delivery service. You pay for a "at the door" service and your customer will never receive the package and will have to fork out extra dough to go get it themselves, gas or cab expense.Date of experience: August 11, 2016

Name: F
Review: Never use purolatorWorst company everDate of experience: August 09, 2016

Name: Bbbbb
Review: Worst delivery!!I wasted 2 days of my time wanting for my parcel to get here. First delivery, the driver didn't even knock on the know, only put we missed you note, second time it was delayed missed delivery. Now I have to wait for another delivery (this will be the third time). I had to cancel all of my daughter piano lesson, dance lesson which cost me over $ 900.00 that I can't get back. Due for the lack of laziness of driver who CANT do their job So now I'm s..t out of luck. Purolator shouldshould pay for my child piano and dance lesson she missed. Because the driver could show up in the hours of 9am to 5pm.Date of experience: August 09, 2016

Name: Kiran
Review: Delivered somewhere elseMy package tracking status shows that it is delivered at reception, but the package hasn't reached the address. The address on file is correct. I have filed a complaint and yet to hear anything back from them.Date of experience: August 07, 2016

Name: tik lado
Review: Extremely bad service!!!!!Their customer service is rude, extremely unhelpful and unresponsive. I don't know why this company continues to be in business.Date of experience: August 04, 2016

Name: Peter Rankin
Review: Amazon Prime recently switched my area to Purolator.Amazon Prime promises two day delivery  and for the last couple of years they haven't missed ? But since they switched to Purolator they haven't managed an ontime delivery.  My last order took 17 Days !! Today's delivery has gone missing and Purolator can't be contacted. Not much point in having a carrier that can't deliver.Date of experience: August 03, 2016

Name: Loretta Fazari
Review: Worst company I ever dealt withThis courier company has got to be the worst. I have lived in different parts of Europe, U.S and of course Canada and still they have not changed.  They give you a date, you wait all day and yet not even a courtesy call or email to tell you that they cannot make it.  The worst company to deal with.Date of experience: August 02, 2016

Name: Red Guy
Review: Lazy and incompetent.I had documents sent over Purolator that are required for business travel visa application. I had the company send it over express so it gets to me faster.The f****d up thing is, I stayed home (missing work, essentially paying $400 to get this f***ing package). THE DRIVER DIDNT KNOCK AND PUT A "MISSED YOU" NOTICE AT THE FRONT DOOR.Apparently now I can't get the package until tomorrow from their local depot that's in the middle of nowhere. What's the point of having this s***ty company deliver stuff to you, when you have to travel an hour out of your way to get the package? Now I have to miss two work days to get my package?I called customer service and they basically couldn't do anything. This company is unbelievable.Date of experience: August 02, 2016

Name: Gigi Ray
Review: Horrible! Lying and very unhelpfulSaid they called to arrange a delivery i never got a call or voicemail. Now they keep telling me to wait for a call that never comes! The person on live chat was of no help and disconnected me without attempting to help me.Date of experience: August 02, 2016

Name: Daniel R. Page
Review: Put off my vacation for a package, comes the same day I leave the province, Purolator had no idea where my stuff wasI urge big stores like Best Buy to stop using Purolator, it is ridiculous.  So for a story: I preordered months ago two copies of a new video game (Monster Hunter Generations) for my girlfriend and myself.  When I had preordered them, I was under the assumption they were going to come with Canada Post, boy I was wrong. Best Buy swapped for Purolator due to the vice on the postal service.  I live in London, so Mississauga (where the shipments come from) is about 3 hours away, so it is expected to come within 1-2 business days (that is the way it always has been with Canada Post for us, we order from them quite often because I have a very busy schedule).  Didn't come until the following week (and even then, they came when nobody was here so my gf while I was gone had to take a very obscure bus to get it the following week after I left), the very day I was leaving (which I intentionally picked so I would have my copy so I could at least keep my girlfriend company while I am gone).  Since the game was sold out almost everywhere, it was very hard to find 2 local copies (fortunately I did), but now I got 2 extra copies I have to return because a certain company couldn't do their basic responsibilities to delivery electronics quickly as expected (because you know, that's the point of a preorder).    When I contacted Purolator, they could not provide me any information on my shipment at all, and told me to contact Best Buy.  Best Buy didn't know anything and it took them at least a week to track it down, and by that point it by happenstance was coming that day.  Absolutely absurd service, and will not order from any company that uses Purolator.  Due to their delivery policies I wasted maybe 3 days of my work week waiting around for something that wasn't coming, which is a huge penalty for me because I do scientific research (where every day counts).Date of experience: July 31, 2016

Name: Sam
Review: The Worst Courier in the History of MankindIn the last few months, I've had to deal with Purlolator as it unfortunately remains to be Dell's courier of choice, and at this point, without fear of contradiction, I can rate them as consistently substandard.Inferior quality plagues all aspects of this two-bit company's services. Without exception, every single package handled by them has been a frustrating experience infested with enormous delays only worsened by unacceptable excuses, a chaotic website with outdated and inaccurate information, rude agents accompanied by irrational supervisors, and lazy drivers who can't or won't even read the buzzer code displayed in plain site on the entrance of the building, send the package to a remote depot, and then have the audacity to demand that the buzzer code has to be included in the address label. This shameless group of incompetent people have taken irresponsibility to a new level. Their allegedly low prices perfectly reflect their incredibly low quality. In a nutshell, this cheap courier service has to be avoided at all costs, even if your life depended on it. If you can't afford a proper courier, do yourself a favor and send your package by regular mail.  The chances are that it will reach its destination days, perhaps weeks, before the purely pathetic Purolator can deliver. Unless you insist on wasting your money, time and energy, SAY NO TO PURELATOR. Help bring them down to their knees so they either shape up or preferably ship out, leaving the job to the real professionals who know what they're doing and treat your with a modicum of respect.Date of experience: July 29, 2016

Name: Devin
Review: Horrible Customer ServiceOk,  so let's start my rant about this my package was apparently delivered to my doorstep at my address hmm...  Where is it?  Call Purolator I think I called, and they said I don't know we will trace it still nothing back hmm....  Horrible shipping like seriously all I gotta say Is **** themDate of experience: July 29, 2016

Name: Doug M
Review: turtle express should be Purolators new sloganOur company send a package to Vancouver from Parksville and it took 7 days to basically cross over on a ferry.When you call Purolar for answers all you get is a recording saying we are experiencing higher than normal delivery times. I guess we now live in a world with absolutely no customer service. sad reality.DougDate of experience: July 28, 2016

Name: Sim Nico
Review: Lost in a blackholeI chatted with the customer service of newegg 2 times and purolator as definitivly took my package and i chatted with 3 person of the customer service and they say they don't have it physicaly so they can't give me an estimation of the time where it is? IN SPACE?!? IN A BLACKHOLE?!Date of experience: July 26, 2016

Name: Pat Care
Review: Take my package on joyrideOk so i had my ps4 sent out to the service centre as it needed repaired and was under warranty. Sony sent me a empty box for my ps4 which puralator got to me in 2 days which wasnt too bad ( sony service centre is literally only an hour away ) i then sent it back which they did deliver quite quickly ( my thoughts are with big company deals they make sure on their side the package is delivered top priority) but now sony has shipped my ps4 back and its been 5 days. Meanwhile sony and purlator centre is located an hour away. Thats not the biggest problem. The day after it was on vehicle for delivery with estimated day the day after and nothing. I literally sat at home all day waiting for nothing to have at 11:59 that day for it to change to say not available. Ok whatever i got over that the next day now it said was the next estimated day available so again i sit at home waiting all day as i here a bunch of storys with puralator leaving and not leaving your package and would u happen to guess same thing happened. This has now happned another 2-3 days and nothing! I have literally almost stayed at home a week straight for nothing! Meanwhile they live an hour away! I rather of drove out their then stay at home all day for a week. I have never had this problem with any other carrier only puralator i really recommend do not use this service. I honestly dont even know how their still in business. They dont even deserve a 1 star.- Angry customer ( i am also extremely mad at sony for even using this company as their carrier hopefully changes soon )Date of experience: July 26, 2016

Name: Toby
Review: Packages have dropped off the face of the earth.I have been waiting almost three weeks for packages that should have taken a few days. One of these packages was shipped express. The tracking information has been stagnant for over a week, and when I called (after waiting on hold for eternity) I was told to keep waiting. I understand there was an increased volume of shipments due to the threat of a postal strike, but this is unacceptable. A few days late would have been expected, but not a few weeks. I will never use Purolator again, and I will go out of my way to tell everyone to stay away from Purolator at all costs.Date of experience: July 26, 2016

Name: fred
Review: worst group of imbeciles in the wordthey do not even deserve to call them a company. when you deal with them you think they broke out of a mental institution.one driver is the exception, he was friendly and nice.there is always one exception to the rule.i call them POORoLATER. because they never deliver.except for one driver who did. the exception!i was at the poorolater office aero drive calgary today. i have never been treated worse anywhere in the world. they treated me like a criminal for picking up my package. first of all there were about 20 people in this small office of about 10 squaremeters. no queue was formed, they just did not care who came first and did not even try to do the normal first come first serve.i had to wait for quite a long time with three people jumping the line in front of me. i decided to wait because i am a peaceful person not searching for any unnecessary conflict.when it was my (late) turn i handed over the notice which the incompetent driver(who did not deliver even though i was at home) left at my door. i also showed my government id to identify myself. they asked me for an id with my address on it. what??? who in the world would ever want his address on his government id? in no civilised country in the world people would accept that.i told him that i would call police right now and he would be charged with a felony because of holding back my property which was already paid for.while i was waiting there was one employee who looked mentally disabled laughing at me all the time. i asked him why he laughed and i told him that i would agree that this was laughable but he said nothing. he looked like a mental patient.a few minutes later a moron even tried to argue that anyone with my name could come to pick up my package. everyone with my name? first of all there is noone with my name in all of north america and second even if there was how would this person with my name get in posession of the failed delivery notice which i handed over to them.after a while of arguing and threatening them they finally handed me over my package. i told them to use their brains and commonsense and left.google those imbeciles and you find only excuses about a strike (why whould this be your business anyway). they behave totally irrational in any way and impolite so you want to avoid them under any circumstances.use professional companies like ups or fedex and you will save yourself a lot of grief and angerDate of experience: July 26, 2016

Name: Jimmy Yip
Review: tons and tons of delayIt's terrible that Purolator has dropped the ball... for SO LONG!it's been more than a month due to this delay and I have to wait 3 weeks for a 2 day guaranteed delivery from Amazon.ca. And yet! it's still not here yet!Date of experience: July 26, 2016

Name: Amanda
Review: I wish I could give zero stars.Purolator is ruining Amazon's reputation in Canada.Ordered a printer. Driver refused to even try to deliver it to my apartment because no buzzer code was provided, even though my name is in the directory.Thus starts a week of going back and forth about me coming to pick up my package in person.Wednesday I am on hold for 45 minutes to talk to an agent who tells me that yes, I can pick it up and apologizes for the delay, they are overwhelmed. I say I want to pick it up Saturday. She says that's fine, they will put in the request and my tracking info will update.Friday it's a day before I'm going to pick it up. No update. I talk to an agent again, this time on LiveChat. Agent says yes the package will be ready for you to pick up tomorrow. Saturday I go to pick it up and wait for 30 minutes. Guess what? No, package is not available.On Monday the tracking information is updated to Address correction required - incomplete / incorrect address provided after "Arrived at sort facility," "Departed sort facility," "Picked up by Purolator," "Arrived at sort facility," "Delayed in transit" -- all on Monday.So I contacted an agent again to clarify the issue and she says the address needs to be corrected to match my ID. And I said no it doesn't because it already matches what is on my ID. I want to pick it up on Saturday, she says I should be able to. How much confidence do you think I have that I will drive 30 minutes and pick it up?Unacceptable behaviour for a shipping/logistics business.  If you can't scale, that's your business problem, not the consumer's.Date of experience: July 25, 2016

Name: Ash Kohman
Review: Unacceptable Customer ServiceI totally get delays. It happens. But when I speak to a customer service representative and she tells me that my package is on a trailer somewhere in my city and that she has no way of telling me when it might arrive or how I may access it, this is a major problem. There was no attempt to help me in any way. If Purolator's package tracking is so inefficient that it is literally impossible for a representative to give a reasonable timeframe for delivery to a customer it's no wonder that they are experiencing such huge delays. Worst customer service I've ever experienced, and I will go out of my way to never use Purolator again and to make sure everyone I know hears about my experience.Date of experience: July 25, 2016

Name: Perfecto Balakubak
Review: Ruining other company's reputationBought separate packages from amazon. One goes through purolator where I tried to signed up with their free Prime 2 days delivery and the other one is just regular shipping. The regular shipping was received ahead of scheduled arrival. I was so glad that I received earlier than promised. That one done by Fedex. The other one with purolator with Amazon Prime, until now I do not know the status of the package. I should receive it last Thursday as promised. Today is Sunday but there is no status yet when I am going to receive it. Very very very poor and delayed service. Companies should avoid Purolator. It will ruin their promises.Date of experience: July 24, 2016

Name: Jack Perry
Review: BrutalDelayed 6 business days so far, waited around all day for my package to come and phones the company to make sure the delivery guy had my buzzer number. He didn't show up all day so I tracked my shipment and it said incomplete address even though I phoned first thing in the morning to add my buzzer number and even reconfirmed my shipping address. I've been on the phone with them 3 times and on hold for the next hour to get a hold of them again. WORST EXPERIENCE EVERDate of experience: July 23, 2016

Name: Prash
Review: Just terrible!!3 days delayed (suppose to be delivered on the 19th of July 2016) and when I asked them they told me that it will most likely come on the 26th of July 2016 (5 business days delayed) and they still can't tell me if it will be delivered on that day. Usually I wouldn't care, but this is some equipment I am buying for my vacation, and I will be leaving for my vacation on the the 25th of July 2016. I let them know that I will be leaving and they have not replied as of yet. Unbelievable. I wish Best Buy let me choose who they were shipping with when I was at their check out. Not going to purchase from stores that use purolator anymore. Terrible service, cant even get anyone on the phone or their live chat. Going to get in touch with Best Buy and request for a refund and as a reason I am going to tell them that their shipper has not delivered the product and its going to be delayed over a week and that is nothing something I signed up for. Lets see what Best Buy will do if they start getting refund requests because products were not delivered by purolator.Date of experience: July 23, 2016

Name: Davood
Review: Worst experience so farThe item was shipped on July 19th from Toronto to Edmonton. The status page has been saying "The shipment is delayed due to delay in transit" since July 21st. I have no idea what this means! The item was supposed to arrive before July 22nd and it is July 23rd. I couldn't talk to them on the phone last night after more than one hour waiting. The live chat box says no one is available to answer. You judge it. Should I be happy with them?Date of experience: July 23, 2016

Name: Kevin Mathison
Review: TERRIBLE SERVICEI have lost packages! had packages stolen from my front doorstep, And sometimes I just don't receive my packages due to the fact there deliverers walk up to your front door quietly tap just once and run. A package I just ordered was suppose to arrive on Thursday! never showed! Then again on Friday! of course never showed, I phoned only to get no explanation why my package was not yet delivered and was told to wait until the end of the day because it just may still be delivered. It was not delivered and according to them they had made two attempts and will make a third and Final Attempt on Monday. So I am stuck at home all 3 of these days waiting for a package that looks like it will never get here. BELIEVE ME TRYING TO GET A PACKAGE FROM PUROLATOR IS LIKE TRYING TO WIN THE LOTTERY!!!!!.Date of experience: July 23, 2016

Name: Mike P
Review: Should be zeroI don't think Ive ever had a good experience with this company. I order many things online and I dont think Purolator has ever had an on time delivery for me.  Latest example that displays their incompetence. I ordered a large shipment off Amazon Prime which for unknown reasons was split into 3 shipments (Canada Post, UPS and Purolator). The first part which was Canada post arrived one day EARLY. UPS delivered theirs on the expected day early in AM. I am one day later still waiting for my parts from Purolator. This is supposed to be with guaranteed 2 day shipping. I have no idea how these guys stay in business.Date of experience: July 22, 2016

Name: Keith
Review: UnbelievableI ordered something from Amazon (One-Day) on July 13th and they still have no clue when it will arrive.  This was coming from Toronto to Ottawa.  It sat in Toronto for several days, inexplicably delayed in transit,  and most recently has been scanned 5 time as 'Arrived' in Ottawa.  After escalating it, someone called and asked if it was an envelope or a box?? Shouldn't they know...then he asked what was in it??  Why does that matter...So Amazon tells me to order another one with overnight service and I do.  Now that one is lost as well.  First, I have to say Amazon has been great about responding to me and refunding shipping costs but I still don't have the thing I ordered, which is what I really care about...not the money.Purolator claims everything is due to increased volume (blaming a potential postal strike) but frankly that is not my problem.  They continue to take packages and people's money without any accountability.  If they can't meet the most basic delivery services because they are 'too busy' then they should shut down and re-organize before taking another single package.I encourage Amazon, and ALL companies, to drop them as a delivery service and it is time for the Canadian people to get out of the delivery business and sell that ridiculous crown corporation.Date of experience: July 22, 2016

Name: Gerry
Review: Complete Logistical Failure...There seems to be a major issue with delivery/courier companies servicing lower mainland of BC. I had an item sent from the States through the other company...the one with the big brown trucks?...They took 21 days to get it here from less than 800 miles away...then they delivered it to a business 3 blocks away. The person there told them it was the wrong address but the driver just said "it seemed like the right number" to him.So I went with Purolator this time. The item shipped from Saskatoon to Vancouver in just over two days. The item was scheduled for delivery on the 14th. It is a home improvement item that I need a tradesman to install so I booked one for the 15th with the proviso that the item is available. As you can guess the 14th came and suddenly the expected delivery date changed...late in the day to "unknown". I tried calling on 4 occasions all totaled 5 hours on hold...each time the phone would just go dead after about an hour and 15 minutes. During this time you hear how you can improve your business by using Purolator so your customers can track the items you are shipping them. Amazingly ironic.Tried e-mail..no reply...live chat..no staff available. I even tried to go in the back door to talk with someone about shipping a new item...no answer.How does this company stay in business?My company measures customer wait times in 3 second intervals...3 seconds...these guys think within a week is close enough.They "attempted" to deliver item today...my wife was at home...heard nothing...she went out front to water plants and there on the door is a delivery notification. The item is about 7 km from the house. It has probably been there for a week but I am only being told of it now.Obviously they are working their staff hard if they can't answer a call in more than an hour or take the time to actually wait for someone to answer their door.Hey Purolator...I will send you payment through your own company...it may or may not get there...Date of experience: July 22, 2016

Name: Traian Manta
Review: worst courier company I've ever metPurolator delivery men do not have phones! They come in front of your building and then leave if the door is not open or you don't have a buzzer. You are at home, waiting all day long, after having given them all the requested information (address and phone number, of course) and still will not receive any parcel!I even left a note on the door of the building telling the courier to call me maybe from his personal phone, that I would hang up and call him right back. Guess what: he wrote "no phone" on my note. What kind of delivery company has no phones allowed for its employees? Then, no one is answering the client phone number on their site. Finally, after a couple of days, you find out that "you weren't at home" and you have to go to their warehouse to pick up your parcel.I will not buy anything else on the internet before asking which is the shipment company. Postes Canada is ten times more reliable (at least you get what you ordered)I will strongly advise the supplier I had ordered from to stop using this courier company.Date of experience: July 21, 2016

Name: Mars
Review: Would rather kill myself than have another delivery from Purolator4 week delivery for my 2 shipments LUL, "Delayed due to missed delivery" LUL, too bad there is no 0 star optionDate of experience: July 20, 2016

Name: country_guy
Review: Parcel "In Transit" for more than a week from Quebec to Arprior.The parcel was picked up by Purolator on July 11th.  Expected delivery was indicated as July 12.  Remember this is only from SherBrook Quebec to Arnprior Ontario. July 12 came and went. The expected delivery changed from July 12 to "Not Available"  It is now July 20th and its still showing as "In Transit" with a delivery date as "Not Available"  The customer service line does not pick up, and email went ignored.  The live chat times out saying "no agent available".  If they are still excepting parcels they are committing fraud because right now they lack the ability to delivery in a reasonable time.Date of experience: July 20, 2016

Name: Lo
Review: Unacceptable delay and non-existent customer helpI've been waiting for delivery of an order since July 3. Purolator's last posting on July 12 says "Delayed in transit". There are no Live Chat agents and the call line does not accept calls. My email has not been returned. I have resorted to asking the merchant to intervene, but they have advised me that Purolator does not respond to their inquiries, either. They are just as frustrated as I am. I would pick up the order myself from Purolator if they would only communicate with me and tell me where it is!!Date of experience: July 20, 2016

Name: survsteve
Review: Horrible service throughoutOrdered back ordered item prior to whole Canada Post nonsense.  Shipped on June 7th, Today is June 19th and still it's sitting in a sorting facility.Was supposed to arrive on the 13th.Spent 1 hr waiting on hold with cust support, nothing they can do.. not even sure if it's lost or what at this point..  $700 video card not in my computer.  Emails sent to customer service went unanswered as of last week.Date of experience: July 20, 2016

Name: PissedCustomer
Review: Using the Canada Post issue as excuse.The biggest issue is not that they could not deliver ontime. The bigger issue is they dont know where the packages are. Common on on this day and age and they dont know where the package is?Purolator the worst shipping company. I hope businesses stops using it. Lets force the company to stop using purolator by disputing credit card charges and paypal transaction.Date of experience: July 20, 2016

Name: Louise Marion
Review: INCOMPETENCE requiredThese people are the most incompetent all sitting under one roof! They don't deliver your package because they have an incomplete address but wait an extra day before posting it on the tracking site and then tell you it's the fault of the sender and you'll have to wait at least an extra day after you've already lost 2 days off staying home while waiting for a package that is not to arrive. And don't forget to have a pillow by your side when you try to call them, since the waiting time is a least 40 minutes (if you're lucky, otherwise they just hang-up on you after the recorded message). Incompetence is certainly a prerequisite to work there.Date of experience: July 19, 2016

Name: Wendy
Review: AWESOME DELIVERYI am in the same boat as thousands of other Canadians who had delayed shipping due to Canada Post threat of strike...WHY...WHY is everyone blaming Purolator??? Many companies shifted their deliveries to Purolator in order for US...the customer to receive our products. Purolator was innovated with deliveries and I think that they handled it with great skill. Yes my items were delayed by about a week...SO WHAT! I received them in great condition and I am very happy. Had the Canada Post strike happened...I would still be waiting. So a great big THANK YOU to Purolator for handling the massive surge in shipping demand and only having a 1 week delay in my orders!Date of experience: July 19, 2016

Name: Rhonda Cousins
Review: Awesome delivery service 👍My candles were delivered in excellent time & shape thanks I always have had excellent service with Purolator a very awesome delivery service 🙂👍Date of experience: July 19, 2016

Name: Doug Walls
Review: Unexplained - Dropped off PlanetOrdered from regular supplier in Toronto, shipped July 7 (11 days ago), takes 2 hours to get a human response by calling and that response is inconsiderate, rude and completely unhelpful except telling us to "wait for it", online tracking inexplicably dead ends a week ago in Port Kells (about a half hour from our offices).  I don't understand why anyone would use Purolator.  I wish I had known of this site and the Purolator issues beforehand - I would have told our supplier "DO NOT SHIP VIA PUROLATOR".Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: Big clouds
Review: My item has been sitting in a warehouse 35 km away for 8 daysSimply put my item has been sitting for 8 days in Toronto and I am in Mississauga. I ordered another item from Vancouver with Fedex and it was here in 4 days with standard shipping. Ordered both items on the same day btw. When i call or use the live chat they say my item has been delayed and they dont have a time frame for me.Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: am
Review: No package after almost a monthI ordered a package on June 28th (the shipping warehouse was only a couple hours from my house). The delivery date was listed as June 30th. On July 14th I began to question where my package is. My tacking information shows the package had no moved since July 5th (9 days without moving?). I emailed twice with no answer (their website states you will receive a response within 48 hours), I have called numbers times, no answer. I even tried the "live chat" option; again, no answer. On July 17th, I tracked my package again and the information said that there was an attempted delivery on Saturday July 16th, with no answer. However, i did not receive an attempted delivery slip. If no one answered Saturday, would the company not attempt to deliver the next business day? Monday July 18th there was someone at my house all day, no attempted delivery. Again, I have called, emailed, attempted to live chat with no answer.As it has been almost a month since the specified delivery date and i have not been able to get a hold of a single person I am beginning to think I will never see my package. I have never had such an awful experience shipping a package. I will never use Purolator again, nor will I recommend anyone else use this company to ship their items.Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: Alice
Review: Worst service experience in my life!Where do I even begin... I ordered more branded packaging for my business because I am participating in a 12 day trade show in my city. Order with priority shipping because I knew I would need it ASAP. It's now 6 days over due. I'm literally sitting here at the trade show, half way over, missing half of my product line because of this. I called their customer service line, 2 hour wait. All the rep could tell me is to keep waiting? I'm losing thousands of dollars of revenue and that's all you've got for me? Even refused to refund shipping, which I've never heard of in my life. Other companies refund if they're even a day late. I order things with UPS and FedEx on the same days and got them EARLY. I can understand them being swamped because of the potential lock out with Canada Post, but this is excessive. I got the rep to get someone in the tracking department call me and, and that rep told me they have 9,200 units in my city waiting in their warehouse, and that it would be at least a few more biz days before I got it. All I could do was laugh. So you're telling me, my business is going to suffer big time, AND you won't refund me the shipping. If I conducted business this way, I'd be long out of business... I don't know how they are still around. Part of me is kicking myself saying I should have ordered sooner, but if I had used another shipper, I would have received it all a week ago! 0 stars. Don't bother calling because it will waste your time. They will do nothing to help you. Keep waiting, and never use Purolator again.Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: bzzz
Review: Worst shipping company everWe had a next-day shipment due- only at 5:45 did the tracking post "Address correction required - address not found". I can see how they had a problem with it as the address has only been here for 35 years, and no one else has ever had problems delivering to this address. Naturally no one can be reached, no one manning the contact us phones, no one on the 'chat' link. Oh, if that's not enough, we have had the same issue with Purlator FIVE TIMES now- this address very much exists and each time message is the same (how does Amazon.ca use these guys as their delivery company?).Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: Yong
Review: WaitI ordered online, and the company used Purolator. It has been over 2 weeks, and I am still waiting. They say it is delayed in Port Kells, whatever that means. That was last week. I am still waiting.Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: Syed Irfan
Review: Very pathetic service,no way a customer can reach your phone line. On top of that you are lying  that no one was there to pick up the parcel. I was in home and waiting fDate of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: Jack
Review: Service is a jokeThanks for leaving my package outside for anyone to steal. At least leave a notice outside if the package is not safely delivered and I can just pick it up from your office. By the way don't bother contacting them because they will say something along the lines of "its not their responsibility".Date of experience: July 18, 2016

Name: Dexter Solon
Review: Terrible customer service and the drivers are hit or miss in delivering your package.As of right now, as in the days when Canada Post threatens to lockout, Purolator seems to be very ineffective in both delivering my package and updating my shipment's tracking. It's been almost a week and I still don't have my package even though I paid for premium shipping. It's from Mississauga to Scarborough for god's sake. How long does it really need to take? I did have other packages from Dynamex and CanPar (which I was really uncertain because never heard about these folks)  but it turns out they are very reliable and the shipments arrived on time as promised. If you're going to use Purolator these days, you're gonna have a FCKING BAD TIME. Good luck.Date of experience: July 16, 2016

Name: Musawar Bajwa
Review: Better to just go pick up the item yourselfI decided to buy a router from best buy and decided to have ot shipped to my address, silly me not knowing how bad of a service purolator provides it was my first time getting something shipped by them and my last time will be sticking with ups or anything else judt stay away from them. Estimated  date of delivery was July 12th and it's still sitting in a warehouse somewhere in Toronto....yet to be scanned or put on a truck this is ridiculous. I know the strike has made you busy but this is just unacceptable.Date of experience: July 16, 2016

Name: Derek
Review: Can't believe companies still use them.Trying to build a computer, ordered from several distributors, about half of the parts were shipped using purolator, the rest UPS. Every package has been delayed by at least 5 business days(the ones that have arrived), excuses and constant delays and the false promise of a delivery everyday. Here's a riddle.One package ships on Monday, coming from Toronto to Montreal, another ships on Tuesday coming from Vancouver, also going to Montréal. The package from Vancouver arrived a day early on Friday, and the package from Toronto IS STILL SITTING IN A GODDAMN WAREHOUSE  SOMEWHERE IN MONTREAL, WHICH ONE WAS SHIPPED USING PUROLATOR?Yeah, terrible company. If you want your package to not be lost somewhere within the void of narnia, use another courier service. Still sitting here hoping the remainder of my deliveries come without any damage, good luck to all you other Purolator customers out there, you'll need it.Date of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: Rami Shalev
Review: WORST COMPANY AND WORST EXPERIENCE EVER !!!WHY IS THIS CRAPPY COMPANY STILL ALLOWED TO OPERATE. MY PARCEL HAS BEEN IN TRANSIT FOR 9 DAYS NOW, THEY KEEP PROMISING DELIVERY EACH DAY AND THE PARCEL WAS NEVER DELIVERED. I WILL DEFINITELY NO LONGER DEAL WITH ANY COMPANY THAT USES THIS DISGUSTING, INEFFICIENT POOR EXCUSE FOR A SHIPPER AS THEIR SHIPPER OF CHOICE. I SENT THEM AN EMAIL WITH MY CONCERN, DID NOT EVEN BOTHER TO REPLY. MAKE SURE THAT YOU AVOID GIVING YOUR BUSINESS TO THIS LESS THAN GARBAGE COMPANY !!!Date of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: Luis Zambelli
Review: The customer service is terrible!!!The customer service play with you, transferring you call several times, until the call mystery drops... It's the worst company ever!Date of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: udit
Review: WORST would give 1/2 A STAR IF I COULD,LETHBRIDGE,service leaves note yesterday between the door and said tried to deliver today,im waiting here the whole day for delivery and the reception lady gives me attitude with her funny jokes,they should have call records at their local branch so they can monitor their employees,if it was in my hands i would have never used purolator.Date of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: MN
Review: CRAP!Purchased something for my fiance's birthday from Amazon.ca , was suppose to be delivered today, but its been "delayed" for 3 days now due to "weather" - than amazon.ca told me its been delayed because the truck broke down, and than purolator says its because there is excessive packages.. LOL Purolator is 91% owned by Canada post, and there is NO strike at least until the end on July, what's the excuse??? Jerks!Date of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: john
Review: Worst shipping experience everOrdered a package with 2 day guaranteed delivery. Didnt come and ruined wifes bday surprise. Didnt come for 2 weeks after that so I cancelled that order, put in a new one with 1 day guarantee and that is now 3 days late, with no tracking info and no one to answer phones.  Tried going there to pick up myself only to be told that its here but we dont have access to it!!!?? Wont come for a few more days. Are you kidding me!!? And the excuse is that canada post might go on strike? Canada post owns purolator!! so basically f*&% purolator. I hope you go underDate of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: Dawg
Review: Awful Awful AwfulWith the threat of a postal strike, Purolator has decided to go out of their way to provide substandard service. An overnight express envelope has now taken more than 10 business days to move from Vancouver to Ottawa with no sign yet on when it will be delivered. Simply awful.Date of experience: July 15, 2016

Name: Li Peng
Review: horrible servicecurrently 2 hours on hold with customer service because my package is 10 days late. what a complete joke. i'm about to freak out because i've listened to this customer service voicemail that plays nonstop for 2 straight hours. purolator is garbage, do not ever use them.Date of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Debbie
Review: WORST DELIVERY COMPANY PERIOD!They had to know they were going to be busier with a possible Canada Post strike, not my problem!  I expect a delivery company to be able to deliver a package in 24 hours!  Locations are only 2.5 hours away from each other.  This is not the first time that purolator has screwed me!  I will be asking the sender to find another delivery company when they ship to me.Date of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Vadim Airiants
Review: I would have put ZERO starsCannot get online status with tracking number, cannot get through to customer service by phone, filed claim is not being followed up in specified time frame. What keeps such a business model afloat? Definitely not customer focus or quality of delivery services....Date of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Becky Rogers
Review: Worst company to ship withI ordered my package over a week ago from Vancouver and I have yet to receive it. I paid for overnight delivery. I can appreciate that they are busy because of Canada Post, but this is getting to be ridiculous. My parcel has been sitting in Red Deer for a week. I would never recommend this company. A carrier pigeon would have been fasterDate of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Dorjee Chopgye
Review: worst shipping companyThis is by far the worst shipping company, never meets the actual time you were promised, with consistent delays and they claim it's due "high volume of service", then hire more people or it won't be so high. Their email is a joke, don't expect any reply. Terrible all around.Date of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Zubin
Review: Slow express shipping and nobody does anything about itSo basically have a parcel supposed to be coming in by express overnight shipping. However, it's been 5 days already. And the only answer I keep getting from reps is it's in a trailer at a depot and won't be delivered till other shipments are done and cannot be picked up at that location either. What type of garbage express shipping are they selling if they don't prioritize items and can't keep up with volume. Also they are refusing a refund on the cost of shipping.Date of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: John F Dunn
Review: VandalizedReceived my package today. three days late and obviously vandalized. Hard to believe that these @$$hats are still in business. Refused parcel ( delivery agent was obviously embarrassed at the condition of my package ) and waiting for judgement. Tell your supplier, either through email or phone, NOT to use this shipper, which deserves to be put out of business.#Worst Shipper EverDate of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Aug
Review: Delivery service more like theft serviceSo my next day delivery package was supposed to arrive 4 days ago, the shipping tracker isn't being updated, none of my calls are being answered, none of my messages returned, none of my emails returned, and their live agents are "all busy". Purolator has essentially just stolen whatever I needed shipped, they have my package and refuse to communicate where it is or when I will receive it. I'm just thankful what I ordered wasn't business sensitive otherwise I'd be completely screwed. If you read the "Purolator guarantee"  it isn't a guarantee that you will receive your package in a timely order like you would assume if you actually read the guarantee it is a guarantee that they guarantee nothing. I would give them zero stars if I could, never will be using Purolator again and I only used it now because it was the only option. Why did I pay extra money for next day when my package is now 4 days late? How is this even legal.edit: Oh and to add to the stupidity the package was sent to Hamilton airport and then transferred to a sorting facility in Toronto, I live between Hamilton and Toronto they drove right past my house with the package alreadyDate of experience: July 14, 2016

Name: Shawn McBride
Review: Terrible ServiceMy next day shipment is now 8 days late. Unable to contact Purolator by phone, chat or email. Tracking site says "Estimated Time of Delivery Not Available Delayed in transit"Date of experience: July 13, 2016

Name: Me
Review: One word: TerribleThis was the first time I had ever used Purolator and it was the worst shipping experience I've ever had. A week ago I was due to get a delivery to my apartment and according to the online tracking system they had tried to deliver my item but did not have the buzzcode - my fault for not leaving it, however I received neither a call nor email (I thought this info is also given for this reason?) from the delivery person as they attempted to get into the building (if this is not possible, my apologies for thinking so).After learning it had not been delivered, I tried to figure out how to remedy the situation. I sent an email asking how to change the address, but over 48 hours later, no response. I tried to open a live chat multiple times but no agents were available. I tried to call but was left on hold for an hour and I eventually had to hang up.The next day I headed to the depot on Yonge and Adelaide to try and figure out where it was. After initially being told my item was in fact at this location, I was then informed it was at the Kipling location and they could get it shipped to this location. I asked if it could be delivered to my work address the day after, and left all the details on a piece of paper. I also left my number and email in case anything went wrong.The day after (today as I write this review) I opened up the online tracking system to find the incorrect street number was given. I called the Yonge Adelaide location to find the wrong street number had been entered into the system - after leaving them the details. No email or phone call either.It is meant to arrive tomorrow - hopefully it does!TLDR; couldn't initially find where my item had gone after the delivery went wrong, had no idea how to find out, and then wrong info was entered when I went in person to update the street address.Date of experience: July 13, 2016

Name: Jared Christie
Review: My 4 horrible experiences with PurolatorI'm a 3D modeler who needs a good computer to render out short movies and it speeds up my work flow so I upgrade my computer about every two years. Newegg ships through Purolator.My first shipment was a Thor V2 computer case and I knew that the Purolator truck was supposed to arrive that day. At night I checked if it was still on the way but it said missed delivery when they never showed up so I had to go and pick it up myself.Second delivery was a Geforce 4GB GTX 980 which costs around $750 canadian. I waited by the front door for a couple of days and when checking online I noticed that it had said that it was delivered a couple of days ago. So my worries are that a) the delivery person went to the wrong house or b) they put it into the system that they had tried delivering it when they really didn't.Third was I was picking up some headphones for my sisters work that costs $120. The delivery driver put the box by the front door, rang the door bell and was driving away as I went outside to pick up the parcel. The two issues is that 1) the delivery driver was going to leave the box there for anyone to pick up, 2) it was raining which would've destroyed the headphones if I wasn't there to take it out of the rain immediately.Fourth experience is I ordered a GTX 1070 from newegg which is shipping from the US. I placed in my order for express delivery but it has been a week now waiting for my package. So I went onto some online forums and found a Purolator representative who said, "Hello, This is Jeremie with Purolator Customer Care. Generally, shipments sent from Newegg are sent ground while transiting in the US and enter Canada through one of our Gateway terminals. From that point, if your shipment was sent express, your package should arrive overnight (depending on geographical restrictions). "When shipping from the United States, don't expect your money to ship your parcel across the United States any faster then it originally would if you pay the original price. Even when it gets into Canada, they are careful not to guarentee that you will receive it the next day. In fact, I don't even have an estimated delivery date from Purolator yet even though it's "express" delivery.Date of experience: July 13, 2016

Name: D
Review: There are better solutions than Purolator, without a doubtVery shifty delivery service.  Deliveries are mainly inconsistent.  This is the only company that is not structured properly to handle a busy workload (referring to the extra business they received via Canada Post threat).  Canpar, UPS, all have been delivering.  Purolator can't even handle this business increase.  Terrible service, and a HORRENDOUS phone system.  You literally wait hours to get someone on the line.  Talk about leaving your customers out in the dark.Date of experience: July 13, 2016

Name: Witoon Khamon
Review: Purolator or Pure (oh!) LatorA company shipped the product to me from the next city close by on June 29th.  The delivery guy is so dumb.  On the shipping label has everything correctly including my phone number, he marks as incorrect address and send the parcel back to their warehouse.  I live in downtown Vancouver, he can just drop off at a pickup location in downtown and they can reach me to let me know to pick it up.  It's July the 12th already I still don't have my parcel yet.  I visited the website and contact them 2 days ago to forward the parcel to the pickup location and contact me but nothing is proceeded.  I am calling on the phone right now and it's been 40 minutes, and yet I still don't get to talk to anyone.  I guess I have to be on the phone for at least 1 hours.  I think they should change the slogan; "Pure Lator, where business isn't going anywhere".Date of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Kevin
Review: Worst Company EverThis is the worst company ever. They have very poor to non existent customer service. They hide behind pre recorded messages when you call. My shipment has been sitting in the sorting facility for 3 days with no movement and no expectations. Their tracking system is poor. If I could give them 0 stars I would. I will never ever use this company for anything. I could bike ride it across the country faster. STAY AWAYDate of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Amanda Chisar-Kuzmin
Review: Horrifiying experience!Let me start by telling you that I am the superintendent at my place of residence.  A few days ago my husband took the day off work to receive a package.  There was no knock at the door and no call from the intercom not even one of those stiny notes "attemptied delivery ". When I called to ask why nobody had cono acted me they said it was because our intercom was not working. (Because I am the superintendent I can absolutely be sure this is not true).Today for the second time this happened. I can very confidently say that they make up excuses instead to doing there job.Date of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Jason
Review: Consistently disgraceful delivery and customer service, I don't know how they are still in businessEvery time EVERY SINGLE TIME I order something through Amazon and they ship through Purolator I NEVER end up getting it delivered. These A******s are claiming that they visited my house twice in the last two days and attempted delivery. Not ONE TIME did you guys ring the doorbell. Usually this is routine stuff coming from Purolator, but this time around they didn't even leave a notice card for me. So had I not been consistently checking for updates on my shipment I would have missed it entirely and the package would have been returned to amazon because they only hold it for a mere 5 days. I really cannot understand how these guys still have clients and judging by the reviews on this site, everyone else feels the same.Date of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Brian Martin
Review: the website liesI had an overnight delivery that was due 5 days ago. They said Canada post disruptions were causing higher than normal volumes. however if you go on their site and book a delivery today there is no mention and you are more than welcome to book an overnight package. Just don't expect it to get there. Won't use them again, after using them I read a review site with 95 1stars and 4 5stars reviews. I went to add mine to the negative and found this site instead. 91% negative. how is this company still in business??? Do not use themDate of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Allison
Review: Don't update tracking and lie about reasons for delaysSo purolator is super late by now and didn't update my tracking info for days...finally 4 days after my package was due it updates to say there was a delay due to weather in my city. It's sunny, clear skies. ...not an ounce of weather problems. Can't get ahold of anyone there, the live chat  doesn't work on the website. They wont even put yiu in a queue...they just cancel the chat and say no one is available. ..why have a chat if it doesn't even work?  They are the only courier that is claiming problems; UPS, CANADA POST (which says ALOT because they're in labour disputes and purolator is trying to hide behind that when no one else is having problems) and FedEx have all delivered to me without problem this week, days before the package is even due. They have said they're a little busier but haven't had ANY problems with deliveries. The ups guy whp delivered to me today even agreed they have had multiple inquiries as to whether people can switch from purolator to ups to go pick up packages purolator cant seem to handle (ups doesnt do that unfortunately). The company I ordered from (amazon) had to reship me a new package (using canada post which is set to deliver even before purolator can get the original package to me) and now I'm forced to wait around for purolator to get the package to me just so I can ship it back since I got a new delivery with a different delivery service. I paid expidited shipping, attempted to get in touch with a human being several times in the past few days...and nothing. Horrible service! If you can't handle the intake then DONT ...and don't force people to pay for a service you're not capable of handling for whatever reason. Really goes to show that they're more concerned with getting money than providing decent service to customers.Date of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Dynamicmanifold
Review: False attempted deliveries to a business2 days in a row Purolator attempts delivery but no recipient is available. Unfortunately, the address is a fully staffed business, open 8am-6pm, and I have an office right inside the front door. The first day, i gave them the benefit of the doubt. Second day, I was actively watching the shipping status. Magically, at one point it just changed to "attempted delivery, recipient not available". Purolators customer service (via phone & chat) was completely unavailable. This is like trying to deliver to walmart at noon and saying no one is available. After 5pm, went to the local depot and the item was still on the truck. So some guy is just driving around with a parcel all day and faking delivery attempts. Good on you, my company will not be using Purolator as our express courier any more.Date of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Kacey
Review: They didn't even show up to my door, just told me I had to drive 3 hours to get my parcel which I paid for to my door delivery.They didn't even show up to my door, just told me I had to drive 3 hours to get my parcel which I paid for to my door delivery.  Avoid these guys if you can, they are lazy and dishonest.Date of experience: July 12, 2016

Name: Samuel Lavoie
Review: 1 Month late, Wrong State 2 timesAt first, I ordered something that got shipped from the nord US and it came to Montreal / Canada (Where i live), but 3 day later it was to Florida in the US, 2 week later the shipping was in New York, 1 week after it came back to Montreal but it still took 3 days to ship in a place around 30 km far.Date of experience: July 11, 2016

Name: James Ingram
Review: Delivery service that doesn't deliverWorst courier service I have ever dealt with. Two packages in one week not delivered. After spending over an hour on hold to speak to a representative, I was told that they attempted delivery but no one was home, so i would have to drive across the city to pick it up myself. I had been home all week and no one came by. No delivery notification. I was practically accused of lying by the customer service rep. She changed her tune when I offered to email her the security footage for both days in question for her own review to show no truck drove down my street. They will now "attempt" delivery on Tuesday which means I will have to take the day off work to receive my items if they even bother to show up this time. I'm so glad I paid extra for guaranteed 3 day delivery only to get my stuff more than a week later. I don't know how this horrible company is still in business. You have 1 responsibility - deliver the package. DELIVER THE FREAKIN PACKAGE!Date of experience: July 11, 2016

Name: John
Review: FedEx instead STAY AWAYTime sensitive documents. Pending postal strike so I decide to use Purolator. Big mistake.
