And ofcourse this guy picked who also knew nothing, his name is PETER (I have his agent # also) , WAS EXTREMELY RUDE TO ME, and did not answer any of my questions, rather repeated the same thing over and over again which was "yah you can pick it up from a store".. Like are U dumb?! I know I can I need to find a closer location so HELP ME! He was so useless! Anyways OH MY GOODNESS! WORST DELIVERY SERVICE ON EARTH! Do not ever do business with them again! BUNCH OF USELESS RUDE PEOPLE! So much for delivery huh.. Cuz I HAD TO PICK IT UP!!! This caused me so much headache and stress that I will never ever do business with this terrible company again!Date of experience: April 01, 2015

Name: B Kelly
Review: Worst Shipping Company......ever.Had a time sensitive shipment slated to go from Burnaby, BC to Edmonton, Alberta.  Package has to be delivered by 10:30am the following day. Called Purolator (~8:45am) - they claimed that they could handle the shipment no problem - they even had 10:30am delivery as an option on the waybill..... Great!  Or, so I thought.... I was told a delivery driver was dispatched - the service agent on the phone even said the driver would be given 10:30am delivery stickers fort the package...... I thought that was great too. HOWEVER - noon rolled around, the package was still sitting in my office..... I called again - "no problem - the driver is still en route.....you're package only has to be at the sorting Depot in Burnaby by 6:00pm to make the air shipment for 10:30am next day delivery to Edmonton".  Fair enough..... I wait.   4:30pm rolls around - my office is due to close - I call again.  This time, the story has changed - the CSR has no record of my request for pick-up..... no driver is coming.  Absolute GARBAGE service. I drive to the Burnaby Depot - get there by 5:00pm....still in time to make the shipment.  I was given the same song-and-dance blurb - "sure thing - your package will arrive on time". It is now the next day....... It's 3:30pm - online tracking still shows the parcel as in transit.  Again, the contents were time sensitive and are surely ruined by now...... Purolator - you are a garbage company.  Fedex from here on in for me....Date of experience: March 10, 2015

Name: mark
Review: AVOID Purolator....HORRIBLE SERVICEI had my shipment put on the wrong truck and was unable to receive my package was delay for 4 daysat the  Granby quebec canada office .i missed the first drop off because i had to bring my son to the hospital.I left a note at the door to leave the package there but they did not.I asked for a return shipment and they said no problem would be on the truck the very next day.I toke the day off work and lost a whole days pay, no truck came .Call back and was told they put it on the wrong truck . Come on what load of B.S.I ask them to make a special trip or meet them ,no way that was going to happen.I live about 40 km from Granby quebec canada and i need to take the morning  off work again to pick up my package.Thanks purolator for nothing.you are the most incompetent company i ever delt with mr madDate of experience: February 28, 2015

Name: Jordan Mango Johnson
Review: Frustrated.This company, let alone just the sheer lack of communication offered by them is a complete joke I ordered something from NCIX on February 10th, it's now the 18th, my package was delivered to this location (missisauga west) and was sent out for delivery today, after waiting all day for the package, and checking at 6 PM with a representative, the status of the shipment was changed to "Mechanical delay". I asked where my package was, because it's a fairly expensive package, and they did not give me details as to where it was,  I asked if I could have it scheduled for pickup at the depot instead because I didn't want them handling my package if they couldn't first deliver it on time, second give me an answer as to where it was, or if it was damaged in this "Mechanical delay" and was told:  "We cannot share the information based on this status, other than it's going to be delivered to you tomorrow" I then called this location which the number listed here is wrong, it's actually (905-814-8080 ext 2005) only to be greeted with heavy breathing into the phone, I said hello and got a voice message notification. After I receive my package I definitely will not be going to Purolator again for any shipping matters, IF I receive my package that is. I can honestly not recommend Purolator after their handling of my package, the sheer lack of communication, the straight up negligence shown by their staff and the lack of professionalism you'd expect in a company that's handling international shipments, I mean, you might as well have the voice mail say; I don't want to talk, please don't bother me because I'm busy and your service is not important, that would have been nicer than just breathing into a phone.Date of experience: February 19, 2015

Name: StelChar
Review: Somewhat reliable, but still very disorganized.I had packages delivered by Purolator on two separate occasions within the last 2 months (once in December, once in February). On both of these occasions I had ordered from the same seller who used Purolator as their designated delivery service (an online retailor shipping from New York, US and I am located in Barrie, Ont. CA). I'll start with the positive experience with Purolator, that being, I received both of my orders within a reasonably outlined time frame (both orders used ground shipping at no extra costs expected in 3-7 days and it came to me within 2 weeks). However, I am one of those compulsive online shoppers where I need to see where my packages are every step of the way, especially when they are on the expensive items. Well you can let that dream fly right out the window if you're going to be receiving anything from Purolator. I don't understand the point of them even having an online tracking system (1) It doesn't register the item until its in Canada which is understandable, however, it isn't registered into their system once it crosses the boarder either so for me I had no idea of where my package was for about 4-5 days (this happened on both occasions). (2) no information is provided on the item until it is at the sort facility in the area where you live, (3) your item can say "on vehicle for delivery" for forever...literally...I got my package yesterday and it still says online that its "on vehicle for delivery", so yesterday it was a surprise to see a package sitting on my porch which was expensive and could have been stolen without my knowledge since it wasn't given the status of "delivered". In another instance, when it was delivered it said "delivered to reception"...which is unusual since I live at a residential address and they happened to leave it on the porch so this can be misleading, which caused me to panic and think it was delivered to the wrong address. Needless to say, aside from not having an estimated delivery date or having any real knowledge of when or where my package was to be delivered, it still managed to get to me safely. which in the end is all that matters to me.Date of experience: February 18, 2015

Name: Kyle Goodwin
Review: Their service is unsatisfactoryUpon the purchase of express delivery for one package and free ground shipping for the other, I received both packages a week later than I was supposed to. Each day I checked up with a new agent and each day they said to expect them there. Not only did I have to get my express package myself because they told me they would allow me to do so if an only if they couldn't deliver it that day, (which was incorrect I was later informed), but he delivered the non-express package the same day I had to pick up the express package myself. Their customer service agents are rude, unorganized, and all on a different page. Their ethos needs to be reviewed and they need to have a major revamp of their tracking systems.Date of experience: February 17, 2015

Name: Purush
Review: Worst experience!!!!!I sent a shipment from Canada to India through Purolator and it was sent to Hongkong by mistake... These were all time sensitive materials and i went through lots of stress. Adding to it the customer service was the worst!!!! I am waiting on the shipment to be tracked and shipped back to me, after which i have to send it back. Will never use Purolator again and i wont suggest it to anyone..Date of experience: February 16, 2015

Name: Jane P
Review: Worst experience everI had my stuff delivered from my ex boyfriend and purolator couldn't figure out that I'm going to pay for that. They just picked it up and delivered it to me without even getting payment. When I called three  times to give them my credit card they "accidentally hung up on me". Two months later they started calling my ex about getting their money. I called again with credit card number and they sent me the receipt online and by mail. 4 months (!!!!!) later they are sending me letters demanding payment and threatening me with the collectors agencies. Please, figure it out between yourselves. It's just insaneDate of experience: February 15, 2015

Name: A User
Review: I will never do business with them again.Do not do business here! Let's see: 1) The rep at the store was rude to me.2) The delivery person failed to deliver the package and gave no reason why.3) The representative did not refund my money even though they had failed to deliver the package and he was very rude and sarcastic to me over the phone. I will never use Purolator again, and I strongly suggest you don't either. $45 wasted.Date of experience: February 02, 2015

Name: Erin
Review: Worst delivery and service everThis company is awful! We order products from a supplier regularly and they ship with purolator. There is always multiple boxes per order. The boxes never show up at the same time or even the same week. When I called and asked them the exact wording was " ya, so what can I do about it " The lack of customer service is astonishing. Not to mention how much money are they losing when they charge you 1 delivery fee and then it takes them 3 times to deliver all parts of that parcel??Date of experience: January 27, 2015

Name: Dante Manly
Review: AVOID Purolator....HORRIBLE SERVICEAs there is no email contact for customers who wish to complain, I have sent it here. I will also post this letter publically and advise people NOT to use Purolator. I am a business owner and will not send anything by Purolator again or buy from a company that uses your courier service. Three times I have ordered something and EVERY time the driver fails to deliver (he doesn’t ring the bell, he leaves package at the wrong house etc.) This time I ordered something perishable. The tracking notice informed me it was on the truck then I get an email at 2 30 in the afternoon, after waiting all day informing me they will call with a new delivery date. After speaking to someone, I am told the driver wrote "no access' on the sheet which was an outright lie. There was some road work at the other end of my street, five houses away. My house was accessible from the other end and he never bothered to turn the corner. I was told I would receive a call two hours later. No call. Then I called to be told to "come and pick it up" twenty miles away. I said no. They told me Monday so my food item would sit in the warehouse all weekend!!! The woman said there was no problem with that...for her maybe...So I sent the item back. Monday I will explain to the seller that in no way will I buy from him if he uses Purolator! I will be advising ALL the business owners in Shawinigan-Sud also to stay away from Purolator.Date of experience: January 24, 2015

Name: Steven Sawler
Review: Awlful CompanyI never had an experience with any other delivery company like this one. I missed the first delivery cause I didn't hear the door bell. not sure they even used it. so I called them up to see if they could recall the driver to come back this was around 2:30 in the Tuesday afternoon. I was told that she could call or paged the diver to due so but can have it resent for the falling day. I Proceeded to tell here that on the wed I had to be home and there be no one to sign for the package. She told me to leave a not on the front door with all moth the package id number permission to leave the package in the door with my name both printed and signed. So I did just that (not liking that idea cause I live in a basement apartment so a note say no one home is not my ideal to leave) Thought after all that the package did not show up and online I got delayed due to miss delivery and would be delivered the next day.  So I had Thursday the next day off work so I could wait for the package. I How ever did get called twice to see if I could work 2 different shift but had to say no cause I didn't want to leave a not again stating no one was home plus the landlord who lives upstairs was not happy with the notes on the mail box as well. It was getting close to 5pm and still no package so I called Purolator for the second time to see if my package was coming at all the girl said she would page the driver and let him now I was wait for the package that did not come the day before cause she said the drive fell ill and assured me that I would get my package. So waited and cheek on line 1 hour later to see if any update and there was AGAIN delayed due to missed delivery. WHAT THE HELL!!! I then called them for a 3rd time to find out what was going on. (you would think after they didn't delivery the day before that make sure you defiantly got it the next day specially if there no acts of god preventing them to do so) Once again I was told to leave a note giving permission to leave the package to do so. After expressing my concers that I did not want to have it public on a not no one was home again and that that landlord did not want that. I even ask to have some one else bring I sure they have people delivery things tell 8pm. I ask if I could give phone permission. Answer no. Asked if she could put it in regular mail. Answer again NO. She then suggest to have it redirected to another location that would be home to sign. but because the person who could do it was in a different area that I would be charge a surcharge to do so? What they cost me a day I could have worked which I could have mad money then say if I wanted to do it that way to charge me a surcharge. I don't drive and have to work so no way I can get to there office to pick it up so stuck try to figure out this package.  This company should be ashamed of themselves and call them self a delivery company. I have never had problems with other carries even Canada post less they delivery even if it slower.Date of experience: January 23, 2015

Name: m754
Review: DISGUSTING BEHAVIOUR. PLEASE READ**I bought something express delivery for my father's birthday. If I would have known it was through Purolator I would have never bought it. They end up leaving a note saying to pick it up (got it sent to my parents as I live in an apartment). I go to the warehouse ALL the way across town and have to pick up my own package from a delivery company. I give her my drivers license and my tracking number and she brings out the package, but bc my address didn't coincide with what was on the package she refused to give it to me. I showed her my email with my confirmation from the company showing the order and she still refused to give it to me. Then she tells me my parents have to come get it bc their ID shows that address. What kind of nonsense is that. So someone without my name can pick up my packages but me as the purchaser cant??? Then I told her to give me my package as it's my property and I paid for it. The woman became irate then left after 5 minutes of us going back and forth about this complete nonsense (like it's me and it's my package) and did not return for another 5 minutes while other customers were waiting going what the hell is going on. Finally my mother arrives from across town to pick up my package (which is in my name and I paid for - figure that logic out) and the girl has written on it in sharpie some nasty things. I realize if I would have left without it I would have never seen my package again. She then calls me the B word TWICE and tells me she told her manager that, smugly. This is 100% real. I have never seen such a lack of common sense or customer service. Utterly disgusting. Beware that you might have to give a DNA sample to pick up your own parcel with Purolator. I have less hassle getting information about my SIN number. On a side note, I hope that woman gets fired. Absolutely rediculous. No manager at any time came out to rectify anything.Date of experience: January 20, 2015

Name: Sil
Review: The Company of the most STUPIDS and INCOMPETENT people in the Universe2 packages in 2 weeks, every time they sorted wrong, instead of being able to pick up my package in a good time I had to wait for days to get them.I am ready to use the 200 years old PONY EXPRESS who used to deliver the mail in the WILD WEST, through INDIAN territory. I make a bet on ONE billion DOLLARS they were able to do a much better job than PUROLATOR.And don't forget: CUSTOMER SERVICE is for Stupids to wash their brain for NOT DELIVERING the service that the client already paid for it. THAT MEANS TO GIVE THEM A SECOND CHANCE BECAUSE THEY ARE INCOMPETENT TO DELIVER SERVICES THEY ARE PROMISING IN RETURN FOR THE MONEY, FOR A SERVICE THAT SUPPOSE TO BE DONE RIGHT FROM THE FIRST TIME. GOOD SERVICES DON'T NEED CUSTOMER SERVICE, THEY NEED CUSTOMER PROTECTION FROM THE GOVERNMENT AGAINST THESE KIND OF COMPANIES.Date of experience: January 17, 2015

Name: Kloe
Review: WORST DELIVERY COMPANY EVER!Avoid like the plague! They don't leave notices at your door or in your mailbox. You will never know they have attempted to deliver a package to your home, and by the time you wonder where your package is, they will have sent it back to the sender... You would think they could call, email, or leave a note at your door? If you're lucky enough to find out they have your package before it's sent back, it will be kept in a storage far out and so inconvenient for you to get to you'll wish you'd never ordered the package online in the first place. FedEx, UPS, Canada Post... Anything BUT Purolator.Date of experience: January 15, 2015

Name: Montreal
Review: Horrible tracking. If you have the option -> avoid!Like so many have already shared, Purolator has the most useless tracking system.  I ordered my item January 7th from an online Canadian retailer.  We are now January 14th (midday) and here is what the tracking website reveals (pasted below) with the last update being January 12th.  The website still does not provide an expected delivery date.  When I live chatted with a Purolator rep this morning, she said to expect delivery on January 16th. 2015-01-12 18:05:00	Vancouver, BC	Departed sort facility2015-01-12 17:37:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 04:14:00	Vancouver, BC	Departed sort facility2015-01-12 03:46:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 03:41:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 03:37:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 03:32:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 03:28:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 03:24:00	Vancouver, BC	Arrived at sort facility2015-01-12 03:23:00	Vancouver, BC	Picked up by Purolator2015-01-08 19:37:00	Los Angeles - Lax	Departed sort facility What's with all the updates on January 12 in Vancouver?  Is it because the item is going in circles on a sorting belt?  Why no updates with expected delivery? Exactly where is my parcel? I'm not sure if I can update my review at a later date.  If so, I'll let you know if I do receive my parcel on the 16th as the rep stated.  My expectations remain very low so let's see if Purolator can go even lower.Date of experience: January 14, 2015

Name: Scott
Review: They want me to pay twice for nothing!I sent a  time sensitive document from Kamloops to Burnaby. It wasn't received, so I sent another by Canada Post which arrived the next day. The cost to send by Purolator was about $27. Purolator said the recipient was notified. The only notification was a garbled voicemail which could not be understood. Not a word of the message was clear. The recipient was pretty sure the message was not in English, so it was disregarded. Purolator also said they left a notice in the mailbox, which is a lie. Two weeks later I was called to pick up something at the Kamloops Purolator. It was the returned envelope. I later received an invoice in the mail for the return, another $27 for retuning the document which I neither wanted or asked for. You've got to be kidding!! They should send an refund, not an invoice! If not so maddening, it would be comical that they wanted to make sure I received the  invoice, so they sent it by Canada Post. Good lesson, don't use Purolator!Date of experience: January 12, 2015

Name: Thảo Đặng
Review: Throw the pick up notice in the junk trashWhat kind of service is this? They throw the notice in the junk trash. Luckily I found it before it is gone. Come to pick it up, they ask for an ID, I gave them the ID. They ask for proof of address. I said I just moved. I seriously just moved. Hello, how the hell I can get the hydro bill or cell phone bill when I JUST MOVED. Which part you dont understand? Ask me to tell them to deliver again and have it throw into the trash again? OMG. So bad service. Im wondering why this company is still exist. I didnt have a choice. The company I had business with chose the company. I will never never never choose Purolator if the decision in my hand.Date of experience: January 10, 2015

Name: Ken Wadel
Review: Class Action SuitThere should be a Class Action filed against this company for failure to honor their delivery contracts. On January 6th 2015 ,@ 3:30p.m , at 5:30 p.m in Nanaimo B.C.they sited bad weather for the first delay ,however they said it would still be delivered to my home in Toronto ,OntarioJan.7th came and went, still no delivery.I called and was told that they would deliver it on Jan.8th. I called their  800 number and was met by rudeness from some guy in Montreal by the name of Jason. He even said that the bad weather delay was ICE and SNOW ! what a joke. Ice and Snow in Nanaimo ? these people think we are stupid.  When I finally got a hold of somebody in New Brunswick ,I was assured that I would receive my delivery by 6:00pm .My wife went down at 5:19 pm and waited for and hour ,NO Purolator  showed up.When I checked the tracking it stated "Delayed due to missed delivery" time dated 5:32pm This driver didn't even come here and it is not a difficult address to find.And they shut their phone lines off at 6 p.m.I payed for EXPRESS next day delivery. This company does not care about it's clients. this is a micky mouse company and should be shut down. It's FED EX and CANADA POST for me.By the way I am disabled and terminally ill, but this just gets brushed off by them.Mr.WadelToronto,Ont.Date of experience: January 09, 2015

Name: mohsen
Review: Incompetence at its best!I wish there was a negative score! They have really earned all the negative revues. Over the past 27 years, I received parcels via Canada Post, FEDEX , DHL, UPS and other independent courier services and they never had problems finding my address yet Purolator can't locate it even after calling them 7 times to confirm the address, which was correct in the first place. Apparently it's their policy to use this excuse when it's inconvenient to deliver. After numerous phone calls, I went to the depot itself: first they couldn't find the address, now they can't find the package!Date of experience: January 03, 2015

Name: Elizabeth Park
Review: Purolator is Rude to Toys R Us' CustomersI ordered from Toys R Us and they use Purolator.   There was a phone call that I had to pick up my $30 parcel in Pickering.  Two hours from my home in traffic and in a different region that I live in.  When I asked why they couldn't leave it at my door they rudely said they needed a signature,  why would I order something online to travel four hours total?  Well, they rudely said, that is where the are located.  ToysRUs is closer to me. will never order from Toys R Us again or any company that uses Purolator.  I do a lot of online shopping and I am not surprised all the other stores I've shopped at do not use a Purolator.Date of experience: December 26, 2014

Name: Lisa
Review: Purolator should be ashamed of their serviceI was home the whole day to receive my delivery. I did not hear the doorbell ring to notify me there was a package at my door. Well apparently, my package was delivered according to the tracking website.  When I went to check the front porch, there was nothing at the door.  I called the claims department to start an inquiry. What a joke!!!!  A few days later, I received an email that the driver said he delivered my package. That was the depth of their investigation and now the case was closed.  Unfortunately this was my first dealing with purolator and I was waiting for other items to be delivered by them over the following week. Well according to the businesses that use purolator delivery service, pulolator hides the packages. This is total Bulls***.  I have a large front veranda with a good 15 feet from the top of the stairs to my front door.  The rest of my packages, delivered over the course of a week, were left at the top of my stairs, out in the open for the whole neighbourhood to see.  One box, that for some reason kept being sent back to the sorting facility over the course of the week, was completely open and falling apart when it finally arrived.  I will never buy from a business that uses purolator as their delivery service.  I have never been treated so poorly or with such disregard.  I feel fortunate that my other packages arrived after the loss of the one.  I have absolutely no confidence in this business.Date of experience: December 24, 2014

Name: Leanne Dalderis
Review: Very unhelpful an unprofessionalSent a parcel that was time sensitive to be delivered in three days. Client didn't receive and when I contacted Purolator told me the driver said there was no such address. Double checked address with them and address was fine. Promised delivery after weekend which was still four days late. Still hadn't arrived when promised. Finally delivered long after the time sensitive date. Asked for refund and told they don't give them. Very poor service and accepts no responsibility. Leanne DalderisDate of experience: December 23, 2014

Name: Catherine Kiernan
Review: Unacceptable delivery and customer serviceMy 19 year old son used Purolator to ship his computer and components and other valuable electronics from Sackville, New Brunswick to Newmarket, Ontario.  He shipped his less valuable belongings by Canada Post.  Every item shipped by Purolator was damaged.  The boxes were a mess, as were the contents.  The items delivered by Canada Post came in perfect condition.  When we filed claims online with Purolator, as directed by them, my son received an email basically saying they cannot be held liable for the condition parcels arrive in.  This is a totally unacceptable response.  The damage could cost my son approximately $2,000.00 in repair/replacement costs.Date of experience: December 18, 2014

Name: Anonymous
Review: With this company I'd rather walk to California and pick up the shipment myselfI live in Toronto, Ontario and I was receiving a shipment from California. They try to deliver on my door at times where no one is there. I mean who wouldn't be at work at 10 AM. But whatever it's not the end of the world so I drive to their center and go to pick it up. Well they made me wait for 2 God forsaken hours. The clerks there were rude as hell yelling at me when they were the ones who had no idea where their driver was. They pledged on their wall to provide us with knowledgeable service but I only heard 3 words out of their mouths:"I don't know". They then told me that they were closing soon and if their driver still wasn't back then I would have to come back tomorrow. They couldn't even offer me a reasonable solution other than come back again and we will see what we can do. Well guess what I am not coming back again and if I learn that any company uses Purolator to ship then I am taking my business elsewhere.Date of experience: December 13, 2014

Name: Jenny
Review: UnprofessionalThey gave me an arrival date on a baby stroller I bought for a gift. ToysRUs didn't have it in stock at the store so they had to ship to my address which I had to pay $20 for shipping to my house. I tracked my package and it was picked up and put on the truck. 8pm on the delivery date they were a no show. I waited all day and asked my mother to pick up my kids from school so I could be home waiting for Purolator. I called the center and they were closed. I used live chat and was told my package was at Purolator and ready to pick up. Purolator is in a completely different city than me. Not only did I have to drive 40 mins away to get my stroller when I had already paid for them to ship to my house, when I got there, there was a fist sized hole in the side of the stroller box. I immediately returned the stroller to toysrus and they did not refund my shipping, and neither did Purolator. NEVER again Purolator. Worst experience ever.Date of experience: December 13, 2014

Name: Ana-Alexandra Mirea
Review: Horrible!They NEVER EVER have my buzz code! Every time I have a delivery through them it is messed up and they have an attitude like it is my fault even thought I always write the buzzer to make sure I get the parcels. The worst customer experience ever. I can't believe they still exist on the market. HORRIBBBBLLLLEEEEE!Date of experience: December 12, 2014

Name: Angela
Review: A bunch of idiotsLast week I arrived home just in time to find our Purolator driver trying to deliver my package - to my next door neighbours!!! He had read the address wrong!! Left a pick up tag on their door with MY information and went to put the package back on his truck. I stood in front of his truck and said " do you have a package for me?" What a moron.  Today I'm waiting for a package.....7:30pm and it's been on the truck since 8:30am....don't think I"m getting it today. Be lucky if I get it at all. I HATE Purolator but both of these packages were from Toys R Us, Christmas presents for my kids that I couldn't get in their nearest store location. Sorry TRU but as long as you continue to use Purolator I will never again order from your website.Date of experience: December 11, 2014

Name: Sam S
Review: Weather Delay?It is +14 degrees in Vancouver, with rain (AS USUAL). Sunny in alberta, sunny in Ontario. Package has been 'delayed due to weather' since December 3 with no other explanation/updates. My only guess is truck has been stuck in a puddle for a week. Today is December 9. For a company that's job is to deliver stuff, that is very laughable. Strap on some winter tires and hire a driver from the north. Unbelievable. I've had UPS, Fedex, CanadaPost deliver in full blown snow storms.  What a soft and convenient excuse. If you can't handle it, stop offering ground service from BC to ON, the weather will never be nice. In fact, this week is the nicest weather you'll ever get in December, and you still can't deliver. If you want your package to come in a whole week late, choose Puro-later (even in the summer probably, it is 'too hot' for their drivers, safety concern) NEVER AGAINDate of experience: December 09, 2014

Name: Jack Jackson
Review: Disorganized covered up with misinformed customoer service representatives.I was personally told, on 3 different occasion by 3 different Purolator Couriers, that they do not leave a information Door Tags (sticky tags) because someone might steal my package. Having been told such an obvious lie and Purolator eventually sending back my merchandise was very aggravating. I will never choose their services and hope that I will never be forced to deal with them again.Date of experience: December 06, 2014

Name: Paul Mitchell
Review: Purolator blunders have cost me literally thousandsIt's a long story, but the series of mistakes (no exaggeration, multiple human errors one after another) they've made on one important rushed shipment resulted in me not being able to bill a client when the item didn't arrive on time.  That one cost me several thousand dollars.  I'm not a rich person - it was an impactful loss for me. Second time I was requested to use Purolator by a client, they managed to somehow crush the item (not a delicate item) in bubble wrap. For some reason I tried them a third time a year later - again, human error at their end resulted in item not arriving. Based on my experiences, I really don't know how they are still in business.Date of experience: December 05, 2014

Name: Vic Tastico
Review: Consistently terribleMy latest in a long history of poor to terrible experiences with Purolator Delivery guy buzzed up, the phone rang two times before he hung up.  I caught him through the window & he begrudgingly agreed to head back to the door.  I heard him drop the boxes (a new computer) on the concrete ground from waist level to press the buzzer.   Terrible attitude at the door: Me "Sorry about that, thanks for coming up."Purolator guy “We let it ring three times and leave.” Me “Rang twice up here for me.”Purolator guy “Rang three times for me.” – walks away This was actually one of the more successful experiences I've had with these guys over the years.  I have associates who also rank them by far the worst courier option.  I don't understand how they're still in business.Date of experience: December 05, 2014

Name: Shawn Samler
Review: How do they stay in business??If you have a choice, do not choose  Purolator.  It all started when we ordered a baby furniture set from Bestbuy.ca (note:they only use Purolator). It's three pieces of furniture jammed into one box; the box is 130lbs. Best buy offers free delivery which is great because we don't have a vehicle to retrieve it ourselves.  About a week after we ordered this $500 box we got a message saying our item is in transit, which concerned us because we didn't get a call to set up a delivery date. When we called Purolator they said it was coming from Vancouver and when it arrives is toronto they will call to make the necessary arrangements.  Great.  A few days after this we checked the status of our delivery and it said delivery attempted, no one home.  Hmm, peculiar, we hadn't set the date yet. We called back and they said no problem, let's just set another date! So we did but the catch is either my wife or I has to help lift the box off the truck and into our apartment!  my wife is the only one home and also she's 9 months pregnant, so she ain't helpin'!  I decide to take the day off because I really need this baby furniture (the baby is ready to go!) our delivery is set for "afternoon" so we settle in and wait.  5:30pm comes along and no delivery so we check the status: December 4th(today), 1:30pm unable to deliver.  Heavy weight shipment.  Assistance required by receiver."  WTF!!!!!   I took a day off!  I was here waiting! Stretching and getting my back and arms loose!  Notice most of these other comments touch on the same theme of fails deliveries and failed attempts.  I honestly didn't think it would happen to me.  How is a company with such poor service (like, they don't do the one thing their supposed to do!  ONLY ONE THING!!) allowed to keep functioning and making money.  More people need to know what these guys are about.Date of experience: December 05, 2014

Name: Stef
Review: They didn't even try to deliver...So I bought some clothing on the internet but I made the mistake of not checking who was the carrier... Purolator. They didn't even try to deliver, no notification, nothing, they send back the package to the seller without trying to communicate with me. No delivery notification, no reminder, no call, nothing. I called their Customer service and they said the package was sent back to the seller, with no further explaination. I called my credit card company for mail fraud. Very bad business decision to use Purolator.Date of experience: December 04, 2014

Name: Sidra Qureshi
Review: Customer Service Reps Lack Logic and Common Sense!The service I have received from Purolator the past few days has been atrocious.  Our company received an invoice with a charge that had a date from months prior – the same charge on this invoice had already been dealt with and paid for on the date in question. (Months ago, we called in to confirm this package had been delivered to the correct address on the way bill, we had actually called the day after it was shipped. We called because the package had been delivered to a different address – and we wanted to know why) Yesterday, we called Purolator regarding the charge from months ago appearing AGAIN on this new invoice - We put time and effort into slowly explaining, in detail, showing/sending proof and insisting that the customer representative review the call logs from months ago when this was settled. We tried explaining, very calmly, that ‘when we had called in (a few months ago) and spoke with a representative to inquire why this package wasn’t shipped to the correct address the rep explained that it had been redirected to the proper address, but it was delivered’  Then, the customer rep I was speaking with (yesterday) said she would email me the other package number *the package number had no way bill or anything verifying it had been sent from our company* The customer rep started emailing me, repeating the same message over and over again. I requested to speak with a supervisor. (As I had already spent half the day trying to prove that there was only one way bill and one package sent out, and that when I called in to confirm months ago that it was delivered -  this was ALREADY VERIFIED) I could not comprehend why this customer service rep was making me do all of her work? Gathering all the information she had at her finger tips, and yet was refusing to look deeper into this situation. *They have call logs for a reason, don’t they???? The supervisor contacted me the next day, repeating the same-exact- word-for-word information that the customer rep had told me the day prior. This supervisor was extremely incompetent and insisted that this was a separate ‘undeclared package’ that our company had not paid for yet (but was delivered the same time as the first package, yet it was undeclared?) She also insisted that who ever shipped it out from our shipping/receiving department must have just made a mistake and slapped a sticker on another package. I confirmed that the person who shipped it out WAS ME!?! I became VERY FRUSTRATED because I know 100% that I shipped 1 package out – it was even more frustrating because the supervisor was simply ‘assuming’ I shipped 2 packages. She then went on to say “maybe the packages were taped together” – this supervisor simply was guessing at this point.  There is still no proof of 2 different packages – our way bill says 1 of 1? We also have the invoice from months ago stating that the package was paid for already – why would we get billed on two different dates for packages that were apparently delivered and signed for at the same time? The training and customer care at Purolator is at an all time low. This situation could have been avoided entirely if this customer service representative at Purolator was somewhat receptive to common sense and logic.  I have never seen such blatant disregard for customers or such lazy work ethics in my life.Date of experience: December 03, 2014

Name: Benny
Review: USELESS, INEFFICIENT, AND UNCARINGSo I live in Ottawa, and I ordered a new computer from Dell Canada which was an order coming in from the States, and to me this shipment is extremely important due to business reasons, anyways, I am given a delivery date by Purolater, which I was kind of okay with, but 2 weeks after my order, they finally call me and say the my shipment will be arriving the next day and that they require someone to be home to obtain the package. So I cancel all my important plans and wait the entire day expecting my computer. By the way, when they called me they told me that I should expect it anytime between 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. It was half-passed six and still nothing. so I called them and they told me that for residential areas (where I live) the deadline is at 8:00 pm. So I waited till eight, still nothing, I checked the website and it said that it has been delayed but still in transit. So I wait to 10:00 pm and still nothing. I checked the website again and it said the it will be delivered the NEXT day due to missed delivery. So now here I am, it is the next day and still NOTHING! These people DO NOT understand that other people's time is very valuable and can't be wasted for pathetic and inefficient delivery drivers that work for Purolator! I bet that my package is not even in transit, and is still at the facility waiting long enough that I have to be forced to go and pick it up! This is absolutely ridiculous and has made me very, very frustrated with Purolator's service.Date of experience: December 03, 2014

Name: M Kris
Review: UnreliableDon't believe the 1 day express delivery.  It ended up being delivered 5 days later.   Weather delays, pickup next day after 3:00 pm  etc., weekend.  They do give a good apology.  Don't waste your money.  $26.00 for an urgent letter.Date of experience: December 02, 2014

Name: Taylor Folk
Review: Unable to follow directions from the startI flew out to Vancouver to perform for Grey Cup on Thursday. My car was in the shop and had 2 shirts I needed. I only realized after the dealer was closed so I formed a plan to overnight ship it for next day delivery. This depended on 2 things: excellent customer service from the dealership to send it, and purolator to send it for the next day , the service I paid 50$ for. Only one came through. It was due to arrive at 1030am Friday. After hearing nothing until 4pm, I called and was informed that it was still in Regina (the origin) due to a weather delay (not their fault). I asked for it to be held in Regina because I told them only to ship it if: it's under 50$ and if it'll arrive same or next day. Why else would I pay for overnight shipping? Now would be a good time to point out that I return to Regina at 8am Monday.  Now, Monday morning, I call for an update and am told that my package arrived in Vancouver on Friday at 317 pm. I would like to point out this was about 30 min before I placed my "where's my package?" call. I asked for it to just get dropped off at the westjet desk immediately but no, it has to go all the way to the destination (the hotel I was leaving). In the end I wasted 50$ and now I'm not getting 2 irreplaceable team shirts or a once-in-a-lifetime Worlds Team bag back, all because I trusted purolator, whom I originally thought was a good company, because since it's hard to "not" send a package across the country, I do not have enough cash at the moment to get a package I did not want sent returned to me for an extra 40$. 90$ wasted for trusting a shipping company to ship effectively.  In the end I ask these questions: why claim you can modify the shipment when you very obviously can't? If a package is shipped through overnight service with explicit instructions as to "if" it should be sent (<50$ and morning the next day) and isn't going to arrive overnight, why would you not inform the customer and seek direction (if the very blunt instructions weren't easy enough)? Why have a computerized tracking system (barcodes) if it's not being used effectively (the answers I received about my shipment made it seem like it was sent off in a canoe into the wild with the courier instructions being delivered by a brain damaged homing pigeon). The customer service representatives were helpful enough but the service itself was terrible. My package arrived in Vancouver 30 minutes before I was told it was in a warehouse in Regina. Instead of sending it out right away, they waited until Monday morning before 1030 to complete the shipment (I refer you once more to the explicit instructions) instead of asking me, the customer, what I would like done. (Aka change the delivery method to a later time). Because even though it did end up landing on Friday they were planning still to deliver it on Monday because it was due for 1030am delivery, not later. If it's already late then why does that distinction matter? I'd rather have my important package the right day instead of the right time. Poor initiative (to get me my package) and poor customer service (to inform and seek instruction).  If you're looking to ship purolator, then after this first time experience I suggest you either don't, or you make sure it's neither time-sensitive or important nor valuable/irreplaceable. The thing that irks me most is the lack of compassion towards clients and disregard for their requests. I don't think getting a free return-ship is too much to ask after my experience but apparently money is more important than a good company image.Date of experience: December 01, 2014

Name: J
Review: Lazy and not efficientThe rental office is right in the lobby of my apartment and they can let shipping company guys get into the building. I always received my packages with no problem. However, I guess Purolator is too lazy to ask the office or even to look around, they just changed the tracking status to delivery failed as they "couldn't get into the building". Got really upset with them, especially with some package you look forward so much.Date of experience: November 06, 2014

Name: Bob
Review: Slow and ExpensiveHad two shipments in one week delayed by "mechanical delays" and "missed connection"... Seriously! Even when they were out for delivery it took closer to the end of the day to have it delivered. Overall not impressed with Purolator in Halifax.Date of experience: October 29, 2014

Name: Hans
Review: Moronic system forces delays on customersTL;DR: AVOID PUROLATOR! Anything else will be better, even Canada Post!  Like most delivery services, delivery attempts happen during the day when we're at work. It's usually not a problem as the delivery company will leave the package to their closest pick up location which is usually close-by. Enter the world of Purolator. Whenever a delivery is missed, it takes the day for the parcel to go back to the central depot. In our case, it is about 3 hours away (return) by public transport. Nobody living downtown would ever go there, and that's the point of using a delivery service.Only once you've missed the delivery can you request _on a best effort basis for Purolator_ to have your shipment delivered to a closer pick up location. This happened to me today. I had to wait to miss the shipment yesterday to request for it to be held at a closer office. But somehow, requesting this before noon the day before wasn't enough and the depot didn't manage to bring it to the holding office today. And today is Friday, Purolator doesn't work on weekends.If I'm lucky, the shipment will be transferred on Monday and I'll have to pick it up at the end of the business day. That's a completely avoidable 5 days delay right there. Every day that passes without this shipment is a day I can't work. I usually pay extra just to avoid shipping by Purolator but this being an RMA, I didn't get the chance to pick. Even Canada Post (who owns 91% of Purolator) does better for a lot cheaper. Like others said, avoid like the plague!!!Date of experience: September 12, 2014

Name: John Korchok
Review: Worst Customer Service AwardMy nomination for worst customer service ever goes to Purolator Courier of Canada. I called them to have a large package picked up in Canada and brought to me in the U.S. I requested Ground Service at $57, because Express was around $400. Before I hung up, I double-checked "That's going to be Ground service, right?" and was assured it would be.When the driver went to pick up the package, he did not communicate any of this information. He made the sender fill out the waybill, which does not display an option for Ground Service. Instead it reads "U.S. Deferred", which is Purolator secret code for Ground. After the sender checked off Express service by mistake, he didn't correct them.Now Purolator is claiming the waybill has precedence over my phone request, even though they knew it was a mistake. I can't afford $400 for a shipment, so I refused receipt of the package. They are returning it to the sender and are going to try to bill the sender for the return. How are these people still in business?Date of experience: September 12, 2014

Name: Angelic Ronee Ogalesco
Review: No problemsI ordered some clothes from Forever 21 and after I got the email, I found out it was using Purolator. I searched for reviews since I haven't tried it before. So I was worried after reading a lot of bad reviews.  I am living in an apartment and I didn't give the code in the address. I got it the email on the 5th with the tracking code and I got the package today. I am at home the whole day since I'm sick. I appreciate that the guy went all the trouble of finding my name for the code and delivering the package right at my doorstep. He was friendly and wished me well after I signed and got my package.  Overall, I got it earlier than expected considering I didn't pay for the shipping costs. The package is in perfect condition and the guy was friendly. I guess it depends from person to person. I'm more than satisfied.Date of experience: September 09, 2014

Name: Sidney Jocson
Review: SHITTIEST SERVICE EVER!2-3 day shipping time took them more than a week and still counting. Will never order online from a company that uses Purolator. Their online chat service is useless as well. This company doesnt even deserve half a star, i would give it a negative star if i could... Stay away from this company. They like screwing people over! Very horrible service!Date of experience: August 26, 2014

Name: Irene
Review: Worst delivery service in CanadaReturned my package to the sender before 5 business days was up even though I had arranged a pick up after the 4th business day. Customer service rep was talking in circles couldn't even get her story straight. This is the worst company I have ever dealt with when it comes to my shipments. I now avoid ordering from online companies that use their services. Thank you Purolator for making me loose shipping costs with almost every order sent by you. I wish I could rate this with zero stars.Date of experience: August 25, 2014

Name: Jesse
Review: One missed call. Package sent back across the country.Purolator was entrusted with a critically important package being sent to my girlfriend from Ontario. This package was 6 weeks worth of short-term disability pay for time taken off work for a surgical procedure that we had already been waiting almost 2 months to receive from RBC Insurance.Apparently, after Purolator tried to drop the package off and couldn't get into our apartment building, they phoned us at 5:20 pm. Unfortunately, that's the usual time my girlfriend would be on the bus coming home from work, so she missed the call. We didn't know anything was going on, and that was the one and only time they ever attempted to make contact. Not even one of those little delivery attempt slips stuck to our front door. NOTHING.The package then sat in the local Purolator depot for a week, that being 7 entire days, from the 11th to the 18th of July. Still no further attempt was made to contact us. On the 18th, they contacted the shipper of the package, RBC Insurance, who had Purolator return it to them.When we started to get worried that the package hadn't shown up by the 18th(We weren't expecting it until the 15th anyways), and finally got the tracking number for the item and looked it up, it was already too late. It was on a trailer heading back to Ontario. (We live in Alberta) I'd like to give a 2 star rating, because the guy I talked to at Purolator was sympathetic and not at fault, and at least explained the situation to me in a manner I found helpful.But as a company, I'd give Purolator a 0/5, if not an arbitrarily large  negative number like -17billion/5. So they get a 1/5, the lowest the site will allow.Date of experience: July 24, 2014

Name: Shawna Laurent
Review: Horrible.I am only giving this company a star because I have to.I ordered a very expensive iPhone 5s from Brandon manitoba, to come to me in Burlington, ON, and it was shipped early sunday morning. (July 20th), and I have used a post office on a sunday before so i know they're open. However It was not processed until about 1pm the next day, therefore pushing back the expected delivery date. I was told I was going to recieve an email that would allow me to track my shipment, however the ability to do that was not in the email, nor was i givin a tracking number. I emailed them asking about it and when it was expected to be here now after a delay in process, at about 9 am on monday, and they did not get back to me until 4pm the same day. They They only answered the expected shipping date and not my question about why I couldn't track it, all they said was that I would recieve an email layer that night that would allow me to do so, still no email. So I emailed them back the next morning -and I got no answer. Still no answer and it's wednesday, I was told it was supposeed to be HERE by today! I paid a significant amount of money for this phone, and have already sold my old one because I was expecting this one by wednesday (like they told me) and i have yet to even recieve a tracking number. Very poor service!! I do not recommend this service!Date of experience: July 23, 2014

Name: Ted
Review: MOST UNRELIABLE COURIER !!ITS NOT EVEN WORTH 1 STAR !I GOT NOTICE OF DELIVERY AND TOLD ME TO PICK UP AFTER 11AM NEXT DAY. I COME NEXT DAY AT 2PM BUT PACKAGE STILL ON THE TRUCK GOING SUMWHERE AND CUSTOMER REP COULDNT EVEN KNOW WHERE MY PACKAGE WILL BE ARRIVED ??I WON'T USE THIS COURIER EVER AGAIN !Date of experience: July 18, 2014

Name: Jake Smith
Review: Earlier than expected delivery, friendly, communicative and inexpensiveFAST DELIVERYI ordered some clothes from Hollister and Abercrombie & Fitch on the 2nd.  My order was processed on the 3rd. Considering the 4th was a national holiday in the United States (i.e. Independence Day) and the 5th and 6th were the weekend. I was able to receive my packages on the 8th despite the expectation that they would be delivered 5 to 7 days after my order which would be the 9th to 11th. So, their delivery was quick and faster than expected. INEXPENSIVEThe cost for shipping was only $15 which is much cheaper than other shipping companies, and especially cheap to transport from California to Ontario. COMMUNICATIVEI was given a tracking number for my package and every step of the way I was able to see where my shipment was and what the action being taken was at each time period. You need to pay more for this tracking feature with some shipping companies such as Canada Post but it came free with the shipping cost from Purolator. FRIENDLYThe delivery man drove right up to my house. I already had heard it from upstairs because the windows were open. He knocked on the door. He addressed me by name.  I signed that I had received it. I thanked him. He provided well wishes. SUMMARY: No problems whatsoever. I was well-informed throughout the entire process all for a very inexpensive cost and delivered well in advance of the expectant date. Will use Purolator again in the future -- and it seems that companies are only offering this choice (I can see why -- because they're great.)Date of experience: July 08, 2014

Name: Zadien Vincent
Review: Shity!!!I am only giving them a star because I have to. I was guaranteed a delivery on Monday and after staying home all day and no delivery I decide to check the tracking information to see what was going on. The information said they came and there was no answer and they left a notice at the door. I checked and there was no notice card left. I called them, they said they would have the delivery guy turn around and come back. Of course no one showed up. The following day I checked to see if they were gonna deliver it, they said I needed to pick up within 5 business days. I called the company that I ordered from and told them that I wanted a refund of my money and I wasn't going to pick it up. You couldnt pay me enough to use this shity service.Date of experience: July 02, 2014

Name: Matt
Review: First impressions count the most, and I am far from impressedI am a first time user of purolator, and not by choice. The company I ordered from only uses purolator for it's US to Canada shipments. I am not impressed at all with there service. This morning on the expected/guaranteed date of delivery, I checked the tracking number to see that it was indeed delivered. Yet when I checked outside my house there was no package anywhere in sight. So I proceeded to check the additional details of the shipment only to find out it was delivered to a completely different address about 5 streets away. Not a problem, it's a nice day, I decided to walk and go pick it up myself. Upon arriving and searching up and down the street I realize that the address that it was delivered to did not even exist!!! So I call the purolator hotline like any normal person would do when there is a problem that needs inquiry. Instead of raining an ungodly firestorm of hell upon them, which believe me I wanted to, remaining calm seemed like the better option. Lo and behold, I am treated with no respect by there customer service and my issue "isn't high priority" according to the person whose name escaped my mind faster than a pig rolls around in s**t. All in all, purolator is great for delivering items to mythological places, but unless I need something delivered to the garden of eden or troy I won't be using there services again even if someone paid me.Date of experience: June 30, 2014

Name: Marcel
Review: Many damaged goods and rude driversI have had nothing but headaches shipping with Purolator.  Many many times I have received damaged goods from them and many more times I have shipped through them and had the goods damaged on arrival. When I asked for a moment to inspect the goods on arrival, I was told no and to just sign.  If I had any problems, to call the office.  The driver was very rude and impatient.  After, I called the office to report the behaviour and was quite dissatisfied because they really didn't seem to care.   They will never be my primary shipping company.Date of experience: June 27, 2014

Name: Andrew
Review: Multiple lost shipments within a short durationIn the last two years Purolator has lost a few shipments and do not seem too eager to assist , compensate, or improve.  We are currently calling the drop centers ourselves trying to find our shipment.  Very disappointed in their service.Date of experience: June 04, 2014

Name: Novvon
Review: Won't even come to the doorHow am I supposed to know my package has arrived if you won't even come to the door or even attempt to get my attention? I don't spend my days watching my driveway, now I have to rearrange my schedule to go pick up my package when I was expecting it to be dropped off at my house. Piss poor delivery company you are. Don't see why I should have to pay you for delivery when you don't deliver.Date of experience: May 29, 2014

Name: Emm Faj
Review: BORING and A BIG JOKE...thumbs downBeen monitoring my package since this morning 09/05/14 and even had a live chat but when I checked the status at 2:30pm there was an attempted delivery at 1:15pm and mentioned that the receiver unavailable.I did not even leave my place waiting for this parcel.UPS is the best... The courier is always trying to reach you..Date of experience: May 09, 2014

Name: Rina
Review: Purolator? A joke. Refused delivery and refused pick up option as well.This is moronic, at its best.1. Purolator drivers, they cannot read and don't buzz the names; the buzz code MUST be on the package for them to buzz. This policy is not posted.2. They don't call the recipient, even if there's a phone#; they tend to skip this part.3. They don't leave a notification.4. They return the package straight to sender after 2 days, without offering a pick up option.Customer service was of no use, wasted 40 minutes with them.The package was sent from Thunder Bay to Ottawa ( time-sensitive marriage documents).In brief, they don't care about you or your business and a class action lawsuit should be filed ASAP.Date of experience: April 29, 2014

Name: Linda Johnson
Review: Purolator...we deliver when we wantI have wasted two days of my vacation waiting for this freakin shipment and have yet to see anything!My husband is on graveyards and wasted two hours of precious sleep because I had to go out!  I am livid right now and am going to file a claim because I honestly think it's lost!  I'll come and pick it up if you find and I want my $22 dollars back I paid for shipping. I know I'm just a little guy and not some big corporation but for god's sake!!!   I've seen UPS, Fed Ex, Can Par and 2 Canada Post trucks go by my house but not one single Purolator truck!  Trust me, I've been watching!!! This has been a total lack of customer service at it's finest!!  Even though you don't care considering I'm not a multi-million dollar company, if I ever seen Purolator as the shipper again, I'll pay more not to. By the way, day three and still waiting.Date of experience: April 23, 2014

Name: David Brady
Review: Beyond horribleI have just spent a very frustrating call with this company.  At no time in my 66 years have i ever experienced such gross incompetence.  If anyone wants to lose business use this courier company.  Both the agent and the manager were obviously annoyed that i would ask them to help me by contacting the drive to leave the package near me.  They both claimed they couldn't do that when i know they can.   In fact they did it for me last week because I'm staying in an apartment in Vancouver and my primary residence is Ontario.  There is no telephone here.  I did call them last week to inform of the situation and asked them to leave it with superintendent of building who had agreed to sign for it.  While the first woman i spoke to was very accommodating - it would appear that no attention was paid to the request.   They don't get customer service.Date of experience: March 24, 2014

Name: abbacus52
Review: Absolute trash, avoid like the plague.I had the misfortune of having a few  parcels mailed to me at once (computer gear) via Purolater as it was the only shipping option available.  Their tracking system is inaccurate, slow and belongs in the 90's. The drivers are lazy and won't attempt deliveries of heavier items later in their shifts, if he sees 2x 16lb boxes expect to be going to a depot after 3-4 days of playing grab ass. The nearest depots are usually in some industrial part of town in the middle of nowhere, so have fun with that too. Expect to take multiple days off of work when your tracking information lists it as  "On truck for Delivery" only to have him never show up, not leave a door card, etc.  I have been dealing with their garbage for nearly 14 years now at 3 different addresses and it's the same damn game every time. Enjoy your multiple days of 12 hour shifts watching the door like a hawk only for it to update near the end of the day telling you to go pound sand.  Get used to seeing "Appointment required for delivery. Receiver will be contacted to reschedule."Date of experience: March 22, 2014

Name: Alan
Review: Delivery service that can't deliver on its own promisesUtterly disappointed with Purolator. Used them for the first time in 2010 and experienced a few hiccups. Had a 4-year break from using their services, but only went ahead with them after purchasing an item online needed for work that only shipped via Purolator.  Ordered an item 2 weeks ago, and I get a call telling me to be at my address to pick up the item. Wait ALL DAY LONG, and find out that a slip is pasted on my door -- absolutely ZERO effort from the guy to look directly to his/her left to see a doorbell that chimes so loud that I can hear it from any corner of the unit. 2 days ago -- get another call informing me that I need to be present today to pick up an item. I need this item, once again, for work. I wait ALL DAY LONG once again, and this time they don't even show up. I most definitely hate wasting my time complaining and almost NEVER write reviews online, so you can imagine the frustration and annoyance that I'm facing. Sure-fire way to get themselves out of business. I wish them the best of luck, and I wish for others not to put themselves through this. Don't waste your time with these sub-standard people.Date of experience: March 15, 2014

Name: Michelle G.
Review: UNRELIABLE UNORGANIZED DELIVERY SERVICETHE FIRST ATTEMPTED DELIVERY OF MY PARCEL, I AM IN THE APARTMENT  ALL DAY AND DIDN'T EVEN HEAR THE DOORBELL RING OR ANY KNOCK ON THE DOOR. JUST FOUND A SLIP OF PAPER THAT SAYS FIRST ATTEMPT IN DELIVERY WAS MADE. PERSONALLY, I DIDN'T SEE ANY EFFORT FROM THE DELIVERY MAN TO EVEN CONFIRM IF THERE'S ANYONE IN THE RESIDENCE TO RECEIVE THE PACKAGE- HE CAME AND WENT AS FAST AND AS SILENT AS A MOUSE! I MADE ARRANGEMENTS RIGHT AWAY WTH CUSTOMER SERVICE TO HAVE IT RE-DELIVERED THE DAY AFTER THE NEXT WITH SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS AND A PREFERRED TIME. AND AGAIN, I WAITED FOR NOTHING, ANOTHER WASTED DAY BECAUSE OF UNRELIABLE SERVICE. CALLED CUSTOMER SERVICE AGAIN AND FOUND OUT IT NEVER LEFT THE DEPOT AND HE DIDN'T KNOW WHY. THE PACKAGE CONTAINS MEDICINE AND HEALTH SUPPLIES THAT ARE VERY MUCH NEEDED. SO DISAPPOINTED.Date of experience: February 28, 2014

Name: Safy Safwat
Review: Worst Service Ever !!!!!I can fairly say that I've never been across such an OUTSTANDING BAD PERFORMANCE !!! I really wonder how can an organization miss the chance of having a single professional employee .????? !!!!!. starting from the customer service agents to whomever claim that they are Managers !!!!I have been into a nightmare since the first moment dealing with them ... Arranging for pick up was a big mess , sorting error led to my parcel lying in Quebec instead of Nova Scotia for 2 days , 1 more day delay of delivery due to weather conditions , and no one knows what excuse they will come up with tomorrow !!!!!! Needless to mention that I already missed the deadline of submitting the documents !!It is useless to file a complain as no one will get back to you and if you try to follow up yourself using the reference number , you will be surprised that even the manager you spoke to didn't bother to write anything on the system !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I have noted all the names but just prefers not to mention it in public .If you are looking for a reliable courier to deal with my honest advice is NEVER TO CONSIDER them.Date of experience: February 19, 2014

Name: Carson Tharris
Review: Purolator is the fastest for rural deliveriesI work for a company that ships regularly between several rural locations.  Most companies have limited delivery days or use contractors, Canada Post doesn't do door to door delivery.  Purolator is the only company that will offer next day shipping from our address, never had an issue.Date of experience: February 11, 2014

Name: Carole
Review: Lost package - claim not honouredMy Christmas package for my parents was shipped on Dec 11 - from Langley to Kelowna - when it didn't arrive after 5 days a manual tracking was set up.  When they couldn't locate it by Dec 23 -Purolator deemed it was gone and told me to make a claim - which I did.I re-purchased the items and sent the second package by courier (not Purolator) Wonders of wonders - the first package was delivered on Jan 3 - I was notified of this by my parents when they received it - not by PurolatorI was contacted by Puolator (by email) and told that my claim for re-imbersement was now declined.I called customer service and explained that I was still out of pocket for the value of the package they lost and that they were the ones to deem it lost before I had purchased the second present.They would not honour their mistake and would only re-imberse me for the shipping costs - not the value of the package!I will not use this company again and am very disappointed with their customer service!Date of experience: January 08, 2014

Name: Amy Chan
Review: Not too bad!I ordered some clothing from Toronto to be shipped to Vancouver. On all 6 occasions, the packages arrived within 2 to 3 business days! The driver/delivery person was friendly and always asked my name so he could verify that I am the recipient. The information on the tracking page were accurate and when it stated "On vehicle delivery", I always received it within the same day. The driver always rung the door bell and knocked on my door to ensure I heard him. I truly don't understand why so many people are upset with Purolator. I guess it's because if people are satisfied with its services, then they wouldn't bother to praise them. Therefore, only people who are upset with Purolator would complain about their services online. I hope more people who are satisfied with Purolator would speak up. Thank you.Date of experience: January 06, 2014

Name: A.A.
Review: Extremely poor service - Drivers do whatever they want > Puro- LaterLadies and Gentlemen,Whatever you, do not trust any delivery service with PUROLATOR.I had a small package to be delivered these holidays and again it was not delivered on the date and time set. Not the first time it happens. At least four (4) other times PUROLATOR delayed and dragged on delivery in Toronto (Ontario). 1. Customer "service" 1 (888) 744-7123 are only there to tell you they can NOT do anything; "parcel is on its way", "we can NOT get hold of the driver" they say. You need to have the "tracking number" for Purolator to track (your complete NAME and ADDRESS is useless to them).2. PUROLATOR  drivers, always rushing, usually says your name is NOT on the building board (I happen to live in the building for the past 3 years) ; Canada Post always find me !3. Is there any REGULATION on this jungle business ? Or "self-regulation" is the only law of the land in Ontario ?4. Asked for case to be escalated. Manager creates a ticket, sends a request to dispatch then calls me back 1 hour later only to tell me the package will be delivered 2 days later. Sender is already paying top dollars $$$  and all we get is a late bad service = Puro-Later . 5. Driver claims that he rang the inter-phone (buzzer) "three times" and got a busy signal. The truth is that I was in my home the whole day, took the DAY OFF work knowing that this PURO-LATER can never deliver on the day and time set (except for much more money) eh . It seems that competitors (UPS, DHL etc) now offer morning, afternoon delivery. I have two (2) independent telephone lines and live alone. Busy line/signal ?Purolator = Puro-LaterDate of experience: December 31, 2013

Name: Geraldine Watson
Review: How to make it work with Purolator!I had the same problem as a lot of people: attempted delivery with no notice left, no way of knowing they'd even tried to deliver, and then the package was sent to a Purolator outpost away out on Kipling, miles away and in the dead of winter.  HOWEVER!!   I called Purolator at their website contact number, 1-888-744-7123, and in a matter of minutes they arranged to send my package to alternative pickup location so close to home that I can practically see it from here.  And they were nice to me, too!  I really recommend this; just call the number -- they'll fix everything.Date of experience: December 30, 2013

Name: Julian Van B
Review: A cancer on the shipping industryTo put this entire company mildly, Purolator is a cancer. Just like [External reference] and [External reference], they care not for customer satisfaction, but only for the quickest dime they can make. They constantly cut corners, slow shipping times, and offer the most pitiful service possible all to raise the useless bottom line so that some soulless accountant can jerk himself off at night. Where in God's name do I start with these short bus riding couriers? As well as Trustpilot, I can also see a pleasant 30% average on consumer satisfaction on Yelp and Google, so needless to say that this will be yet another unique interpretation of a classic story. I’ll try to make it simple for the morons at Purolator to understand. Now I can understand that a package might not be here before Christmas – it’s a busy season. I just wished the mouth breather who lumbered towards my front door with my GTX 760 understood how to ring a door bell (protip- you just push a button). And thus, even when I waited all day for my new graphics card to come, the only decency I could be rewarded was a slip telling me to pick it up in 3 days because Purolator can’t be bothered to run a business on weekends in the year 2013. I guess I’ll just have to go pick it up myself because god forbid, this soulless corporation should do ANYTHING for the consumer. That is of course if I go to the right one, because while on the slip it told me to go to the Purolator in Fairview, a message on my phone told me to go to the Purolator in the ass end of Richmond, right next to the airport. I’d be surprised at this point of they didn't drop my new hardware in a puddle because they were distracted by a distant butterfly. Even with all my angry, frustrated, ranting, the reason why Purolator has such an astonishing lack of respect for its clientele is 100% crystal clear. They, along with [External reference] and [External reference] have nearly monopolized the industry. They know they can just screw with us because they’re the only game in town next to [External reference] and the [External reference], and I wished Newegg just used them instead. Purolator, to put your conduct simply, I trust chimpanzees to be better couriers than you. I’ve dealt with drug dealers friendlier than your staff. I mean this in the most profound sense possible; apply yourselves, for the love of god.Date of experience: December 29, 2013

Name: Bedros Balabanian
Review: Worst delivery company ever - NEVER AGAIN!!!!Purolator has got to be the worst delivery company. Absolutely worthless with rude clerks and lazy drivers! I purchased tires and had them delivered to me by Purolator. On the day of the arrival, I noticed from the window of my house that the Purolator truck came and so I waited at the window to see if the driver would need my help. So I'm standing there at the window, IN FULL VIEW of the driver who comes out of the truck, SEES ME THERE AT THE WINDOW, and then goes ahead and puts something in the mail box at the edge of the driveway. He then goes ahead and gets back in the truck and starts driving away!!!! Flabbergasted, I open the door, without a coat on (snow around us is about 2 meters high in Montreal) and start running after the truck, to wave the driver down and in the process fall down on the ice, break my eye glasses, my wallet flies out of my pocket. So I pick myself up, I head to the mail box and inside the lazy driver has put a delivery notice saying that I wasn't home!!!! I do a tracking on the web and the results say that I wasn't home!!!! So I take the delivery notice, and go to the Purolator office to pick up my tires, for which I PAID EXTRA for door to door delivery. I'm at the Purolator office and they ask me for an ID and that's when I realize that when I fell down, the transparent nylon pocket that holds my drivers license and medicare card is not there, it had fallen out of my wallet when my wallet flew out of my pocket when I fell. Meanwhile this is the day of the big storm in Montreal and I had driven to the Purolator office under treacherous conditions. So the clerk refuses to release the goods to me unless I show a government ID with my photo. I show her my Social security card with my name on it and all my credit cards with my name on them and my costco card which has my picture on it, but she's not budging so I get extremely angry and we have an argument. Bottom line is that she won't release my goods unless I show her a Government issues Photo ID. So I drive back home, grab my Canadian Permanent resident card which has a photo of me and is government issued and drive back to Purolator office. This time they won't release the goods because the Canadian Permanent resident card has no address on it but in my presence they just gave merchandise to another person who came to pick up and he showed them his Medicare card WHICH DOES NOT HAVE AN ADDRESS ON IT!!!!!! So now the manager gets called because the matter is escalating beyond reason, and after making my case with the manager why I don't have another ID for 40 minutes, they finally give me my goods. The driver who caused all this mess did not even ring my door bell to check if I was at home, even if he didn't see me at the window - which is impossible not to because my windows are large and I had all the lights on and I was standing there waiting for him!!!! I will never buy from a company again who uses Purolator to ship their goods, I will never use Purolator for any of my shipping needs. Absolutely worst company ever!Date of experience: December 23, 2013

Name: Jenna Walsh
Review: Worst Company Ever - missing and damaged my items!My father sent me some stuff from Ontario to Alberta. Nine jars of homemade pickled eggs, pickles, and beats. A $20.00 bottle of pure maple syrup (in a sealed PLASTIC bottle), Two bath towels and a face cloth.  They came in the afternoon while I was at work and left a note to pick up at a certain location. I went to pick it up a few days later and when I got there they said that the package had been damaged and was sent to another location on the other side of the city. They had not called me at all to tell me this so I walked there (20 min) for nothing. The lady there gave me the number of the location so I could call and I did. They told me some of the jars had been damaged (even though they were all bubble wrapped and than wrapped in towels, stored nicely in there by my father and taped up very well).  They said that they would repack what was left and send it to the original location it was to be sent to. I picked it up and carried it home, opened it and a face cloth and the bottle of maple syrup are missing, plus they led me to believe that a couple of the jars maybe two or three got damaged but five of the jars are gone and the original tote it came in.  For the original tote to be damaged and the amount of stuff that got broken in there after my fathers careful packaging, the package had to be mishandled. Plus, where are my other two items that couldn't be damaged?  I understand that there was glass but that much damage? And it was obviously fine at the time they came around to my apartment. What happened to it between there and the store?Date of experience: December 18, 2013

Name: Jumping Jack
