Review: Not lost a parcel yetIf I see that a company uses Purolator to ship I usually cancel the order unless it's the only game in town (like Newegg.ca (grumble)). Canada Post all the way! Their lowest cost service isn't quite as fast as Purolator but I can be guaranteed that I get my parcels on the first delivery attempt (much higher levels of professionalism from their staff--the benefit of a unionized workforce!), and, if not on the first attempt, at least they're available for pickup the same evening at a location that's only a 10 minutes walk from my house. Purolator is an OK company in terms of getting a package from point A to point B INSIDE their own network (if the tracking info is to be believed). But, in my part of Toronto (postal code M4J 1C4) they're downright awful in terms of getting packages to me AT HOME.  My wife and I work a full time job which means we're not home during working hours (and, even when my wife was off on mat leave they STILL managed to never deliver ANY package on the first attempt even though she was home during the day). The only time Purolator ever tries to deliver is during "normal" working hours so I have NEVER received a shipment from them on the first try. Usually it takes them two or three attempts to get it right or I just give up and have them redirect to my work address. Now I send the parcel straight to my work address if I know I'm dealing with Purolator because I'd rather not have to deal with their friendly, but highly ineffective customer service department. Plus, Purolator's depot in this part of the city is out in the middle of nowhere (a 35 minute walk one way along a pretty grungy road populated by lots of drivers hell bent on killing anyone who's not in a car) so EXTREMELY inconvenient and also a slight bit dangerous. You'd think that repeated attempts to deliver a package would cost them money because I make them deliver rather than waste an hour and a half out of my day trekking to the lake and back. Ah well, I guess this is what the federal government wants Canada Post to devolve into--a private company offering terrible service, even to people in high density parts of the country where providing high quality service costs a fraction to deliver compared to small, low density towns. Mind you, my service experience with Purolator sounds a lot better than what people in small town Canada experience (which is why I'm prepared to give them three stars).Date of experience: December 18, 2013

Name: Nathan
Review: GongshowI just want to start this review by saying I will never ever be using Purolator for anything again. The small package was sent to my old city, so I asked for a redirect. I was told it would come Tuesday but it didn't and they said there was a delay and that I would receive it Wednesday. It didn't arrive, and showed that it was in LONDON so I called and asked about that and they said I would receive it Thursday because there was a shipping error and it was sent to the wrong city. I talked to a 'tracking specialist' who promised I would receive my package Thursday morning and now it's back in Toronto getting sorted (why would he tell my that I would have it this morning if it needed to go back to TO to get sorted!?), and I'm still waiting for a call back. Between all this I spoke to a woman who was basically blaming me for having it redirected and then a different guy was telling me that this sort of thing happens (well, I've never had a single problem with any other courier). I'll be contacting the Better Business Bureau next, and I encourage any other customers with issues do the same. The amount of negative comments are atrocious, it's amazing to me that Purolator doesn't look into their management issues.Date of experience: December 12, 2013

Name: Tanya
Review: Perte de temps, Perte d'argent ! Ne choissisez pas PurolatorÉprouve présentement de très grand difficulté a recevoir 2 petit clé USB... Tant de temps perdu pour ces deux petits objets **!/&?&*$ Purolator  Difficulty to receive my package. They have it, but they do not want to give me because my adresse is not the same on my cards...(father/mother separated)  But I have a lot of proof that I reside there too... Really Bad experience with those people...Date of experience: December 12, 2013

Name: Dionne Samuels-dussie
Review: Waste of time and InconsiderateAfter ordering on-line from Bestbuy, Purolator had me waiting at home two days in a row waiting on the package to be delivered. Each time the driver would just scan the package and not show up!!! Fedex and UPS drivers never no this!!! The service is poor and unreliable.Date of experience: December 10, 2013

Name: Daniel Generic
Review: Purolator is the worst way to receive a package.Purolater never lets me know when they've attempted delivery of a package. They don't leave a slip at the door and they don't always call, so they only way to know if something has arrived is by tracking the package from the vendor. Then, to pick the package up, the warehouse is out of the way on the other side of the river. Other alternatives like Canada Post are much more convenient.Date of experience: December 07, 2013

Name: Mabel T
Review: Can't handle Black Friday/Cyber MondayDuring Black Friday and Cyber Monday, I placed many orders from two different retailers. Both retailers only offered purolator for shipping. I used to love purolator because they shipped pretty fast and they do ring the doorbell more than once but unfornately, I had so many delays in my trackings during this week. They've been delayed 2-4 days due to missed connections and missed delivery (they didn't deliver to my house so don't get confused, they didn't have enough time to delivery to me!). I would have thought they'd put in more shifts since delivery companies know during the holidays many people order stuff online..Date of experience: December 07, 2013

Name: Hannah
Review: Purolator cannot be any WORSE!Can’t swear enough about this incompetent operation. Waited SIX days for delivery, the package is still not here! I called 1-888-744-7123 and used live chat, no one from purolator can tell me where my package is right now and no one knows when am I going to receive my package!   Dec 6, 2013	11:55 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Delayed in transit due to missed connectionDec 6, 2013	5:03 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 6, 2013	3:35 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 5, 2013	6:32 p.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 5, 2013	4:47 p.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Delayed due to missed deliveryDec 5, 2013	8:10 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	On vehicle for deliveryDec 4, 2013	2:38 p.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Delayed due to missed deliveryDec 4, 2013	7:40 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	On vehicle for deliveryDec 4, 2013	12:56 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 3, 2013	10:39 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Delayed due to sorting errorDec 3, 2013	8:06 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	On vehicle for deliveryDec 3, 2013	3:38 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 2, 2013	2:32 p.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Delayed due to missed deliveryDec 2, 2013	9:18 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	On vehicle for deliveryDec 2, 2013	12:31 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 2, 2013	12:19 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Weather delayDec 2, 2013	12:19 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Arrived at sort facilityDec 2, 2013	12:18 a.m.	Winnipeg, MB	Picked up by PurolatorNov 27, 2013	7:26 p.m.	Montreal Sort Ctr/ctr Tri, PQ	Departed sort facilityNov 27, 2013	7:00 p.m.	Montreal Sort Ctr/ctr Tri, PQ	Arrived at sort facilityNov 27, 2013	6:59 p.m.	Montreal Sort Ctr/ctr Tri, PQ	Picked up by PurolatorNov 27, 2013	6:56 p.m.	Montreal Sort Ctr/ctr Tri, PQ	Arrived at sort facilityNov 27, 2013	11:10 a.m.	Purolator	Shipping label The worst courier company!!! Why is it still in business!?Date of experience: December 07, 2013

Name: Lisa
Review: False tracking? Halted delivery?Someone local deemed my address didn't exist and halted my package. No one called me. But the tracker still indicated 'attempted deliveries to an incorrect address'. I even confirmed that no one was coming by. Misleading tracking information. Support did get my package re-delivered, but it shouldn't have been halted two days by a locationally challenged delivery driver.Date of experience: December 05, 2013

Name: Katherine
Review: Allowed some random to refuse my packageOn Thursday the 28th I got a parcel slip on my door saying that after 4:30 my package would be available for pickup. I wasn't able to go that day or Friday so on Monday I made my way over to get my package. When I got there I gave the employee the slip that was left on my door and she went into the back. After several moments she came back and said that for some reason she couldn't find it in the back, but not to worry, she would track it down on the computer. So she goes on the computer and she seems quite confused. Then she looks at the ticket, back up at me, and to the computer screen. "Was the package from Starbucks?" she asked.  I told her that, yes, the parcel was coming from Starbucks. It turns out that three hours before hand someone else had come in with a slip from my package and since their name wasn't on it and they couldn't pick it up they decided to refuse it.  I questioned how someone who wasn't me could refuse my package, especially considering that I need ID to pick the damn package up that has my name and address (which I am not against, but the rules should be the same for refusing a package). The lady swore up and down that the shipping address was this other woman's address and her phone number was even the one on file! I call bull to that. No other women live at my address, I'm the one who filled out the shipping information (and what are the chances of me putting down some random persons address and phone number?), I had already received the bill at MY address, and lastly if it weren't filled out for MY address then why did I still get a parcel slip to my address in the first place? It doesn't add up. I'm assuming that the employee who accepted the refusal didn't even check to see if this person lived at the address in question and just let them turn it away. This is completely unacceptable. At the VERY LEAST a call should have been made to me to see what was going on. Why did this person get a slip to my package to begin with? The only other people that live with me are my husband and infant son. Obviously neither of them were this mystery woman. They refused to give me any information on how this mistake occurred and told me the only thing I could do was call the customer service hotline and try to get them to catch the package and reroute it back to my city. I tried calling the number two days in a row when I was available.  They claim to be open until 8 p.m but both times I've gotten a message saying they're closed and then it states their hours. Now I've had to file an online request for it but apparently it takes up to 48 hours for them to respond and by that point it could already be back to the company I bought it from and then I have to sort it out with THEM and pay shipping AGAIN.Date of experience: December 04, 2013

Name: Sara
Review: Lost another package... Can't you get it rightThey lost my package... Apparently no signature required means leave the package wherever you'd like. Had someone home all day, and they can't be bothered to ring a doorbell. Package was left at clearly the wrong address... Great customer service right thereDate of experience: November 25, 2013

Name: Tyler Monsanto
Review: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIMEPUROLATOR AND THEIR BOGUS DRIVERS WHO SAY THEY DELIVER PACKAGES BUT NEVER DO. AND WHEN YOU DO CONFRONT THEM, THEY JUST FILE A CLAIM AND STILL CAN'T GUARANTEE THAT YOUR PACKAGE WILL BE DELIVERED IN A TIMELY MANNER.Date of experience: November 08, 2013

Name: a3a11307
Review: purolator is the worst delivery company ever!I can't believe that purolator is even in business still. How strange is it that a delivery company doesn't deliver?? They made no attempts to deliver my package,  there were no notices on my door and i'm home most of the day and would have been able to receive it so they are obviously don't try to deliver it or they just stop in front of the building for a second and then keep going. all they ever do is call you and leave a recorded message, not to ask you when it is convenient for them to deliver but instead to tell you to come and pick your package up! I mean isn't that their job??  Doesn't help that their package depots are so few and far between that I have to drive 40 minutes round trip out of my way to get the darn thing. This time they just called me once and then sent the package back to the senders...so frustrating!  Canada post is sooo much better, I will even pay extra if I have to to get them to deliver, unfortunately some company's don't you a choice.Date of experience: November 01, 2013

Name: trisblou
Review: DO NOT EVER USE THAT SERVICE. EVER!The only one positive moment from my experience with this company is operators. They are polite and helpful.  As for service, it is just horrible. They almost never get packages to their costumers right on time. You have to wait from 8am to 8pm, waste your time, and finally get your status " Delayed due to missed delivery". It is already two days of loosing your time ( it can be more) . To Purolator:  Hey, we pay you for a proper service and it is not our problem that you don't have enough employees to work! Just hire more!Date of experience: October 31, 2013

Name: Jean-Philippe
Review: Purolator doesn't care, it's all about the bottom line."This place is impossible to find, don't try to GPS it." "Most remote service center in the world to retrieve package" "I want to die whenever I receive a package note from Purolator." "Worst delivery company ever." I'd like to go at length about my particular delivery but since I'm stuck with a 3 hours+ commute to pick it up I'm making it short and leaving those choice reviews of my Purolator Anjou "service" (roflmao) center.Date of experience: October 25, 2013

Name: Jasmine Hsiao
Review: Gave my package to someone else!ive been tracking my order for a few weeks, and it said that my package was delivered to the facility, when i went to pick my package up they told me someone else had claimed it already!!! worst experience ever do they not check to see if the name and address match. unacceptably disgustin.Date of experience: October 24, 2013

Name: tre drt
Review: Horrible Delivery ServiceThe whole point of paying for delivery is for it to be convenient not to have to drive out to the depot to get your package. Seriously horrible business plan, would never use again.Date of experience: October 21, 2013

Name: omg
Review: Worst service everI can't remember a single time this purolator aliens did a single delivery right. I am never ordering again from anybody who uses purolator and if that happens may the guilty party can't sleep at night and get home late and have to work double hard next day.Date of experience: October 17, 2013

Name: Zim Zen
Review: They don't deliver, literally.Attempted delivery twice on 'incomplete address' in the same day, a little over an hour apart I did give my overlydetailed address after seeing the first failed attempt and gave my complete address, along with the apt# and buzzcode, and my cell #. I gave the message BEFORE the second attempt message. (Let's assume there were actual attempts.)So how did they fail on the second attempt? If they did not get my message --> WHY ATTEMPT AGAIN ON THE SAME DAY WITHOUT A 'COMPLETE' ADDRESS? If they did get my message --> HOW DID YOU FAIL AND NOT CALL ME?? All I can see this coming down to is a third failed attempt that will ask me to pick it up off their site on the opposite side of the city.Date of experience: October 12, 2013

Name: Bapujee Biswabandan
Review: Worst ServiceI was expecting a delivery today . I did not go anywhere today so that I would not miss the delivery. At 1pm when I checked the status of delivery, it showed "Appointment required for delivery. Receiver will be contacted to reschedule delivery". What is this? Nobody came to my unit, nobody knocked on the door and you just reschedule the delivery. I am very much disappointed with your service. You don't have any respect for a person's time. Tomorrow I have a meeting and I can't take day off from my work. It is totally unacceptable. Next time I order anything online I will make sure that it is not sent by Purolator.Date of experience: September 26, 2013

Name: Kelly
Review: Make No Effort!The Purolator driver made no effort to deliver my package. I'm not sure he even showed up. I waited all day only to find out I had to go pick it up. He said he was here but I know if he was he must have driven on by. The office just made stupid excuses. Worst delivery company I have ever experienced.Date of experience: September 19, 2013

Name: Jean Racine
Review: Every time, problemsAre these guy are really trying to deliver packages or they just stop in front of your house, wait a second, and continue to drive? EDIT: My buzzer was off last time, so i want beserk on them and im sorry for that.  The other times still count and explain low rating.Date of experience: September 13, 2013

Name: Neil
Review: Canada International Delivery = SuccessI don't get why so much people have problems with Purolator. Worked fine for me! I ordered a pair of shoes (Air Jordan Spizikes) and they shipped on the 6th of August. Tracking number provided, I checked its status daily. It only took about 5 days to get ship from Toronto to Vancouver (Where I live) and when the Purolator truck came around, my Doorbell rang and the dude handed me the shoes. Pretty smooth experience with Purolator besides the fact that everybody flames on them. 5/5.Date of experience: August 12, 2013

Name: NameNotImportant
Review: Horrible company, will never useDelivery guy doesn't even attempt to deliver my package, instead forced to go pick it up which failed too.Date of experience: August 07, 2013

Name: frankus
Review: Worst. Company. Ever! Beyond Imcompetent!I've been trying to get my package for the past week! I tried live chat 3 times before giving up completely! Are Monkeys running this company??actually that would be an insult to monkeys. -_-Date of experience: July 31, 2013

Name: JoanneBarrett
Review: Agreed - PUROLATOR has the worse in customer service!!I had a problem with a $10 fine Purolator added to my bill.  It was due to an error in the information they had on their system, using wrong account and business information.  I called, emailed and spoke with someone on their "chat" to no avail.  Finally I just gave up since my time is worth more than $2.50 an hour!  I suggested I would use another courier who was appreciative of customers and they were so fast sending me confirmation of my "cancelled account"  Imagine that - would not find the time to provide quality customer service to help resolve my issue, but speedily and promptly cancelled me - I guess that made the customer service employees feel proud.  There are many other quality courier companies - don't bother with Purolator!!Date of experience: July 29, 2013

Name: Lin Tran
Review: The worse delivery company that I have encountered.Dealing with Purolator representatives is a pain in the ass.  They promised the package be delivered on Monday but was not delivered until Wednesday after calling them several times on Tuesday and Wednesday.  The representatives don't know what they are talking about or doing.  It was frustrating!  I will not go back to them. LinDate of experience: June 19, 2013

Name: Mira
Review: Shockingly incompetent company!!Purolator's mistake cost me a lot of money and customers! The manager told me that their policy states they can't be held responsible for their mistakes, tried to blame it on me, and gave me attitude! She acted like I should be grateful they are refunding the shipping charge! The $70 shipping charge is nothing compared to the damage their mistake did to the business. They shipped my parcel 5-day ground instead of 9am next-day air shipping like my receipt said. The box had air stickers on it too! My supplier said this is the second time they've made this same mistake in the same week!! I bet this happens to tons of their customers alllll the time!!! Don't trust this company with important deliveries!Date of experience: June 16, 2013

Name: Jack Jackson
Review: Worst Delivery Company in Canada ... By FarEverything that Brandon Brown and Milan wrote. This company NEVER delivers. I honestly don't think they even try.Because on days I'm home (I work from home) there will be no buzzer or anything. Just a message that Delivery Attempted. A lot of the other courier services are great. They deliver. They try twice, sometimes thrice. They leave a note. They call up sometimes. Canada Post sends a postcard reminder. What does Purolator do?Try once. No Card. Send it back. I've stopped ordering from Dell because Dell only uses Purolator. I'm gradually cutting out companies that use Purolator.After a year of frustrations it dawned on me that the problem is companies that use Purolator. Everyone else was fine. It's the Purolator using companies whose orders weren't reaching.Date of experience: May 08, 2013

Name: Hanle Yap
Review: This company performs like the governmentTerrible service.  Won't tell you when they will re-deliver, just stay home for 2 days, and we'll deliver within those 48 hours.  I will never use them again, and will never order from sites that use them as courier.  Attention Walmart.caDate of experience: April 23, 2013

Name: Brandon Brown
Review: no delivery attemptDriver did not attempt to deliver my packages when I had items shipped with Purolator (was no other choice but Purolator with the place I ordered from). About 10-15 times no delivery attempt. Called and complained 3 times on different occasions. Only after the third complaint did they start actually attempting delivery and leaving notes for pickup if I wasn't home.  The drivers have always been incredibly rude when they actually do deliver the package. Not sure why they don't just drop it off at the pick-up locations since doing their job is such a hassle that they have to act like bastards when making deliveries to paying customer.Date of experience: April 18, 2013

Name: Milan Assuied
Review: Worst shipping compagny ever1 - Never call you when they try to deliver the package2 - They try only once3 - Location unreachable4 - They keep the package for 5 days only The only thing I wish for this company is it close. That way no one will ever send me again a package using purolator.Date of experience: March 26, 2013

Name: Abida Remtulla
Review: Pretty good!I was extremely worried about not receiving my package in time for Valentines Day (it was a gift) or having to drive a long way to pick it up from the postal office, however, I fortunately had a very good experience with Purolator.  The tracking statuses were up to date, and I received my order the next business day! Right in time for the occasion.  Personally I'm not one to write a review, however I was so surprisingly pleased with the service and I will definitely be using it as a carrier again.Date of experience: February 14, 2013

Name: Matt Inglis
Review: Absolute GarbageI recently moved from Alberta to B.C, and didn't have room for all my possesions, so I had a freind send a few of them via Greyhound for my convience. Greyhound took roughly a week, and I struggled to find time to go to the depot and pick up my packages, but I eventually got them all, safe and sound with no hassle on the companies end. When I was ready for my next round of possesion to come, my freind back home suggested delivery via Purolator for a faster shipment, and delivery right to my door.  1 package of roughly the same size and weight as the 4 i sent by Greyhound cost MORE than the four I had previously shipped, and still took 3 days. When I didn't recieve my delievery after that, I tracked the shipment, and found out "an adress correction was needed"  Purolator contacted me, using a blocked number, I might add. (Poor choice, as I don't usually answer those) and asked for my apartment's buzzer number. After I got it for them, I called the 1-800 number I was provided with, and spoke to a rude, abrupt woman who was of no help. When asked if would be home for delievery tomorrow, I replied, only before 10 A.M as I work Monday-Friday. I then asked if I could pick the package up, and was told I would need I.D with my current adress on it. Having only moved two weeks ago, I don't have updated ID. I was told pick-up would be impossible without it. I was also told delivery couldn't be made to my adress before 10 A.M, pretty much telling me I couldn't recieve my package anytime soon.  When I asked if package could be returned to sender so they could re-send it using a different comany, the phone representative suggested I have the package deleivered to my work. After an excrutating three minutes trying to explain I work at a television studio called C-T-V, not I-S-T-C-V, the representative told me to make sure if someone was going to recive the package other than myself, (receptionist, etc) that I warn them, so the package isn't turned away. In closing, Purolator would not let me pick up my own belongings, that I paid outragous prices to ship, they could not deliver, BUT, however, they would just simply drop it off with a receptionist at an office downtown, no questions asked? Where is the logic behind that?  I will never be using this service again, and will be informing my social groups of the difficulties I encountered while trying to use Purolator, and reccomending the use of competators.Date of experience: January 14, 2013

Name: Johan Boer
Review: Unacceptable delivery policy and no client considerationI sometimes order items online for the convenience to have it delivered to my door. Typically couriers will phone and agree on an approximate delivery time that someone will be home, or leave a note to call them.  Unfortunately purolator's service ethics is not in line with industry standards. They came in the middle of the day (when normal harworking Canadians are at work) to my door, found no-one at home, and left a note that I can pick up the package from their warehouse, more than a 50km return trip from my home. When I complained to purolator about this system, their response was defensive and blaming my trip on my inability to read their note. They claimed that they would have phoned me the next day to agree on a delivery time, and that this is indicated as such on their note. I re-examined the note, and still can't find it, not even in the fine script on the back of the note. It only indicates that I can pick up the package and that they will hold the package for 5 business days.  To me there are 2 principles wrong in the way Purolator treats the clients of other companies that use Purolator to deliver their products: •They can make a quick call like other couriers to find out approximately what time you are home, which they refuse to do. •They place the blame for their ineffective operations on the shoulder of the client.  To be honest, next round it will be more convenient for me to drive 5 km to my local store and buy the product in person. If I pay for the convenience for delivery, I don't need to drive 50km to collect the part myself, after paying double the cost. If I need to order another item next time, and the dealer uses the services of Purolator, I will unfortunately cancel the order.Date of experience: January 10, 2013

Name: Sy Serediak
Review: The worst shipping company ever.Purolator is the least reliable shipping company you can imagine. They did not a delivery note to my apartment door, which made me ran around to find out who I was dealing with, since original sender used different shipping company in England and they did not have any idea Purolator was involved. Purolator have a stupid policy which they don't leave any notes on the apartment building because they don't want people to wrongfully claim and  pick up  someone else's parcels.  In my opinion, if the staffs at the office check the ID (look close and actually CHECK it), this is totally avoidable. Why they cannot leave the notes? Any other company does for no problem. I made a complaint. All I got was "so what?". NO apology what so ever. All staff I dealt with had bad attitudes.  This is absolutely the worst shipping company I've ever dealt with. Please, do not choose Purolator for your sake. Use Fedex, UPS or even Canada Post, you'll have a better service for sure.Date of experience: January 08, 2013

Name: Prabhjot Athwal
Review: It sucks and its run by moronsI recieved a package that was supposed to be recieved in 3 days but it came after three weeks and I paid forty bucks for this shit that was sent from the u.sDate of experience: December 23, 2012

Name: Brad
Review: Absolutely awful serviceI've had nothing but problems with packages delivered through purolator in St. John's, Newfoundland. I'm not sure if it's lazy drivers or just an incompetent staff but my packages are always delayed for a day or more due to "Weather" when there is never any adverse conditions that would effect the safety or customers packages. I've had to call the local office (whose number is never listed in the phone book just the 800 number) and randomly punch in extensions to and catch the office staff off guard to get any service. For anyone in St. John's having issues I suggest calling 579-5671 and their extensions start at 2000. I've had luck reaching 2006 and 2007.Date of experience: December 20, 2012

Name: Jones Jonas
Review: Why are they in businessPoor customer service...Maybe your delivery guys are just plain LAZY or INCOMPETENT but your service to paying customers is horrendous. Shame on those companies who offering online shopping and use this company as a means of delivery. LAZY LAZY LAZY drivers.Date of experience: December 03, 2012

Name: Sarah Currens
Review: Never attempts deliveryNo matter how many time I sit at home, waiting for a delivery it never comes. I check my tracking information and it shows a delivery attempt but no one home. They never even try, I know because my buzzer is linked to my cell phone. I could be in Timbuktu and if someone buzzes me I would get it.Date of experience: November 26, 2012

Name: Andrew Cripps
Review: Pay a lot, get very littleI bought something online, sadly shipped by Purolator. When I got home from work there was a voice message to say that Purolator needed to know whether my street was "east" or "west". Now Purolator already has (a) my account details, and (b) my Postal Code and my street number. And the Government, major banks, Credit card companies, etc all have NO problem shipping to my street without the East or West designation. But not Purolator! No, their computer asks for East or West and they can't possibly ship without that information it seems. I phoned the day I got the call - Thursday - and provided the "West" designation and  was then told that my package wouldn't be delivered until the following Monday! I was staggered. Pay a lot to Purolator, get very little.Date of experience: November 23, 2012

Name: Deanne Warholm
Review: Purolator will not deliver to Priddis Alberta.If Purolator will not service an area namely Priddis, Alberta. Why are you not telling your customers so they use someone who will? The driver lied about trying to deliver my package. There was a 2 min time difference between the time he attempted to deliver my package to the time he dropped it off at a Purolator station. The reason that is so wrong is the station is 25 minutes from my home. That just proves he never even attempted to deliver the package. Talking to a station manager this happens all the time in this area. If Purolator has a driver unwilling to deliver to the whole area he was given or appointed. Why would Purolator continue to employ that driver.Date of experience: November 16, 2012

Name: Pamela Bentley
Review: Worst possible Experience I have ever even imaginedFrom start to finish my dealings with this shipping company has been horrible.  They only told me I had one package, when I really had two. No one called about the second package.  I had to make a second trip to pick it up. However when I got there, the package had been moved to a different facility.  I have spoken with several managers at the purolator main office and NONE of whom made even a single not on my file about the issue that was happening.  So each time I call back, it is as if nothing had happened before and i have to start overall. I will never Ever use this company again.  IT IS HORRIBLE. I recognize that shipments to individuals make up a very small part of their business. But they should get out of that business all together.   This company sucks.  I could honestly run a better company from my basement.  I hope I never even have to hear the name Purolator again!   PS: that is a DUMB name for a shipping company!Date of experience: September 19, 2012

Name: Mayank Prasad
Review: Idiots would be understatement for this companyHorrible service,They may try to deliver your package once if you are lucky. And if you are unfortunate to not pick it up then then trust me your package is as good as gone back to sender. Best part is every morning at 6AM they are gonna mark your package as refused. Within 2 days they will return the package to sender. No notifications no details. I am hoping i can pick it up from their warehouse today but hope they keep it for me.Date of experience: August 01, 2012

Name: Steve
Review: Unreliable and idiotic.I checked the web site regarding a package one recent morning, and saw that it was "on vehicle for delivery".  I took steps to ensure that someone would be home for the entire day, yet no delivery.  Furthermore, I saw a Purolator truck drive by. I live on a quiet residential road.  It is not a through route, so I assumed he was delivering something to a neighbour and would be back shortly, but he never returned.  Later that night, I checked and found that the tracking was updated to indicate that a scheduled delivery appointment was required - and that this change was made about 5 minutes after I saw the truck drive by.   Early next morning, I called and was told that the package was once again on the truck for delivery and would arrive by the end of the day, but once again, no delivery and the web site was once again updated to say that an appointment was required.   The next time I called, I was advised that the double failed delivery indicated an incorrect address.  I had a receipt from the vendor and knew that the address shipped to was correct.  It had allowed the post office, UPS, Fed Ex, and the pizza guy to all find my house with no problems, but apparently not Purolator. That evening, I was speaking to a neighbour of mine, and she told me that for two consecutive days, she had a number on her call display.  She called it and found it was Purolator - they had called my 2nd floor neighbour twice (without leaving a message).  Apparently, because my neighbour did not answer (she was at work), they assumed that the address on the package was incorrect. Finally, on the third day, the driver delivered it (and the address was perfect.) It even turned out that the delivery was "no signature required" in the first place - he could have avoided this bad review, avoided my rage and given acceptable service if he had just dropped the package on the front porch and driven away on that first day.  It must have taken more effort to load the package 3 times than it would have actually taken to deliver it.  Now, whenever I order anything, I have to get assurances from the vendor that it will not be sent by Purolator since they are so unreliable.Date of experience: August 01, 2012

Name: Michael Hodges
Review: Does not even "attempt" to deliverThis company is absolutely incompetent at delivering packages. Three times now the company has stated that they attempted to deliver the package. Three times I have cancelled my WHOLE day waiting for this extremely important package. I have sat at home waiting for a buzz. My buzzer is conected to my cell phone so not only do I always hear when someone is buzzing, I know when I have missed a buzz because my phone has a missed call. Three times I have been home, three times I have not been buzzed at all, no followup, three times the "attempted delivery" has failed. I did not even receive a notice of attempted delivery which makes me believe the driver didnt even show up in the first place. I even called customer service to reiterate my address, buzz code, and contact number but not even that worked. Now I need to drive an HOUR out to the nearest depot just to pickup the package I PAID them to deliver. Complete incompetence. DO NOT DEAL WITH THIS COMPANY!Date of experience: July 25, 2012

Name: Emmanuel Goldstein
Review: Beyond worthless.Actually -999.999.999/0. So I need something shipped next day and UPS is around $50. I call Purolator and the guy says "$25-30". Great. I get there the next day and he says $40. Fine, still cheaper. He tells me it will be there the next day at 10:30am. That was Thursday...I'm writing this Monday afternoon and it just arrived. Is Monday the "next day" after Thursday? Maybe Purolator needs to hire Rebecca Black as a consultant. I could have sent it via Canada Post for $24 and had it there by Monday. I could have paid UPS the $50 and had it there the actual next day. And their excuse when I called and spoke to two useless customer "service" people for 40 minutes trying to get a partial refund? "It was held up in Customs". Well, Customs didn't take my money. Customs didn't tell me it would arrive the next day. But hey, who knew an international shipping company would have to deal with Customs? That's crazy talk! If I'm 3 hours late for work I don't tell my boss, "you still have to pay me cuz it's not my fault there was traffic". He'd laugh me out of his office. If they at least said anything like "oh, it may be delayed due to blah blah" then I'd be 100% fine about it. They REFUSE to take any responsibilty. The twit I got "escalated" to told me "dur, it's in the 22 page agreement on our website so STFU". I didn't use the website. It may as well be on the Great Wall of China. It's not even on the 10 paragraphs of fine print on my receipt. If the website said "we'll throw your package in the trash and use your money for cocaine and hookers" that wouldn't make it acceptable. Man Up.  They will steal your money then talk to you like you're mentally defective. It's that simple. Go FedEx or UPS or Canada Post. Carrier pigeons would be better than these losers.Date of experience: July 09, 2012

Name: Parker Miles
Review: Terrible service from a terrible companyI am a college student that has classes every morning and it is clear to a shipping company that I am from my address. However Purolator is the ONLY courier I have used where my package arrived at 11 am. UPS and FedEX both have delivered after 4pm, a more reasonable time for almost anyone with a job or school. But that is just the beginning, I left specific intructions with the place I ordered my package from and Purolator outright IGNORED my request and now it is sitting in a depot since noon and Purolator REFUSES to ship again today, even though there would be plenty of time to do so to rectify their mistake. I left instructions to leave the package with the landlord of my complex if I do not answer my door when they show up, FedEX followed my request when I was not in town and a overseas shipping company IN KOREA RELAYED THIS MESSAGE when I ordered a monitor FROM KOREA. But no, Purolator just ignored my request and now I must pay a cab or take public transit to get my package or walk in 35 degree celcius heat because of their incompetenceDate of experience: July 06, 2012

Name: Lizzy Shafir
Review: AVOID PUROLATOR UNRELIABLE SERVICEYou are the worst delivery service. YOu rip off customers who paid shipping. YOu simply do not deliver as a delivery service. One missed phone call, and my package is shipped back.That is not delivery service that is delivery theft. AVOID AVOID AVOID, LIKE THE PLAGUE DO NOT USE PUROLATOR FOR ANY DELIVERY SERVICE THEY ARE SIMPLY NOT RELIABLE TO GET YOU YOUR PACKAGEDate of experience: May 11, 2012

Name: Alex Katz
Review: Awful service! AVOID!!!Purolator service is built for themselves! They deliver from 7am to 6pm, excluding Saturdays, when the most people at their workplaces at  this time! Could you believe it?! So, you MUST be at home  for a whole day waiting for them and it doesn't guarantee that you will get your item!!! Because they have a lot of different excuses - for example, your buzzer wasn't working, you didn't answer etc'. How could I answer  if I did not receive any buzz!When I've complained about it, I've got an answer that they did their best and now I have to come to their location to pick up my item!!!Why some companies still use this selfish, ill-organized company?!Date of experience: April 27, 2012

Name: Kate
Review: Rude and sketchy service.I've never had a good experience with this company. The customer service at the 1-888 number is absolutely terrible. Every time I call they are rude and unhelpful. One of the depot stations in Toronto (Morse street) is extremely sketchy. My package was opened... the seal was broken (it was a Lenovo laptop) and things in the package looked like they'd been moved around. The depot station never left a note on my door, or tried to call me. The depot station also had NO PHONE NUMBER to contact them. It was a nightmare.Date of experience: March 23, 2012

Name: ania
Review: Ridiculous.You never got a note that we stooped by? Oh you live in an apartment building - that's why" .... Ummm... Does that make sense? Then, I was told I could have asked for another delivery the next day. I replied that I was never told there would only be one delivery, that I wouldnt even get a note when they stopped by, or that I could call to ask for next day delivery. I was told "you never told us you wanted to know". IF I HAD KNOWN, I WOLDNT HAVE TO ASK!!!!! Seriously, worst service EVER.Date of experience: March 23, 2012

Name: Lud Duch
Review: Fast delivery NJ to Montreal!!!Ordered a Desktop from newegg.ca on monday. delivery came from New Jersey. Receive my Desktop in East Montreal on thursday. 4 days for ground delivery. No extra cost for taxe or anything. Good work on the road but the customer service that i called on monday told me that i cant track until friday...i'm lucky that i have a free week or i'll miss the delivery.Date of experience: March 23, 2012

Name: Tyler Bauder
Review: Never had any issuei don't understand why theirs so much hate. I have shipped and received well over 200 shipments with Purolator and not once had any issues. The drivers are nice and polite. I have had a few times when i called them and asked for a address change or a missed delivery so they came back. My driver is nice shes talkative and always polite. The phone service is def outsourced and that can be a little frustrating, however i rarely need to use it. Also the speed is almost always at the bottom end of my time line (5-10 days comes at 5 days.) overall Very pleased and will always choose them over any optionDate of experience: March 16, 2012

Name: LF
Review: DIDN'T EVEN ATTEMPT TO DELIVER...AND THEN CAME BACK AND THREW A SLIP IN MY MAILBOX DATED 3 DAYS EARLIER!Thursday, February 23, 2012:Purolator arrived at my home, but no one answered and left the slip adhered to my screen door.  I picked up the package, but it was only for one of two packages that I was expecting.  The second package had not yet been delivered.  Friday, February 24, 2012:  I work from home and no package arrived.  I left the front door open because I was expecting the 2nd package to be delivered that day.  Nothing in the mailbox, nothing on the door.  Saturday, February 25, 2012: I received a phone call on my cell around 1030am saying I have a package that needed to be picked up at same location.  Again, I checked the mailbox to see if I had missed something...empty. Monday, Febrary 27, 2012:  I found a slip inside my mailbox dated for February 24, 2012.   ....but...i guess they did deliver ONE of the two packages.Date of experience: February 28, 2012

Name: Joanne
Review: NEVER USE PUROLATOR IN CANADAI called to get a quote, after taking about 20 mins, finally booked for next day delivery...they quoted an amount "16.37."  THis is when i asked who and how much should i make the cheque out for.  Then the next day JOhn , next rep had absolutely no clue....he was then saying they pay at pick up, i said i am paying for everything, he insisted that hey have to pay something at pick up, and i pay remaining...lol...what a joke....ended up asking for supervisor, who i said , listen i only want to pay for our original contract,  i should not be held responsible to untrained, unprof. employees...then ....i asked for a manager, who then MACENROLL...came on.....who could hardly speak english.....kept saying no amount is 18 AND 30..SO I SAID U MEAN 18.30...NO 18 AND 30...U MEAN 18 AND 30 DOLLARS?  LOL........BELIEVE IT OR NOT HE MEANT 18 DOLLARS AND 30 CENTS.....BUT NOT ONCE DID HE SAY THAT....THAT ON TOP OF THE ORIGINAL LADY QUOTING ME SOMETHING THAT WAS NOT RIGHT....  WEB TAB WORDS:  NEVER USE THIS PUROLATOR COMPANY....WORST COURIER EVER IS PUROLATOR, WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IS PUROLATOR. PUROLATOR BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE,PUROLATOR BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE,Date of experience: February 25, 2012

Name: amy
Review: Purolator is a joke!Purolator is a huge joke. I have had to use this shipper several times and each and every time it turns into a huge inconvenience.  First off their shipment tracking online or by phone sucks. All it ever says is picked up by purolator. No information updates ever making it difficult to arrange for me to be home for delivery which brings me to my second issue.  When the  info did update it was wrong. Several times I have left work or missed it to be at home to meet my package and of course. No delivery. I phoned there today and when finally was able to speak to someone he was a huge dink. Customer service gets 0 stars as far as I'm concerned. People at depot not much friendlier. My third and final issue is this. We live about an hour and a half from a city. I have had more than once only one delivery attempt if I happened to not be home for delivery. There has never ever been a second attempt made. This makes this interesting when working shift work and having to arrange a 3 hour round trip drive into e city because they won't try a second attempt. I will not ever by choice choose to use purolator or recommend them. Terrible.Date of experience: February 16, 2012

Name: Jason
Review: Avoid Like the PlageEvery time I get shipping with purolator my package is either not delivery is not attempted but they say they did, it is lost, or sent to the wrong house.  Most recently I bought a new monitor from New Egg,  Great online store only problem is the free shipping option is purolator.  My monitor qualified for a mail in rebate but I have to take the rebate sticker off the box and put it on the rebate form.  purolator put a delivery attempt sticker over the rebate sticker so now I can not get my rebate.  If I could give negative rating I would.  Pay the extra for FedEx they don't mess up. (At lest in Saskatoon they are really good).  purolator is a disaster on wheels literally.Date of experience: February 05, 2012

Name: Rylee Ann
Review: Not that bad...I've ordered 2 things from F21 canada using purolator... personally i'd prefer to use canada post despite no tracking, but F21 uses purolator. the first time it arrived while i was at home, not very quickly (10 days, but it was 5-10 day shipping) i signed and got my package of goodies. second time, not as simple, everyone was away at work at the time (save for the dog) and they left a slip with the adress of a place to pick it up in town but still fairly out of the way (in the industrial park next to a carpet seller.) after getting driven out there, there were 3 or 4 people in that day, the place was very shabby, with outdated posters on the walls, and one guy with a beard and a ponytail (though dont be too alarmed, theyre relatively common here.) waiting on the line single-handedly. it was a long wait because the lady ahead of us was shipping a package to india with purolator.. but we gave the slip and we got our package.  oh, and that package came VERY fast. like, 2 days with the 5-10 days shipping option. no clue why.  honestly, its not as terrible as reviews make it out to be.Date of experience: January 24, 2012

Name: Pistol Pete
Review: I wish I could give less than one starPurolator is THE worst "delivery" company out there. I hesitate to use the word delivery, because they are essentially an inter-warehouse shipping company, and so are about as convenient as using VIA rail to get a parcel to my doorstep. They make ONE attempt at delivery (compared to 3 for FedEx and UPS) and in many or most cases the date of delivery is unpredictable. What is the chance the average joe with a job is going to be home at 1:30pm on a random weekday? Your packege then it goes to the warehouse, which is typically out of the way. Compare this to USPS/Canada Post, with post offices in almost every neighbourhood. So I call in a favour to get a lift to the warehouse and find the time between work-- and am confronted with a 15-person lineup and only one employee. Seeing as purolator doesn't actually make many deliveries, you would think they could amp up their warehouse staffing. 45 minutes later I get my package. Next time, postal service will be the first choice, then UPS/FedEx/DHL/any other company.  I"d rather not ship then go with Purolator.Date of experience: January 19, 2012

Name: terry
Review: Terrible!!!AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!( If you can!) I didn’t choose this company. I live in a small building containing 10 units. It is very easy, at the front door, you have the list of the units in numerical order and the name of the occupant, for example: 1-John Smith, 2-Robert  Johnson,… Beside each name/number, there is a buzzer.Very simple, easy and convenient for visitors or for delivery companies, I had lots of packages delivered for the 10 years I’ve been at that address and never a problem.   I had electronics supposed to be delivered to me by Purolator today, on Friday the 30th of December.I had a tracking number, when I checked it online on the 29th, it said : 2011/12/29	14:41	Shipment In Transit	2011/12/29	14:40	Picked up by Purolator	I called them and they told me it would be for sure delivered on the next day.So I checked the next day (today then) at around 11:30 and it said : 2011/12/30	11:10	On vehicle for delivery	2011/12/30	03:24	Shipment In Transit	   I was excited, according to that I expected to receive the parcel in the next hour or so. I had to leave home but my wife could stay and wait for the buzzer. When I came back at 3pm, I was surprised , there was no parcel at home, my wife had not gotten any buzz or news. There wasn’t any notice on the front door either. Unfortunately , at that time we started to have a power outage in the neighbourhood, so I couldn’t check the online tracking system. I called Purolator, asking them to tell the driver that the buzzer wouldn’t work and that he should call my phone instead but I was told that drivers don’t carry cell phones (?!?)Also they couldn’t check my status because my name was not enough, they needed my tracking number, which I could not access because I had no power… So I couldn’t put a note on the front door either, therefore I waited more than hours downstairs for the driver’s  arrival . He never came. When the power was restored, I checked the tracking system, and it said : 2011/12/30	14:08	Scheduled Delivery Appointment Required Not sure about what it meant, I called Purolator and I was told that the driver chose not to deliver the item because he didn’t see a code on his papers for the buzzer! Of course, there is no code, I cannot invent one, it is much easier the way it is than with a buzzer, a 5 years old kid can figure it out! He had my name , address and apartment number, that is all he needed. But he decided not to buzz!!!He just went back to his truck and left!!!  When you call Purolator, they have a message playing, pretending that they can deliver on Saturdays. Of course, I asked for that service and they could offer it only if I paid 25 more dollars. I refused and asked to talk to a manager to try and get it for free. What kind of a tactic is that to not deliver an item on a Friday when it should be so that they can get 25 dollars more for delivering it the next day???Anyway,  as angry as I was,I talked to a manager (Darryl Redmond in Moncton), got the name of the route of the driver (7W2) but I couldn’t get to have the parcel delivered on the next day without paying. I refused to pay, so the package will be delivered 5 days later, on Tuesday the 3rd of January, as they don’t work on the 2nd of January. We are very upset. What guarantee do we have that the next driver is going to be more professional than the one we had today? Tuesday’s delivery is if everything goes very well I guess, but it could go on forever if Purolator does not improve its overall system , the communication with its drivers and its training/recruiting of the drivers… Next day update : How do regular customers manage do stay patient or polite with Purolator employees? I just phoned Purolator because I thought it would be better to simply go to the warehouse to get the package since your drivers are so incompetent ( for reminder, the driver supposed to deliver the package decided not to do it because he wanted a code to enter a small building when all he needed was to push the button next to my name as in any regular house).Of course, I was told that it was not possible , but also that the item woul'nt be delivered before Wednesday!!! Now I think your employees are just playing with customers, and exercice revenge with those like me who dare complaining...So childish and unprofessional, shame on your company!!!Of course, nothing I can do but I'll be so careful to spread anyone not to ever take their business to Purolator!!!Date of experience: December 31, 2011

Name: Anja
Review: worst company evera package that is sent out from a toronto company to a toronto residence is taking 2 weeks to be delivered when it should take max 4 days. Every time i track the package it states that a address verification is needed...when they have all the info. super annoying i've been wasting my days waiting for the package to arrive. worst service ever, and the customer reps dont know what theyre talking about one says one thing another says another.Date of experience: December 30, 2011

Name: Will
Review: Vancouver Downtown LocationI am very disappointed with the level of service with this company. I recently ordered some replacement ink for my printer from HP. The package arrived when I was home but I could not go out immediately. I ran out as fast as I could to meet the Purolator delivery person, by the time I got out here was gone! it wasn't event a minute. So I get a call from him later on in the day but I could not take the call immediately. I call him back a few hours later and no one picks up! I try calling again the next couple of days and to my surprise no response! So a week later, I go the the pick up center in downtown Vancouver to see if I could pickup my package! I didn't have my tracking number but I gave them my last name and some other info, they told me there was no such package with my name! I asked them if they could pass me a number to whom I could contact to get the tracking number, BUT as incompetent as the customer service representatives there, they didn't have a number to give me. Instead of going to Purolator for help, I went to Hp. I then found the tracking number and I called Purolator to see if I could pick up the package today. After I called them they told me that the package has been sent back to HP because they only hold packages for 5 days. Excuse my language but ...WTF, at no time was I given indication of that.  I needed that ink as I will be doing a lot of printing this semester. Now I will have to tell HP to send the package again and this fiasco will probably happen all over again! I an very disapointed to say the least! This could of all been avoided if the person with the package waited an extra 30 seconds. Some potential improvements for Purolator:- The delivery person should wait a little longer and if the receiver is not there they should post a message with pickup information with certain deadlines!- provide tracking and pickup information at the door for those who cannot pickup their package immediately. (inform them that their package will be shipped back to the sender in 5 business days if the package is not picked up!)- customer service should spend a little more time explaining things to people. they lack poise in this area and it shows for people that don't use their services often. Purolator, you should fire your operations consultants, seeking as they are not able to mitigate these issues!Date of experience: June 29, 2011

Name: Aaron
Review: Can't get much better.My mother is a Nurse, so is my cousin and my sister in law. They all get me to order scrubs and different things they need for work for them online. They usually use three different websites, two offer Purolator, UPS, DHL or FedEx and one offers Purolator, Parcel Force or DHL. Needless to say I have tried all of the shipping companies and the best 3 are Purolator, UPS and FedEx. I must say Purolator may not be as quick as UPS or FedEx, but the package always looks nice upon arrival.Date of experience: March 07, 2011

Name: jixi
Review: Purolator never deliver the package and they can't find it at allPurolator is a cheater service company.Date of experience: March 05, 2011

Name: sandy
Review: Purolator sucks BIG TIME!!!I had to wait for freaking 2 week for my 2 parcels I called customer service two time they always end up taking my address and everything and tells me they are going to send it to me tomorrow but end up me staying whole day waiting for my parcel and non of them show up like WTH !!you guys need to take a look at your service !!!  It sucks BIG TIME!!! That customer service guy( name is Jason something ?)  is stupid as hell!!..Both the day he acts like nothing happened and takes my address and next day same thing happens !! He doesn't do this job properly how come he is even a customer service representative!!!!!!!!!!!Date of experience: January 18, 2011

Name: Dmitri
Review: Consistently Unacceptable Level of Service!Multiple and multiple accounts of Purolator not delivering parcels! Purolator did not call my cell as instructed, did not bother going in thebuilding even though my superintendent testifies he let the delivery personin the building. My wife and I were home all the time caring for our newborn baby. There was no paper notice left in the mail box either. I onlyreceived an automated call requiring me to pick up my parcel from awarehouse. Ultimately, instead of spending my time off work by assisting my wife with a few-days-old baby, I had to drive around town and collect my parcel from the Purolator warehouse. Purolator has consistently not delivered the parcels to my home, instead,telling me to pick the parcels from their warehouse. This happnens everysingle time I expect a message from Purolator. The delivery persons ignore the notes I left on the file inregards to the phone numbers to call and other delivery instructions.Purolator's understanding of delivery is to collect the money for thedelivery service and then simply make the goods available for pick up at a remote location. What an interesting business model! Rip off! My experiences with Purolator over the last years have been horrible,unfortunately, can't opt for another delivery method with some of my shippers. Purolator is a warehouse, not a courier service and I will try to avoid dealing with Purolator in the future whenever possible. One week after I filed the above feedback with Purolator, they have done it again! Awful company! Shippers be aware that your clients on receiving end are not happy. Please choose another delivery company that actually delivers the goods.Date of experience: December 24, 2010

Name: Amy
Review: I TRULY DEEPLY HATE PUROLATOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!This is my first time in 30 years ever signing up for an account just to complain about a COMPANY!I live in TORONTO and i have been waiting for a shipment from TORONTO for 3 weeks! 1) first attempt they tried to deliver my package, but for some reason it ended up back at the depot. 2) purolator called to reschedule a re-delivery. THEY NEVER CAME. 3) today they were supposed to come, once again my package ended up back to the DEPOT. I am really fed up. I tried calling every number, customer service, sales line to reach them but it always says UNAVAILABLE!!!!! but they are able to reach me every time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! SOOO MADDDDDDDDDDDD!Date of experience: June 08, 2010

Name: C
Review: 2/10 They keep screwing up.Purolator is extremely disappointing. Normally, I wouldn't write any review for any complany, good or bad. But company is huge, they have to be more strict with their workers. I've had on 4-5 occassions a "address correction required" which is apparently supposed to mean that the driver came to the door and it was the wrong house. They then send the package to the warehouse for pickup, even though someone was home when they "came to the door"; this is another way of them saying, my shift is done for the day, i'm not going to bother with the rest of the packages. By the way, purolator's bourndaries for Depots are very messed up. I have to drive 20-25 minutes north for pickup, when there is a purolator 5 minutes south of me. BUT, what is worse, the homes that are north of me go to the depot south of me, when they should be going north and i should be going south. No sense in this company. BUT, i have to say, their customer service reps on the phone are nice (if you can reach one!), which is why i gave a 2, otherwise, it would be a zero. i pay for a delivery and have to go pick it, what a useless company. UPS has never had a problem coming to my door. I will purolator straightened up and treated it's customers better. drivers should be reprimanded for not doing their job properly. if their shift is over, another driver should take the package and drive it would the same day. unbelieveable.Date of experience: February 02, 2010

Name: Melanie
Review: No notice before returning to senderI ordered something and it was sent with Purolator.  Purolator returned it to the sender telling them that they could not find my address.  They had my correct address.  When I phoned Purolator to find out what the problem was, they claimed they did deliver it but no one was home.  I never received notice that they came to my home.  There was no phone call made to me, no note left on my door.  NOTHING before they simply returned it to the sender.  This company is completely UNRELIABLE, LAZY, and LIARS.  They don't even deserve one star.Date of experience: September 21, 2009

Name: Billy Bob Butterball
Review: No notice of package at all. Suddenly Purolator decided that I "refused" my packageCompared to UPS and Fedex which are U.S. owned companies, Purolator and Canada Post suck big big time. In the case of Purolator, I received no notice whatsoever. I proactively tracked my package, it showed in their website that I "refused" my package which will be returned to sender. They said they did not have my buzz number, even though my name is clearly listed at the apartment front lobby. Excuse me? How do you Canadians learn to make decisions for your customers, EH??? Why are you so lazy? You could have given me a handwritten note. Plus, my home phone is listed on the package, you could have called me?!? Do you seriously expect me to just wait all f**** day for you to deliver???  Just like that? Return to sender? Without even letting me know I got package? Learn some basic business work processes, a-holes!!!  If other shipping companies have systems in place to notify customers of package, why can't Purolator have similar system? Tell me how you f*** piece of s*** can compete internationally?  Purolator can rest easy now because of lack of competition in Canada. Canada is a f**** communist country anyway ... everything is monopoly. Do you, for once, think about your customers? Common courtesies? EH??? Common sense???  Have a great life a-holes!Date of experience: January 07, 2009

Name: Carlos Carvalho
Review: Puro-late packets, always delayed, always missed, no deliver around the time they update the status.I am tired of getting packets delivered by this company, getting a message on their web site saying "missed delivered" when there was NO delivery attempt. I work from home, I sit facing my building entrance and there was NO Puro-late truck within hours form the moment they updated the status on their website. I don't recommend.Date of experience: July 05, 2023

Name: NA
Review: I just want to give negative starI am extremely dissatisfied with the services provided by this company and would rate them poorly. The behavior of their drivers is consistently rude, often leaving as soon as they hear someone approaching the door. It seems they have no interest in fulfilling their duty to deliver packages and have even suggested that I retrieve my own items from their truck. Such a lack of commitment is unacceptable for a delivery service. I strongly advise against using this company's services. It is disheartening that a significant portion, 90%, of this company is owned by Canada Post. This reflects poorly on Canada as a whole. It would be in everyone's best interest to reconsider its operations and not waste taxpayers' hard-earned money. The quality of service provided is far below what Canadians deserve.Date of experience: May 01, 2023

Name: Érica van Hellsing
Review: Only deliver when ou are at workOnly deliver when ou are at work, when (of course) ou are not home, they leave you parcel to some shop of their choice ... which opens only when ou are at work !They may be good with business deliveries, but the are awaful with normal peopleDate of experience: January 09, 2023

Name: Prachi P
Review: Most unreliable delivery serviceWaiting for delivery at home for entire but the delivery person did not call. Without any attempt to deliver, it was update as receiver not available.Called three times, escalated the issue but still no action and no updates at the end of the day for delivery. I have no clue when I will get my parcel. On their website they promise one day delivery. Do not charge customers if you cannot keep your promises. Most unreliable delivery service.Date of experience: June 29, 2023

Name: Silvana Mascitelli
Review: Scored a 1 for all the good employees…Scored a 1 for all the good employees who still have a work ethic that are unfortunately stuck working alongside the rest of this disgraceful team. This delivery service has gone down the tubes over the past couple years. The absolute worst.Date of experience: June 30, 2023

Name: erwin pondevida
Review: Bad delivery habit …Waiting for delivery but the delivery person did not call. The number was provided. The provided number was correct since they sent message after 5 pm to instead pick the item. No fail delivery slip left to inform us what to go next. For me, will not do business with Purolator.Date of experience: June 27, 2023

Name: Chris Chebry
Review: SCAM TAXATION CHARGESNo matter how many times I write to Purolator regarding incorrect tax billings, they DO NOT LISTEN!!!  They charge an Alberta based company HST?!  No matter where I send my products, even within Alberta, they charge HST?!  Alberta DOES NOT HAVE HST stop charging me 13% tax on my invoices!  I have contacted Purolator three times in this regard, so their response is useless.  I have emailed and talked to a customer service rep on the phone ..... they continue to charge HST.Date of experience: May 31, 2023

Name: anees jameel
Review: Bad company my package moss be arrive…Bad company my package moss be arrive yesterday, but nothing is coming. I call the customer service I hold in the line 1 hour. No body answer me. I advise people not to deal with themDate of experience: June 30, 2023

Name: Maqsood Syed
Review: Pathetic service. Never againThe package was returned and the reason stated was “No buzz code”. They probably don’t know that something as simple as a phone call works. All the driver had to do was give a ring to ask for the buzz code, but no. They actually didn’t even attempt the delivery, because the main door was open all day that day because of some maintenance and it didn’t even need a buzz code. When I checked with the customer care agent, they updated the buzz code and said it would take 3 business days for it to be updated. Also, i was told their drivers don’t have phone. And they expected me to believe it. Just Purolator things. Never ever use their services again.Date of experience: June 28, 2023

Name: James McCleave
Review: Very Very Poor Service & DeliveryIf I could pick no stars that would be it. You claim I couldn't be reached to deliver my parcel (ink) from Epson. Shouldn't be any need, address & phone number on order. Various excuses on tracking number over a 2 week period. Now want me to pick up.Date of experience: June 28, 2023

Name: Ohemaa Amponsah
Review: terrible delivery companyterrible delivery company! received an email that package was unable to deliver (the driver did not even attempt to contact me my buzzing my apartment number) and when i called customer support, and waited 30mins, KIM (the agent) hanged up on meDate of experience: June 28, 2023

Name: Julia Jones
Review: Waiting for a replacenment from Shaw a…Waiting for a replacenment from Shaw a modum. Supposed to be delivered Monday,tracking number didnt work,finally wednesday it worked,parcel delivered Tuesday..no sign of it. Hate their service,spent hours searching for my parcels,even found one THROWN AT  BURNT OUT HOUSE DOWN THE ROAD.Date of experience: June 20, 2023

Name: Kayli Mejia
Review: Do not use this company they will lose your packageThey refused to deliver my large package for 2 weeks trying to get me to pick it up they then lost it claiming someone picked it up with valid ID when that is impossible. Do not use this company they will lose your package then tell you theres nothing they can do.Date of experience: June 23, 2023

Name: Joseph
Review: WORST COURIER SERVICE EVERAll my experiences with this courier service has been nothing but terrible..From fake delivery attempt to bad customer service.. They will never call or message you to notify you that they will be coming to deliver your package, then you will get a meaage to come over to their office for pickup (For God sake I paid for delivery).. One of their drivers once told me once that they don't make any delivery attempt once you get a message of failed delivery attempts.. This company shouldn't be in business..Date of experience: June 06, 2023

Name: D D
Review: Way to go Purolator!Ran into the Purolator driver today and he helped me out with a no signature sticker for my deliveries. That was really cool of him as he mentioned he hated leaving the stickers on my door. I appreciated what he had to say and made things positive for me today. Again I still think Purolator needs to change their policy on signatures all the time for deliveries and do not hold the driver responsible for that. Never did as I know it comes from the top. Anyway,Thanks to the driver on making my experience positive today.Date of experience: June 19, 2023

Name: Phoebe Smith
Review: If I could give this company 0 stars I…If I could give this company 0 stars I would it. Is the worst possible shipping company in the world? I have a fairly long driveway which I would like to say. Every other shipping company is able to navigate however purelator finds it better to leave my parcels in the dirt on the side of the road nowhere. Near my property. When I said I would like to actually receive my parcels so could they hold them at the access point? They then give me no notification of the parcel being held and if I do not pick it up within 5 days they send it back have never had. A good experience to this day my parcels are either lost stolen or left in the dirt.Date of experience: June 19, 2023

Name: Yuri Kytsenko
Review: Not delivered package after double delaysPaid $2 for each of 10 km of express delivery, Distance 475km, promised time- within 24 hours. Receiver all time stayed at home but after 44 hours driver has not delivered package, not left any message,  but reported absence of receiver.  There is a Purolator's outlet in delivery town but instead of leaving package there I received a note in tracking: Wed. June 21, 2023 - 2:05 p.m. CRANBROOK, BC (108 KM from RECEIVER!) Available for pickup for 5 business days from arrival date at the counter. According to Purolator's request for NOT delivered package people need to drive 216 km to pick up their EXPRESS package. No response to my complains Case 200912981, no apology, normal practice for Purolator. After several calls to Purolator, package was left in town delivery outlet to pick up by senior receiverDate of experience: June 18, 2023

Name: Merrily MacIntosh
Review: WorstWorst, worst, worst courier company EVER!!! I have had nothing but problems with this ridiculous company. They take packages Willy-Nilly to places nowhere near where they say they’ve dropped it off for pick up …beyond stupid! And, absolutely impossible to get an actual human on a chat or the phone. They need to be put out of business . The BBB is my next step.Date of experience: June 21, 2023

Name: Benjamin Wright
Review: Absolutely horrific serviceAbsolutely horrific service, they promise to deliver on a date, they don't deliver on a date, they blame you, then tell you to be home, take the day off, its coming that day, it doesnt come that day, this process repeats, and nobody cares about the time you are wasting of your clients. Nobody calls, nobody cares, and the product still isnt delivered, at this time, I have wasted 3 full days at home on days I was told it was coming, and nobody seem to give a crap. How is Purolator still in business with this level of service.Date of experience: June 19, 2023

Name: Gordon
Review: ABYSMALPurolator has consistently failed to deliver on time. Complaints fall on deaf ears. Offer and charge for express service (early AM delivery) to areas that THEY DON'T DELIVER TO, only to hand off to a local carrier without daily service. Latest issue - Early AM delivery from Mississauga to Toronto. End of the day, and it's not delivered. Tracking is useless. Virtual assistant is worse. Phone call isn't answered. Requested a call back which hasn't happened. This is the last straw. I will not pay the invoice, and I've instructed my staff to use ANY courier but Purolator in the future.Date of experience: June 15, 2023
